title: There are plenty street food.who gives fresh food as per your choice. Pizza/Burger is available every where should enjoy all tha
text:
No breakfast available inspite of ready to pay.even Dinner at night whole restaurant no one there no staff nor any one to attend. At midlanding Bar was open with limited food..gone 30mnts walk at 9.30 night for food.its whole road no one there.i & my daughter walked fast to have food since .aware no breakfast will get..
Just wondering such big brand does not have basic hospitality facility.only Reception staff are good 5 star to them.
My $200 deposite- Refundable no receipt given. So while checking in money given but no record I have checked out 1 week back.
We appraise this brand.but be clear on all this.

title: Nice option for downtown Manhattan. New hotel close to subway stations and tourist attractions.
text:
New hotel, very well maintained.
Professional and friendly staff.
Good value for your money.
Small fitness center but it has what you need for a short (3-4 days) stay.
Laundry on the basement works fine and is a nice option for a budget trip and families.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: Being this close to Battery Park, 9/11 Memorial and able to catch the Big Bus Tour was amazing.  The Pranza eatery more than made up for the fact that the restaurant was out of service at the hotel.  And so many places to eat and bars within walking distance.  The staff was so helpful and we really enjoyed our stay!

title: Perfectly Serviceable Hotel
text: This is a perfectly serviceable hotel. Nothing to write home about. The room was clean, however the rooms could use a refresh. I found it very surprising that the rooms do not have a safe. The staff were all really great. Pleasant stay, and pleasant staff.

title: Anniversary Night
text: I mentioned to Tyra and Ameena that my wife and I are celebrating 15 years and they were so excited for us, I thought they were just being the typical awesome Hilton hosts. But to my surprise, these two had placed a small yummy cake, Champaign, 12 dozen roses and fake rose pedals throughout the room when we returned from dinner. My wife and I had such a blessed night.  Thank you Trya and Ameena, your sweet gesture really helped make our night special. Kira plans to bring these roses back to Colorado. :-)  I think she likes walking around with them. Great Location!!!

title: "Excelente"
text: Muy bien ubicado, linda vista, lindos cuartos, súper amables todos lo que no es tan común en NY!, nos guardaron las maletas luego del check out, Rafeel y todos muy atentos siempre. Regresaría siempre a este lugar. Estación del metro cerca, farmacia cerca, barrio tranquilo y limpio.

title: 5 star experience!
text: Our 3 night stay couldn’t have been better! Friendly customer service, great location, and an overall pleasant ambiance. Martin and Ann were really the icing on the cake, they answered all our questions and were very accommodating. Our NY experience was amazing and a big part of that is thanks to Hilton Garden Inn and the staff :)

title: Excelente estancia.
text: El servicio del hotel es excelente. Llegué antes del check in y pregunté si me podían guardar mi equipaje, y con mucho gusto Martín nos ayudó, además de que nos proporcionó un mapa de la ciudad para ubicarnos.

title: Nuestro experiencia en una noche…
text: Aunque sólo estuve una noche en el hotel, la experiencia fue buena, es un lugar lindo y limpio, lo que se valora mucho. Mención especial para Martín Hernández quien nos atendió con mucha simpatía y nos facilitó la comunicación, lo que se agradece mucho cuando uno no domina el idioma…

title: super one night stay
text:
Had a quick stopover in NYC back in April and chose this hotel due to the price, an absolute bargain was had. quick check in, room was a good size and spotless too. comfy bed and no signs of wear anywhere, looked brand new.

didn't have time for breakfast in the morning so cant comment here.

not too far from the subway, south ferry is 2 minutes walk away.

Will not hesitate when heading back to NYC to look at booking here first as its a great place to set up base with amazing value to be had.

highly recommended

title: מלון מושלם פשוט מושלם !!!
text:
ביקרתי בניו יורק למשך 8 ימים כשאר את כל שמונת הימים ביליתי במלון. המלון נמצא במיקום מצוין מסביבו מלא מלא תחנות סאבווי. הוא ממש קרוב לשור הזועם..לפורט ולברודווי. החדר היה ממש ממש נקי וזמין מיד כשהגעתי. אפילו נתנו לי לעשות צ'ק אין מוקדם יותר. צוות המלון ממש ממש נחמד בייחוד מארק ואמינה שפשוט היו סופר נחמדים ועזרו לי בכל. מארק מנהל הקבלה בחור מדהים וחייכן ותמיד זמין לשאלות.
החדר נקי, יש טלויזיה כספת ומקרר..וכמובן שמים חמים תמיד.
ממליץ בחום לקחת את המלון הזה!!!
מעיין.

title: Mom and daughter trip to NYC
text:
Really liked this hotel! Close to the 4&R trains and ferry to Ellis Island. We also enjoyed the area of stone street. Leo’s Bagels is a must! It’s the worth the wait in the line! 
Enjoyed the friendliness of the staff. Especially Martin Jaquana and Machael. Very accommodating especially being able to leave our bags before we could get our room so we could do some sightseeing!

title: Buena atención
text: El hotel tiene muy buena ubicación e instalaciones, es un bonito barrio, muy fácil movilizarse y estamos muy agradecidos del trato recibido, personal muy atento sobretodo Martín, Jaquana and Amina, muy amables.

title: Perfect for overnight stay Downtown
text: Location was across from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal. Close to Battery Park/Wall St. Beautiful view of NY Harbor. Room was clean, beds very comfortable. Staff was professional and courteous. Only complaints- the 2 hookers in the entrance upon arrival; and the noise from people in the hallway after midnight. Hookers were visible to staff, so not sure why they weren't asked to move along;  I did not report the noise. All that aside, I would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Recently, five of us descended on the Hilton Garden Inn, NYC Financial Center, on Water St. in Lower Manhattan.  Two of us were coming from Cleveland and the other three from San Diego.  We arrived on June 22nd.  We were all first timers to New York City and were really looking forward to this trip.  We had three criteria that we expected from our hotel: cleanliness, location, and excellent customer service.  The Hilton Garden Inn did not let us down.  The housekeeping staff did an outstanding job of keeping our rooms clean and responded to any needs we had quickly.  The location was fantastic.  A short walk to the waterfront, several excellent restaurants, and the subway.  But, by far and away it was the customer service that went above and beyond.  Always a warm greeting, including a smile and eye contact, and most importantly remembering we were new to this beautiful city. The front desk staff never failed to ask us what we saw, how our day had gone, and what were our plans for the next day.  You may be wondering why, of the three criteria by which we rated our stay, customer service would rise to the top. That is because three of the five of us have over a cumulative 50 years working for Nordstrom, the major U.S. retailer well known for its exceptional customer service.  As a result, customer service holds a special place in our hearts and our expectations.  We especially want to thank the following people: Jaquanna, Ameena, Martin, and Rafael for the level of customer service they delivered and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a trip to NYC.

title: Just below the standard 4.5 rating. Roomy for a NYC hotel IMO, but perhaps some post-pandemic things to work on.
text:
So from my review of another NYC hotel, I wanted to try out another place to see how things compared. Didn't know that next time would be several years and a pandemic later.

This Hilton Garden Inn was located in a fairly convenient location relative to getting around the city. You are near several different Subway Lines through the South Ferry/Whitehall St Stations (1, R, W), Bowling Green (4, 5), and if you're willing to take a slightly longer walk, through the Broad St (J) and the Wall/William St Station (2, 3).

It's also near a masseuse that I highly recommended in a review I posted just a little while back - which is a plus to unwind all those tight muscles from walking around all day.

Back to the hotel, I had taken a red-eye flight and arrived at the hotel an early Friday morning. The very friendly lady at the front desk confirmed my request for an early check-in, which allowed me to shower off the tiredness of traveling.

You are given a choice of a City or Water View for a room as an option. I thought that a Water View would not only be a nice view to have in the nighttime, but also some privacy from the high-rises that pepper the city landscape. I even chose a very high floor to increase those chances.

But when I orientated the room to Google Maps before arriving, it seemed less likely that would be the case. And in fact when I got to my room, there was indeed a view of the water, but also of an office building right across from me. So while it was not wrong that I got a water view, I would say that I was disappointed in the water view I did get - so I personally wouldn't waste the time spending more for a choice of view unless you don't mind it somewhat being obstructed by a building.

But the room itself was spacious. Much more spacious than the room I got from the other hotel. It had a normal hallway opening to a room much like any other room I would get in a HGI elsewhere. Ample space to get around, the same comfortable bed, a sliding door into the bathroom (which seems to be the thing nowadays), and a proper hot shower available to you. And there were many outlets (though the bedside ones were a bit loose when plugging things in - don't know if that was a feature or something that needs to be fixed.

The only real gripe I had was with the carpet. Wearing my personal travel hotel slippers, I noticed that (a) there appeared to be an area that was a bit sticky and also noticed a stain or two, and (b) a bobby pin that was against the wall to the bathroom. These weren't enough to warrant pointing it out immediately to the staff who might have someone clean the room, and I particularly didn't really care enough to consider asking for a different room.

I also figured if housekeeping staff is a bit shorthanded and/or like other hotels don't clean unless asked to or after the customers leave, that that extra day or two of not being able to do maintenance probably makes it harder to get rid of those things. I'd probably say that to counter that to have the carpet steam-cleaned regularly. Perhaps they might already do that and I just caught the tail end of the period. Again, I wouldn't consider it overly dirty or anything, but at the same time something that should be noted for all rooms going forward.

I did not get their breakfast, but I also believe they were having some work being done and the restaurant being closed, but since I wasn't getting breakfast anyways (I wanted to have Dunkin since it's not in my area) I didn't actually catch all of what was said to me.

Overall, it was still a good stay, again would probably recommend deep cleaning the carpet regularly (if they don't already). Would definitely give the hotel another stay. Again, not enough issues to give it a 4 (which as mentioned is more punishing on this scale), but would put it on the lower side of the 4's though if the carpet thing is resolved it would be the normal 4.5 every other hotels have received.

title: Great location in FiDi
text:
This  hotel is in a prime location in lower Manhattan FiDi. We only stayed 1 night and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to keep our luggage at the hotel after we checked out, until we were ready to leave the city. In walking distance to so many great restaurants and attractions!
Our room had a nice view of the city and the river by the ferry dock.  Room and bathroom is definitely on the smaller side, but was fine. My only complaint was our room was clean, but needed a little TLC. Shower curtain was stained, sink didn’t drain, light bulbs out around the mirror, some tiles missing around the floor. Otherwise, beds were comfortable and our room was quiet!
I would stay here again.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
My husband and I had a wonderful weeklong stay here earlier this month. This was my 13th trip to NYC.
The hotel was very clean and the beds were comfortable.
The entire staff was friendly and kind.
There were lots of good places to eat nearby, especially on the weekdays.
We will stay here again if we want to be in lower Manhattan in the future.

title: Family Trip to NYC
text:
This was the first stop of a 14 day East Coast trip for my family (parents, 2 boys 13 and 9). We stayed there five nights. The location was great! Close to three different subway stations and a short walk to Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty tour. My older son especially liked being able to walk to Starbucks every morning in the Staten Island ferry station.

We got to our hotel around 7pm after a long flight and subway trip to the hotel from JFK. Check in was a breeze, but they charged me double for one of my rooms. Good thing I noticed while I was there. Our adjoining rooms were on the 18th floor with a nice view of the water.

We didn’t take advantage of anything else the hotel had except to grab some cookies from the convenience store and charge it to our room. The rooms were nice and we had housekeeping everyday. Our floor was surprisingly very quiet—we never hear anyone the whole time!

Water pressure was very weak and the bathroom door was a barn door that didn’t lock and had gaps where you could see in.

Would definitely recommend to all kinds of travelers. And a great rate, too!

title: Great stay, recommended
text: Great stay at the Hilton Garden inn. Stayed two nights. Had a room on the 26th floor, the view was mostly of buildings. Clean and Quiet room, decent space, great location and great staff. Thanks to Ami, Martin, Michael, and the rest of the staff.

title: Excellent room with fantastic view
text: Recently, my wife and I stayed at the Garden Inn (6 Water st.) NYC. We had the top floor with the river view. Staff was extremely friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The resort is just blocks from the financial district and Battery Park. I recommend parking when you book. Parking typically runs $52.00 pr. Day - oversized expect to pay $62.00 pr. Day it is recommended to park and leave your vehicle till your visit is done. Easy transportation to tourists destinations by bus, cab, subway, Uber and citybike. We chose the bus. The room had a very good view of the river.

title: Perfect Location  with amazing staff
text: I would like to thank you for the great service and the perfect care during our ten-day stay in your hotel.  from the first minute it was a pleasant feeling to be here.  the most contact we had with the amazing Mister Marc Dacres, Mrs. Jaquana, Mr. Imram,  Mr. Steven Castro,  and and alI the other ones who offered such perfect wellfeeling service incl. rooms service. can only say, congratulations that you have such employees.

title: Be Aware!!
text:
- Lobby, although multi-ethnicity loves whites only.
- Blacks and Browns could wind up in poorly serviced rooms with malfunctioning 
  units: leaky toilets, improperly seated toilets that rock and make noise. 
- Printing a document from your flash drive is a NO. The front desk suggests you 
  email your document to their private email for printing.
- Mostly inefficient staff. Seem it borders on management. Servicing issues are 
  mostly delayed or get swept under the rug.
- The restrooms are located on the 3rd floor. If you really have to go after checking 
  in, with their slow elevators, you can be in for an accident.
- Small rooms.
- A sweaty laundry room.
- Misleading restaurant service as listed on the website.
- Nice location. Close to train stations etc. However, very low on the totem pole 
  when it comes to other HGI's.
- Overpriced and undermaintained.

title: Excellent établissement, tant sur la propreté, l’emplacement, l’accueil du personnel que la qualité de la literie
text: excellent séjour, établissement très bien situé, endroit calme et serein, personnel très disponible, arrangeant et sympathique (entre autre Michael à qui nous avons eu surtout contact), la propreté et le soins des chambres réguliers. Je recommande volontiers cet établissement !!

title: Hilton garden inn
text: Staff is always professional and courteous. The location is perfect for access to Ferry terminal's.And there's a nice variety of really good dining close by.When I get a chance to come back for a vacation I will be staying here. Ameena, Steven and the rest of the staff always ensure a positive stay thanks.

title: Best front desk staff
text: We primarily dealt with Michael.  He was by far the most courteous and helpful front desk staff member I've ever met.  We had an issue with the sink in one room and a mix up on the bill, but he handled both very quickly and professionally.  His restaurant recommendations were perfect, too

title: Nice stay
text: Amazing location, easy/ close access to train stations. The hotel room was nice and clean! Enough space for what we needed. Thanks to Steven and all the staff for being so helpful and attentive during our short vacation.

title: Great hotel in a perfect location!
text:
Our family stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn this past weekend to celebrate my sons birthday. The hotel is in the perfect location, right across the street from Battery Park and the Staten Island Ferry. Our room had a view of the Statue of Liberty! We were in walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge, NY Stock Exchange, and 9/11 Memorial. The room was sparkling clean with a huge tv that offered HBO and ESPN as well as many other channels.  The staff were incredibly pleasant and helpful.  Michael welcomed us early, letting us leave our bags when we arrived in the morning, and was able to get us an early check in. Steven and Latia were always offering recommendations on things to do.  Rafael our bellman was so kind and gave very specific walking directions to these out of towners learning their way around :-)
I can’t recommend this hotel enough…we will definitely be back when we visit NYC!

title: Waterfront Disappointment
text: Upon my arrival I requested extra pillows and toiletries in my room. Never got them. Once I arrived I had to wait for my room to be cleaned which was fine as I arrived 30 minutes early. However, upon check in I was not provided any water or told the amenities in the hotel which I observed was told to the other guests. The room was good as it looked over Battery Park City. A plus !! Another plus it's centrally located by trains and restaurants. However, for a clean room why was there leftover pizza and open beer in my fridge. Eww. When I finally got settled I requested a shower chair. 2 hours later as well multiple calls to the front desk and multiple visits later from the staff asking what I needed such as do I need my shower repaired, etc. I recieved the chair. :( poor customer service and communication. The view and location was great but doubtful I will stay again due to the poor customer service.

title: Dissapointed
text: The staff is wonderful; friendly and very helpful.  The hotel is clean, that is the good news.  The website states their is a restaurant on site - there is NOT.  It has been closed since 2020.  The website advertised a "water view" room. NOT.  We booked a water view room only to find out that we did not have a water view, we had a view of the building across the street.  If one stood at the window, leaned forward and peeked around the corner of the building across the street, one could see a sliver of water.  When we spoke to the desk clerk about it, his replay was, "that is a water view room"  The security lock on the door did not work, the thermostat did not work. Even after someone came to "fix them", they still did not work.  The plug for the sink did not work. We were very disappointed, the website misrepresented what the hotel had to offer.  The website was and is misleading.

title: Great views, great service
text: Our third stay and as always super. Martin and the other staff helpful and courteous. Rooms always impeccable. Water view rooms are a treat every day. Access to the subway just across Water Street. We'll be back.

title: Old dated bare bones hotel
text: The rooms looked very nice in the pictures but are old, dated, faded, and bare bones in reality. Based on the pics, I was expecting a bathroom with a tub but got one with a walk in shower without anything to keep the water in, so the bathroom would just flood after every shower. Housekeeping is only available if you request 24 hours in advance. There is no food credit or any other benefits for a Hilton Gold member. Definitely avoid unless you need to be in this neighborhood and can't find anything better.

title: EXCELLENT choice. (But design flaws needs fixing.)
text:
This hotel is totally solid, and very professionally run. I highly recommend it. At the same time, design flaws did affect the experience.

PROS:
-Quiet rooms. Didn't hear a peep.
-Perfect beds. Slept like a baby.
-Clean. Didn't see a hair anywhere.
-Parking easy thanks to arrangement with nearby lot.
-Well-equipped gym.
-Professional staff.

CONS:
-Sliding door on bathroom prevents privacy, in particular given that bathroom is literally right beside the bed.
-Bathroom fan doesn't work.
-Blackout drapes billow outwards due to placement of air conditioner, allowing some light into room
-Most of the view in "water view" rooms is consumed by a skyscraper across from the hotel.

And the rooms are small, but that's New York. Overall a completely dependable place.

title: Eigenmächtige Stornierung unseres Zimmers im Hilton Garden Inn
text:
Ich kann nur einen Punkt geben, da wir nicht in diesem Hotel übernachten konnten, da es seitens des Hotels zu einer Stornierung an unserem Anreisetag kam. Ich kann hier nur warnen, da wir erst  im Taxi vom Airport zum Hotel davon erfuhren, dass das Hotel unser Zimmer storniert hatte. Ehrlich gesagt, ist mir so ein Geschäftsgebaren noch nie passiert, zumal es sich hier um eine Hilton Tochter handelt. 
Ich hatte die USA Reise sehr frühzeitig gebucht und meine Kreditkarte, die zu dieser Zeit gültig war, hinterlegt. Die Buchungsbedingungen waren als „ohne Vor- und -Anzahlung“ beschrieben. Zwischenzeitlich hatte ich eine neue Kreditkarte erhalten und das Hotel wollte wohl am Anreisetag meine Kreditkarte, die ich hinterlegt hatte, prüfen. Da jedoch die alte Kreditkarte noch im System war und das Hotel somit keinen Zugriff auf die neue Karte hatte, versuchten sie mich zweimal zu erreichen um meine Kreditkartendaten zu aktualisieren, dann, da ich nicht antworten konnte, stornierte das Hotel unser Zimmer eigenmächtig.
Wohlgemerkt, wir wurden am Anreisetag kontaktiert, an dem wir fast 9 Stunden im Flieger saßen und mindestens 4 Stunden in Flughäfen ohne Internet. Wie soll ich da reagieren auf Fragen meine Kreditkarte betreffend, zumal ich Bedingungen ohne An-und Vorauszahlung gewählt hatte. Also wäre eine Bezahlung eh erst im Hotel nötig gewesen. 
So etwas ist mir noch nie passiert, ich reise in die USA und mein Zimmer wurde eigenmächtig storniert, nach etwa 20 Stunden Reisezeit (Transfer, Flugzeit, Wartezeiten an Immigration…)
Merkwürdigerweise war unser Zimmer zwischenzeitlich angeblich  bereits vergeben worden und man konnte uns nur ein kleineres und schlechteres Zimmer zum dreifachen Preis anbieten. Somit haben wir müde und erschöpft ein anderes Hotel online gesucht und konnten wieder mit dem Taxi zu dem neuen Hotel fahren, das wir glücklicherweise so kurzfristig buchen konnten.
Der für die Stornierung Verantwortliche wurde zudem sehr unhöflich und frech und meinte, wir sollten doch bei booking.com anrufen und den Vorgang melden. Zu bemerken ist, dass es zu dieser Zeit bereits nach Mitternacht in Europa war. 
Unser Urlaub fing also sehr schlecht an, zumal ich auch noch Telefonkosten von nahezu 100€ hatte, da ich vor Aufregung wegen der Stornierung versucht hatte bei der Hotline des Hotels anzurufen und ewig lange in einer Warteschleife hing.
Ich kann nur  vor diesem Hotel und dessen Geschäftgebaren warnen, schade für unseren Urlaub.

title: Lovely place
text: Rooms were clean, nice views surrounding the Staten Island ferry.  The staff was friendly and provided me with a smooth experience checking in to and out of the hotel.  Movtin was super helpful in assisting with luggage in the lobby.

title: Awesome location and Staff
text: The Front Desk Staff the entire four days were very friendly and helpful.  The location for my stay is the best to get around lower Manhattan.  The fact the hotel has three elevators is a plus when trying to get to your room.

title: Awesome stay
text: The whole stay was great. For the first time, it was incredible. The staff are very friendly. At the reception, Miss Amina was the perfect representative of the hotel. I must point out that every time we go in and out of the hall, she is the only one who calls us by our names. No breakfast.

title: Great stay
text: I am on crutches w/ many bags. I was nervous about managing belongings and navigating the hotel. From the second we arrived to the moment we left, Rafael was friendly, professional, responsive and incredibly helpful.  I am very thankful for such a kind and hard working staff member to assist me with all of my needs. All team members were wonderful. The room was clean and comfortable-met all of our needs. Some issues with water pressure but that was quickly resolved and complimentary services were provided. Overall great stay and enjoyed our two nights here at Hilton Garden Inn. Thank you Rafael!!! :)

title: Kudos to the staff and location!
text: We stayed at Hilton Garden Inn on Water Street for Bike NJ 2022. It can be taxing on the staff to have a fully booked hotel filled not only with guests but each guest also having a bike! Ameena, Rafael, and Steven handled the weekend like a champ! They accommodated every request and provided excellent suggestions! The location is awesome - I could see the ferry port from my room, the neighborhood is a delight and the 911 area is short walk away. I will be back in 2023!

title: Amazing staff
text:
This was perhaps the best experience I’ve ever had in a hotel. The staff was incredible and hospitable. From the moment we checked in from the moment we left, the staff exceeded my expectations. Michael, Martin, Imran, Steven, Jaquanna, and Ameena were all fantastic. They were friendly each and every time I returned to the hotel or stopped by the desk to ask a question. I really can’t say enough good things about them.
The room was also fantastic; clean and comfortable. It was everything that I wanted for my trip. 
The staff, however, really made a difference in my vacation. They made my first time in New York City truly unforgettable. I will absolutely return to this hotel and I can’t thank them enough for making my vacation memorable.

title: Toller Aufenthalt!
text:
Wir hatten einen rundum tollen Aufenthalt! Das Zimmer war sehr sauber und das Bett außerordentlich bequem. Außerdem waren die Mitarbeiter sehr freundlich und überdurchschnittlich hilfsbereit. Insbesondere Amens, Steven und Mark haben unserem Aufenthalt perfekt gemacht, da Sie sehr zuvorkommend und bemüht waren.
Wir würden jederzeit wieder kommen!

title: Vista eccellente
text: Posizione comoda per visitare downtown e per i ferries per staten island o liberty island. Camere piccole ma pulite, materassi molto comodi e soprattutto una vista stupenda, almeno dalla nostra camera, che era al 27esimo piano.  Personale gentile e disponibile. Apprezzatissimo da tutti gli ospiti il caffè gratuito, da gustarsi negli ampi spazi con posti a sedere della hall

title: Hotel y ubicación buenísimos!!
text: La ubicación del hotel es excelente, queda a pasos de la estación South Ferry, donde tomas la línea 1 que te deja directo en Times Square. Está cerca del Ferry a la isla de la estatua de la libertad y a unos 15 minutos caminando al toro-wallstreet-memorial 11S. La habitación tenía microondas, cafetera, refrigerador y caja fuerte. Muuuuuy espaciosa para todas las maletas y compras. Todas las mañanas había te/cafe/leche disponible en el lobby para llevar. No hay restaurante en el hotel, pero tienen servicio a la habitación. La limpieza de la pieza hay que solicitarla 1 día antes. Martin y Michael nos brindaron un excelente servicio en recepción, siempre muy amables!! Recomiendo este hotel sin duda alguna!!!

title: Buena relación precio-calidad
text: A unos pasos de la estación del metro linea 1 y del ferry a staten island. En metro llegas en media hora a times square. Tienes que avisar en recepción que limpien el cuarto, si no, no lo hacen. en mi opinión todos los días deben limpiar la habitación. Tamaño de habitación y baño no muy grandes. Muchos restaurantes en los alrededores, zona tranquila.

title: Excellent hotel for family or business, very good beds, superb service
text:
We stayed as a family in two king-size bedrooms for six days to explore New York. 

The hotel is located in a quieter part of Downtown (as quiet as it can get in Manhattan). You can easily move around thanks to the many subway-lines and busses which are just a few steps away and run very frequently. Multiple restaurants and pharmacy/convenience stores are close.

We had rooms with a water view, which however is only partial, since the One New York Plaza is blocking parts of the view.

The rooms are new and very clean. They are large enough for two people. The bathroom size is OK, while the shower is spacious. 
The beds are large and super-comfortable - we slept very well. Also very good are the pillows (two types available), the linen and the towels. 
The A/C works well and is relatively quiet.
Space to put your clothes is just enough, but not abundant.

The staff is superb. Every single employee was super-friendly and helpful. I would like to single out Mark Dacres, who truly was exceptional. 

Breakfast or any restaurant facilities were not available during our stay because of Covid-restrictions.

Although this was a holiday I would absolutely recommend the place also for business trips for the comfort of the beds and the proximity to the financial district.

title: Estadia confortável
text:
O hotel é muito bom. 
Limpo, organizado. Uma pena o restaurante e o bar estarem fechados, acredito que seria muito bom poder desfrutar desses espaços. Tem uma lavanderia o que facilitou muito a nossa vida, uma vez que pegamos dias chuvosos e precisamos lavar e secar as roupas. À academia é muito boa, bem equipada. No quarto tem cafeteira, frigobar  e microondas, que é muito bom! Os funcionários são ótimos, prestativos e educados.
Um agradecimento especial aos queridos, Martin, super educado, alegre e muito solicito, que nos ajudou bastante. E ao Steve, que nos recebeu muito bem, deu dicas de restaurantes (adoramos) e nos passou todas as informações necessárias ao chegarmos no hotel, permanecendo sempre com seu sorriso simpático no rosto! Muito obrigada

title: Great experience
text: We had an excellent stay (9 nights) in this hotel. The bedding was impeccable and the room was very clean. The staff is impeccable and very helpful. In particular, Mack, Amina and Martin delivered a service above expectations. Many thanks for everything.

title: Top Notch Professional Service
text:
Mr. Michael Mark went above and beyond to help us.  Our original accommodations at another hotel did not meet our standards and we scrambled to find a place last  minute with adjacent rooms as we were traveling with teens.  Mr. Mark graciously perused all of his available rooms and found us adjacent rooms on a high floor with a great water views.  I can no express enough how grateful we are.  When our flight was cancelled on 4/12/2022 due to an unfortunate incident, he again graciously helped us  with our last minute accommodation.  He has such a kind heart and truly went out of his way to help us.  His staff was also very polite and helpful.  Ms. Ameera Steven greated us with a smile and provided helpful recommendations as well as a list of dining and retail options nearby.  Mr. Martin and Ms. An were also equally as helpful.  The housekeeping staff is very efficient.  The downstairs lobby is cleaned throughout the day and refreshments (coffee and tea) area in the morning is replenished and cleaned quickly.
     The bed was comfortable and the pillows soft.  The rooms were very clean.  The carpets are new and the walls freshly painted and wall papered.   The toiletries were generously replenished.  There is a Kuerig coffee machine, tea and bottled waters in the room.  There is a small refrigerator, microwave, iron, ironing board, hairdryer and safe in the room.  
     There are two outlets in the bathroom, two outlets and a smart phone charger on each side of the bed,  four outlets on the wall by the desk and two international  outlets and a smartphone charged attached to tthe table lamp.  
     The room is spacious with sufficient luggage storage by the doorway.   This is a great place to stay for families.  Three subway station entries will take you anywhere in the city.  The area feels safe enough to walk around at any time of the day or evening.  There was plenty of overnight parking on the streets on a Sunday night, but during the weekdays, you will need to move your car by 7 am.
    I highly recommend staying at this property.  This will be our hotel of choice whenever we visit New York City.

title: Goed hotel
text: Goed hotel met mooie schone kamers. Elke dag schoonmaak van de kamer. Ruime hoeveelheid handdoeken. Vriendelijk personeel. Gelegen op het zuid puntje van Manhattan. Dicht bij metrostations. We hebben het hier 5 nachten goed gehad. Een nadeel was, maar daar kan het hotel niets aandoen, was dat het soms erg hard waaide voor de ingang.

title: We absolutely LOVE the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/ Manhattan Downtown ❤️
text:
We are currently in week 1 of a 4 week stay at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/ Manhattan Downtown.   We had stayed here for 9 days in January while my autistic son attended  New York Film Academy and I accompanied him on the trip. In January with Mark Dacres as manager we knew we would definitely return for the month of April.  He and his friendly staff have gone above and beyond to make sure that we are well taken care of during our stay. When my son came home early from school he said we’ve got you buddy 😀.  They treat him and me as family and we are so blessed by them all.  Michael, Steven,Ameena, An Pham and Martin and Nicky greet us everyday with such warmth and hospitality which makes this hotel like a second home to us.  They also give this parent since peace of mind and a grateful heart that my son with Aspergers know that he is truly welcomed here. Special thanks to Mark for working with us on arranging the stay and letting us know he and his staff is here to help us whatever we need. Special thanks to Michael at the front desk for making conversation with us daily and recommendations for grocery shopping and working with us quickly to connect on refrigerator concern and to Nicky the engineer who brought us a second refrigerator  at 11:30 pm when I realized the other one wasn’t working. He came back twice and went out of his way to check the second refrigerator  so that the $65 in food I purchased that day would be okay. Ameena for the positive comments on Aj’s signing Karoake songs for staff. 

As Diamond Members we can highly recommend this Hilton Garden Inn.  Safety, security and their clients well being is their highest priority and special thanks to Mark Dacres there is no other place we would rather stay in NYC. If you have a special needs child you will love the staff.  They really care about all guests ❤️

More positive reviews to be forthcoming ❤️

title: Good for visiting Manhattan
text:
Chose this hotel because it had good value within Hilton. 
I'm a Hilton Honors member, checked in via app, no line when I arrived.
Clean room with a nice view.

Had a great sleep. 

Only issue was some other guest smoking in a nearby room, smell also in my room.
Reported this at the front desk, Steven took great care on the topic. Was helped by Rafael with the luggage.

Great staff, good value for the money in NYC.

title: Special thanks for Martin
text: We really like this hotel which is very close to the subway station. Everyhing was perfect but special thanks to Mr. Martin who was very kind and helpful for us.  Martin could answer any question and arrange our perfect transport to the JFK airport. Thank you for everything.

title: Fantastic hotel with great staff
text:
We chose this hotel as it offered the best value for money. The location is great, you are surrounded by subway stops and the Staten Island Ferry is a stones throw away. 
I’d like to give a huge thank you to the guy on reception who checked us in and greeted us daily as we left and arrived at the hotel (I think he was called Steve but could be wrong!) 
He offered fantastic customer service and was super friendly and helped us with restaurant and bar suggestions. He was a credit to Hilton and made our stay fantastic, so thanks!

The room was much bigger than we thought and the bed was comfy. The shower was great although the sliding door to the bathroom is a choice!
The Keurig machine was also a nice touch but we had to ask for pods every day as they weren’t refilled by housekeeping. 
Apart from that we couldn’t fault the hotel and would definitely recommend. Just be prepared for a 30min subway ride to midtown

title: Oustanding in every way
text: Well what can we say apart from awesome. This hotel knows how to deliver excellent customer service. Staff are amazing from reception through to housekeeping. This hotel is very well run by management and they should be super proud of themselves to what they offer. Location has to be one of the best in NYC away from the buzz. The rooms we were given were stunning. The views from the 29th floor were amazing. The only downside was breakfast was not available due to covid but we were refunded accordingly by management.

title: Excellence
text: Thus hotel is a real a gem the staff here are the most welcoming, helpful , friendly and professional in particular the Front Office and Housekeeping team is outstanding .The rooms are modern immaculately cleaned. Location  was excellent close to subway shopping restaurants. I would  definitely return.

title: noisy
text:
First room I was given - a bit noisy / close to construction below. 
2nd room - I eventually realised that the loud mourning sound, was not a crazy man in the street below (shouting), but the wind, rushing through the outside of the window frame. 
3rd room - the window here was a sash style (previously opened from the side) - again, the wind rushes loudly through IE it is not sealed properly either. The room also has curtains that don't meet in the middle - they give you a blind, but put in curtains just at the side, which is odd. The bathroom basin tap is completely loose, like just sitting on the surface, 100% loose (dangerous from a flood POV / I'll report it, but it's odd no one else did before me) ! The fan makes an unpleasant noise too. I knew that the restaurant probably wasn't going to be operational - It's a shame though, as it draws one, to feel more at home and looked after, when you meet for a meal with everyone there. There is a good  'whole foods' style store, a 5-10 min walk away - go east up Water Street. Bizarre that the desk didn't all know this, now I've taught them where to advise, for the future.
I stayed in an outstanding Hilton Garden inn, in Tangiers, Morocco (several times) - this was not as good as that. No double rain shower, or amazing menu room service, generally not as smart. In a tall building where it can be cold and very windy in winter, this place needs the windows sorting out.
The guy at the desk said that the room would be cleaned in the afternoons, it was not. He also said he'd ring to check if the room was ok, but he did not.
For such a short street at the back, that my room overlooked, I've NEVER heard so much noise from 1 small street - ENDLESS beeping from deliveries, garbage trucks, construction trucks - its like ALL of New York's trucks with their reversing beeping on, crashing and banging. Ludicrous - starting early in the morning. Unless you're planning to be up very early, then you won't be allowed to sleep on.
I asked for my room to be cleaned on the second last day. He said 'no problem, I'll get someone to do it this afternoon". I came back in the evening and it hadn't been touched. Went to ask for more toilet paper, as its the one thing I needed -although the overflowing bins needed emptying too really, and another towel, as the shower surround leaks, so I have to mop up after a shower and they don't dry in time, by the time one returns for another shower.
He let me check out at 2pm, which was nice, as my departure from NY by train wasn't until 3.40.

title: Superior Customer Service and Very Clean Hotel
text: This hotel felt and looked new - although it is not.  The hotel shares a physical building where the front half facing Water St. is the Hilton Garden Inn and the "back side" facing Pearl St. is a Hampton Inn.  My room was very comfortable, the bathroom was very clean, the towels were far better than average, and I had a view of the East River and the Staten Island Ferry Terminal.  Unfortunately, the restaurant was still closed due to Covid - so that was a minor inconvenience.  What surpassed my expectations - I failed to check my mini-safe before leaving, and the hotel reached out to me while I was at the airport and offered to send to me overnight the contents of the safe.  Now, that was service above and beyond any expectations I had for a Front Desk staff member.  I am most grateful.

title: Excellent stay!
text:
Great location. Loved it here!

Really loved my stay at this hotel, the room were nice and comfortable. 

Ameena, An and Nicky were so helpful and friendly.

They showed me around and made sure I had everything i needed for my stay. The best staff!

title: Culinary Arts Class Trip
text:
We came as a group of 12 from Texas for a class trip.  Steven was accomodating even before we arrived!  He made sure my students had double bed rooms even though it was not a guaruntee, as well as the chaperones having thier own room.  It would have been a disaster if that was not done!  He also made sure we had maps and gave us tips to move around the city.  Laticia (I apologize if I spelled it incorrectly) was also amazing because she made our check in as smooth as ever!  It literally only took five-ish minutes and we were good to go!  Thank you both so very much for your hospitality!

I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay!  Great location and great staff!!

title: Boston getaway
text: The staff was extremely helpful and amazing. John McKinnon was very helpful throughout our stay. Great location and staff. I’d highly recommend this hotel for your next stay. The rooms are very clean and comfortable.

title: NY Girls Trip
text: Convenient location close to multiple subway stops and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty.  Comfortable rooms.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I forgot an item there and Steven and Mark were incredibly helpful.  Would definitely stay again!

title: Consultant
text: Great staff. Everyone was respectful and helpful. Ameena was attentive and assisted multiple customers courteously and with hospitality! The rooms were cleaned. The gym was also clean. The room service was not too bad. Had cold food once but good other that.

title: Work Event - Room Block
text: This was a great hotel for a work event I hosted in early February! I worked with the sales team to secure about 40 rooms and they were quick and super accommodating! Also easily accessible to the best line in NYC (green line)!!

title: Great experience from check in to check out
text: Quiet room with a thermostat that actually keeps the room at the right temperature ... soundlessly.  Staff was welcoming. Location could not be better. Battery Park, the ferries to Governor's Island and Staten Island were only a short distance away. Excellent value.

title: Excellent Staff and Very Pleasant Stay
text: We had an excellent stay at the hotel this weekend. The front staff - Steven in particular was extremely helpful. He made it totally enjoyable! Rooms are relatively small but totally functional and very clean. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

title: Excelente ubicación para tours en la zona
text:
Nos gustó mucho el hotel para hacer los siguientes tours:
 + Estatua de la Libertad
 + Memorial 11-09
 + Puente Brooklyn

Bastantes restaurantes alrededor, también algunos supermercados (caros, como en toda NY)

De este hotel salimos para New Jersey en Ferry.

Todo está bastante cerca, el personal muy atento. Guardan equipaje sin costo.

title: Clean, quiet room
text: Clean, quiet room topped off by pleasant staff willing to assist.  Greeted with smiles by lobby staff who asked what else they can do to make my stay a good one.   Room was quiet, which for Manhattan is  a rarity.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Comfortable setting for our exploration
text: We had a comfortable room that worked for us. The staff couldn't be more helpful and the location was good providing easy access to the metro. There was no breakfast served due to COVID so we went to Georges nearby a few times. What a joy to find that we had sweeping views of the harbor and Staten Island Ferry.

title: Hôtel mediocre
text: La chambre n’est pas nettoyée (ou quand c’est fait c’est très mal nettoyée), aucune restauration proposée, pas de petit déjeuner proposé alors que la réservation à été faite avec, personnel pas très aimable

title: EL MEJOR HOTEL DE NEW YORK
text: Estuvimos buscando varias opciones de alojamiento para nuestras vacaciones en New York y estamos muy contentos de nuestra elección. Desde el primer día Martin y Steven estuvieron muy atentos para que nuestra estancia fuese de 10. Lo recomiendo

title: Enjoyed our stay
text:
We stayed at the HGI from Jan. 22 - 26th. Steven at the front desk was very welcoming upon our arrival, and the overall check-in process was seamless. We booked a room with 1 king bed and were upgraded to a room with a double bed free of charge. The hotel is conveniently located to nearby train stations which is a plus and there are lots of food options in the area to choose from if you want to venture out. My only complaint is that we asked for room service to be completed every other day and it was not done originally when we asked. When I called the front desk the lady (didn’t get her name) apologized and sent someone up with fresh towels, wash clothes and toiletries. Room service was completed the following day.

All in all, we enjoyed our stay here and will not hesitate to book HGI for future stays.

title: Review
text: Michael Steven provided EXCELLENT customer service to my son and I during our visit he was very helpful and made our visit worth the stay. I will definitely be back with staff like him on board and your wonderful  accommodations!

title: Friendly, convenient, comfortable & affordable
text: I was 100% satisfied with my 9-night stay at this hotel. All staff members were great, but Anthony and Steven at the front desk were especially terrific -- very welcoming, super friendly and always helpful. I greatly appreciated having them at my service! The hotel itself was completely fine and the price was great. The location was super convenient with 3 metro stops, buses and the Staten Island Ferry just steps away along with plenty of nice restaurants, bars and convenience stores.

title: Muy bueno
text: Muy limpio, atención muy educada y agradable , buenas medidas de seguridad, muy buena opción y muy buen precio, cuando valla a Nueva York volveré a mirar para alojarme allí porque cuenta con una estación de metro que va a toda Manhattan

title: Excellent hotel !
text: Amazing location and staff with very clean rooms , we really enjoyed staying in here . Also the morning coffee is great . 100% recommend to select this hotel , the price is very reasonable and they take the COVID precautions very serious.

title: Good location near the Ferry to Staten Island.
text: Great for visiting the bottom end of Manhattan, good location in a safe area close to Wall Street.  Good views of the river from our room in between the two towers opposite. There is a subway stop across from the hotel and the Ferries across to Liberty Island and Staten Island are close-by too. There are places to eat just a few mins walk although the breakfast was good. We found the hotel to be very clean with good amenities. We also was helped by the hotel reception to obtain a taxi to the airport that was excellent. The driver was very professional and the car was very clean. I would recommend.

title: Absolut zu empfehlen
text: Es war ein sehr angenehmer Aufenthalt, sehr gerne wieder! Wir reisen sehr viel aber in einem sogsauberen Hotel waren wir noch nie.Das einzige was keine volle Punktzahl bekommen würde war die Lage, da es für Manhattan etwas abseits war und drum herum abends nicht viel geöffnet war. ansonsten aber Top!

title: It was ok
text: Lobby likes only white people and they don’t have free coffee or breakfast or barrooms it’s very sad and I wish they offered some type of free or discount for not having breakfast or free water or coffee it’s supposed to be the Hilton

title: Very nice hotel with a star called Anne <3
text:
Lovely, clean hotel in the financial district of Manhattan. Staff members definitely stand out - manager was amazing and there were 2 more great ladies, but the one called Anne stood out - such a kind, patient and mild mannered person, we felt great just chatting with her. 

Location of the hotel is also great - few minutes away from Wall Street and Metro station, lots of cool bars (Lovelace), restaurants (historical Fraunces Tavern), bakeries (we loved Leo's bagels as you can see on the only photo we took in the hotel :P), super cool cookie place called Insomnia Cookies and super tasty sushi just next door.  Staten Island ferry station is just across the street.

If you want to escape the chaos of Times Square and its vicinty, but still be close to everything and have plenty of cool spots in your neighbourhood, this is most definitely hotel for you.

title: Amazing Staff
text: My friend and I had a week-long of driving from the West Coast and we arrived in New York at 4 am. We were greeted by friendly smiles despite our exhausted look. Latia, the staff working the front desk, welcomed us and made sure we were all set up for our room. She was so helpful and was insightful on where to go around here in NY when we asked for recommendations. We had a lot of small bags and Nicky who stopped by the front desk helped us with our luggage and gave us tips on where to park around the area since parking seems a problem here in NY. The room that we stayed in was in pristine and clean condition. I rarely make reviews unless it's something that needs to be noticed and praised. This hotel and the staff that greeted us, Latia and Nicky, deserved every bit of praise. I would definitely book this hotel again when I come back next year.

title: Chris Wronski Hilton Garden Inn FIDI review
text:
My stay in the FIDI Hilton Garden Inn was fabulous.  The front desk representatives were cordial and informative.  The room we extremely functional with an absolutely incredible 29th floor  view of the harbor overlooking the Staten Island ferry.  The location of the hotel could not have been better as my business trip required me to be in the 1 NYP building  - right across the street!!!  Easy access the #1 and R subway lines allowed me to get to mid-town Manhattan  or the WTC for access to path and NJT in a matter of minutes. 
One thing  that could use a bit of improvement was the size of the closet as it was a bit tight for hangers to store the shirts and pants. 
I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for future patrons and you can be sure that I will definitely be back in the FIDI Hilton when I  next return to NYC

title: They do not Clean
text:
My room was not cleaned the entire 3 days I was there. The restaurant was closed due to no staff but they do not post that on web sight. 
They are very short staffed and over whelmed but they keep over booking this hotel. 
They need staff to help the ones trying to do their best.

title: Pagos
text: Al ingresar cobrar un monto después durante la estadía cancelan ese cobro y después cobran menos después cancelan ese cobro y al final cobran más de lo informado al llegar el primer día sin mayor detalle

title: Gran opción para alojarse en Manhattan
text: El hotel es muy conveniente, el cuarto está cómodo y limpio. Teníamos vista hacia el Hudson. La estación 1 de metro está Justo cruzando la calle y South Ferry Station si quieren cruzar el ferry. El cuarto está equipado con todo y vale cada centavo que pagas por el.

title: A little gem of a hotel in manhattan.
text:
I would suggest this hotel to anyone who wants a quiet location away from the main tourist traps.
Room - we had a room on the 24th floor with a great sea view, the room was well equipped with iron, safe, hairdryer,  coffee machine and a great light that double as a uk plug adapter nice touch. The room was more than adequate for space only 2 very minor gripes 1. Not much storage for clothes. 2. A slightly noisy ice machine in the corridor these 2 things are why i did not give 5 star.
There is 3 lifts ALL always working on our week and never had to wait more than 30 seconds lifts are also quick in use.
The location of the hotel is brilliant you have numerous subway stations within a minute or two and you can literally get to anywhere in manhattan/brooklyn etc from here. The Staton island ferry is also on your doorstep.
Finally we found the staff to be extremely friendly and accommodating.
Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Tranquilo en downton
text: Estuve alojada con mi pareja. Si esperas un hotel correcto, con todas las prestaciones, buen precio y en una zona tranquila en Nueva York, este es el hotel. La habitación era correcta y también el servicio. Lo malo era la puerta del baño, que se quedaba fija y quedaba abierta todo el rato a la cama. Por otra parte, falló un poco la limpieza ya que se tenía que avisar que pasasen cada día, y aún viendo las sábanas manchadas no las cambiaron. No obstante, lo recomendaría y volvería

title: Good location
text: The hotel is in good location with nice views if on top floors. The location is less crazy than Midtown Manhattan but still feel urban. The rooms were nice and lobby when enter. The downside is could be more comfortable with the sheets and less vent noise.

title: Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/Manhattan Downtown
text:
I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center because of its convenient location to subways, points of interest in lower Manhattan and reasonable room rates.  I was able to utilize public transportation (Air Train, LIRR and MTA subway) to get from JFK to the hotel at a substantially lower cost than it would have been to use Uber or Lyft.  The easy access to the subway was a big draw as I needed to make a few trips to Brooklyn during my stay.  The room rates at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center were more reasonable than those of other Hilton properties in Manhattan and Brooklyn, and my room at the Hilton Garden Inn was very nice. 

As a Gold Hilton Honors member, I was upgraded to a room with a water view on a high floor.  The room was very nice. The bathroom was immaculate and stocked with the usual toiletries. The hotel itself was very clean and looked like it was being well maintained. The staff at the front desk were quite helpful, providing good suggestions regarding restaurants in the area.

I would definitely stay at the Hilton Garden Inn again for return trips to NYC.

title: Half a hotel for full price
text:
Do not stay here. This hotel is providing half services, or less, without disclosing that until you arrive. 

Cleaning of your room is provided once over a 5-day stay.
 Water was shutoff two different times. 
Supplies for room (coffee, etc,) aren’t replenished, and it’s a crap-shoot whether they’ll show up when you ask for them (and are assured they will be right up).
 2 of 3 elevators were working, and one was always commandeered by staff, leaving 1 elevator for 20-some floors of guests- 10-15 minute waits for the elevator were common.
The bathroom in your room has a loose-fitting sliding door with no latch, so you had better be plenty intimate with any roomies (or you’re about to be).

The cherry on top of this excrement sundae is the incredible construction noise beginning at 7am, but also starting and stopping in the middle of the night (power saw cutting metal at 1am, etc.).

I would avoid this property at all costs.

title: Great views, Clean hotel
text: Really great views at this hotel, as well as excellent and prompt service. Rooms were modern and clean, although the location was a bit far from where we wanted to be. Overall, we had a great experience!

title: Okay
text: This was an okay experience. A few annoyances, parking is $50 a night with no leaving allowed once you park. No breakfast or Pool, only a gym. I will say it was clean which I appreciate. I expected the room to be a bit bigger (two beds) but maybe this is normal for nyc hotels.

title: Accessible, clean, & helpful!
text: Subway right across the street. I used it all weekend, perfect! The front desk girl was so accommodating to get me checked in earlier. Super clean and so welcoming. I felt safe and comfortable. I’d return.

title: Convenient location but lousy bed and shower
text: We made a last-minute decision to stay here so that we don't have to wake up early to commute to the city for our Monday meeting. The hotel staff was great but unfortunately the sleeping quality was not up to our standard. The bedsheet was rough and the shower wasn't great. In fact, the door was stuck that I had to ask my husband to help me open it so I could get out. Not to mention... the battery of our room door was also dead, so it took awhile for us to wait for them to recharge before we were able to settle into our room.

title: Excellent hotel for exploring New York City!
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a 3-day weekend to explore New York City this fall.  The hotel met many of my preferences for a great stay in NYC.  I also was able to get a decent price, even though hotel prices in New York City are climbing back to pre-pandemic levels.

The location is awesome!  The NYC Subway system can get you anywhere you want to go in the city! Just tap your credit card to enter--so easy! 2 subway stations (South Ferry and Whitehall) are literally across the street; other subway lines are within short walks. Staten Island Ferry is across the street, and NYC Ferry lines (South Street Seaport) are a short walk away. One subway ride to and from Penn Station if you are using Amtrak or other long-distance train service.

I requested a room on a high floor with a nice view, and they accommodated my request.  Of course, being in the Financial District, most views are of high-rise office buildings.  But I could see some decent views of Brooklyn, Governors Island, and the SI Ferry.

The room was very clean and modern. Large windows to look out over the city. They made efficient use of the small space. Comfortable king bed. Multiple electrical outlets to charge devices.  I made use of the mini-fridge (Buy your drinks at the Walgreens nearby). I was very happy to have a walk-in shower, as I am not a fan of tub/shower combos.  I believe it is because it's a newer hotel; most older hotels only have the tub/shower combos.

I was disappointed that the restaurant is not open, but there are many other food options nearby, for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Both fast food, fast-casual and sit-down restaurants.  All kinds, including mexican, salad, indian, italian, bagels, burgers, etc.

Elevators were fast and efficient, and never a problem during my stay, and I was almost on the top floor.

They made it clear when I checked-in that there was no housekeeping service; fresh towels and other supplies can be requested from the front desk. If I wanted my room cleaned, I had to give them 24 hours notice. Not my preference, but this seems to be the way all hotels are going, even after the pandemic period.

All hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  I know that they are short-staffed, and probably over-worked.  I made a point to greet them and say hello every time I entered or left the hotel.

I will consider this hotel again on future stays in New York City, depending on the price.

title: Disappointing
text: Very small rooms. Restaurant not open. Told it would be. Asked for block of rooms on same floor. Told no problem, when we arrived we were told couldn’t be done. Barriers blocking entrance. Difficult getting picked up and dropped off.

title: No cleaning, No breakfast available allegedly due to limited staffing
text: Pleasant staff at reception. Beautiful views of the water. Unfortunately my room was stinking of stale smoke yet I expected anon smoking room. Also room wasn't cleaned at all through the three nights I was there. The hotel claimed to be on skeleton staff. Neither was there any breakfast. Again the excuse was skeleton staff.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Hotel con excelente ubicacion, cercano a varias estaciones de metro, restaurantes l, atracciones y farmacia.
Personal amable y atento a nuestras solicitudes. Habitacion comoda.. realizan limpieza diaria si lo solicitamos. Recomendaria mas variedad en el desayuno

title: Amazing stay in Manhattan
text:
We arrived late at night with a lot of luggage. The lady at the front desk (Unfortunately, I did not write down her name) immediately presented  me  with luggage carts and assisted us in hauling everything in. 
The check in process itself was quick and informative leaving me with no questions at all. 

The room itself was clean, modern and very comfortable. 
We had packages delivered everyday and the front desk staff was very helpful and patient. 
The location was perfect as well. A short brisk walk to the Southferry subway station got us anywhere we needed in Manhattan and the ferry right down the street gave us amazing views of the Financial District at night and easy access to Brooklyn. 

Highly recommend this hotel. It was wonderful coming back every night and feeling like we’ve come home. 
Can’t wait to be back!

title: Great stay and trip!
text: We just stay at this hotel and from the moment we got there until the moment we left, we felt welcomed and the staff was very helpful in us getting around and navigating N.Y.. The location turned out to be perfect for us, close to subways and the attractions we wanted to and yet being able to leave the hustle and bustle of the for the quieter area the hotel was located.

title: Great stay with exceptional front desk
text: We walked into the lobby late in the afternoon to check-in on what seemed to us to be an extremely busy Friday, and were delighted to find that check-in was quick, easy and flawless. Thank you Christina, An and Michael for making this happen and for being so welcoming and friendly each and every time we passed through the lobby over our two-night stay. We had 2 beds, what seemed to be a very large bathroom, a coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator and safe. We were extremely happy and comfortable in our room. Thanks to everyone for making our special weekend so special. Keep the lights on for us until our return early next year.

title: 1st trip NYC
text: Hotel experience was pleasant. Room are clean and private. The area was pretty quiet and pleasant at night. Close to Ferry and Subway. I enjoyed my stay and will definitely will return to the same area and stay at the same hotel.

title: Excelente

title: Excellent Customer Service

title: Terrible Hotel 🏨
text: Clean room and friendly staff. That is all this hotel has to offer. Room 1814 is not well lit for working at the desk. title: Meh
text:
Pros: coffee kcups in room. No daily resort/hotel fee. Great location. Clean. 
Cons: Small rooms. Missing coffee & lotion, & only 3 towels when reserved for 4 guests.  Only 3 pillows for each double bed. Why not 4?! Burns on carpet floors. title: No cleaning of room for a week stay
text: This survey is asking the same questions over and over. My room was not cleaned for a sat-sat stay, restaurant and bar was under renovation and this was not stated on the site when booking. Had to keep going to the reception for supplies and made a request multiple times to have the room cleaned.

title: Great hotel
text: Loved this hotel, we’ll be back. It was in a great location, nice and quiet, nice helpful staff, convenient location to food and the subway, close to the park for a nice walk. This is gonna be the place to stay for us.

title: Грязно
text:
Непонятная сегодняшняя политика отеля, но не убирают в номерах за всё время проживания. Мусор самостоятельно выставляем за дверь. 
За 7 дней проживания ни разу не меняли бельё, не меняли полотенца и только по просьбе дали туалетную бумагу.
Маленькая бутылка обычной воды стоит 3$. 
Грязный туалет, душевая кабина, окна и подоконники, ковровое покрытие в номере ужасное . Вообщем везде пыль и грязь.
В улучшенном номере на двоих в туалете дверь-купе, которая не закрывается , реально щель сантиметров 15! Как это вообще возможно?! 
Лифты  для персонала и клиентов одни и те же и поэтому доехать нам на 34 -ый этаж постоянно было проблемой , остановки на каждом этаже.
Ну и конечно залог в 700$ , который будут возвращать 30 дней! 
Не рекомендую для пар и на долгое время этот отель. 
Месторасположение хорошее.

title: Nice stay for my return to New York
text:
I hadn't been to New York in 22 months (which is really long for me). I decided to stay away from Midtown so picked this hotel in the financial district.
The personnel was really nice and helpful. I had few needs and did not require the room clean but they provided me with anything I requested. They were also very helpful with the subway system.
Because of Hurricane Henri my flight was cancelled and they were very accommodating with giving me an extra night in the same room.
I really enjoyed my stay

title: Great Stay
text: I stayed for my birthday weekend. After a long drive in the city, Niko at the front desk welcomed us with a big smile, gave us a good room and great recommendation for my birthday dinner. We will be back.

title: Family Vacation
text:
This is a review of our stay in NYC for out hotel & for Booking.com. 
My name is Sonja & I traveled to NYC with my two son’s ages 17 & 20. This was our family vacation. I booked our hotel with Booking.com on March 18, 2021. I read the reviews & viewed the rooms & did a google search of the surrounding areas & decided we would stay here. 

Here is my overall review & opinion of our stay. 

Hotel Lobby: the lobby is just beautiful. The décor & the seating area are all very plush & comfortable. If you need to get out of your room for some fresh air, to relax or read a book you can do so in the lobby. The lighting is perfect, it is clean & the hotel smells so good. The staff is . . . . . . WONDERFUL…I will get to them shortly. 
Surrounding areas: you can catch the M55, M15, M20, the subway, site tour buses, eat at the many street vendors & purchase souvenirs. The hotel is located across the street from the Staten Island Ferry; you have access to several subway connections & buses. There are many restaurants around each corner, a Chipotle a few blocks down, (a good deli sandwich place) around the corner called Potbelly & a host of other eateries. If you are feeling sick & need some medicine there is Walgreens (they are called Duane Reade) in NYC but there is one around the corner. There is a park across the street & a waterfront. You cannot go wrong staying here. PERFECT location. 

Rooms: Our room was located on the 25th floor & the view…….AMAZEBALLS……AMAZING……so beautiful. The rooms were very clean & equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker & a safe. They have blackout curtains if you want the room dark. There is an iron, ironing board, blow dryer hangers & a desk with a desk lamp. They have free Wi-Fi & cable & I almost forgot to mention, the fridge is cold & our drinks were ice cold. The linens are so beautiful & high quality. The pillows…..I felt like I was in heaven (LOL) they were so plush & comfortable. I told my son’s I need to find out where they got these pillows & sheets & blankets so I can purchase some myself. They had these green blankets in case you needed extra cover & my 17 year old slept wrapped up in that blanket the whole seven days. He kept saying, mom please ask if we can buy get one of these because I need one of these. Therefore, since he kept saying how wonderful it was I asked for another one & my 20 year old said the same thing. They were in sleep heaven…..I even took a nap & wrapped myself in one. Love those covers. Overall, they have top notch, high quality bedding & it will not make you itch & it is definitely not cheap. You can tell Hilton prides itself on making sure the guest sleep well.  My favorite thing was the bed. I slept like a baby. 

Bathroom: There is a light around the entire bathroom mirror that I just love. I need one of those in my bathroom & it allows you to see your makeup very well. In addition, the bathtub is was my other favorite, I love taking a bath & I took a bath almost every night. There is no stopper so I just used a towel to keep the water in. The tub is long enough so that my feet did not even touch the other end & it is wide enough so that you are comfortable. I loved the tub. The water stays hot & we all showered twice a day & the hot water never ran out. NYC is very humid & you are going to want to shower when you return. The bathroom is very spacious. I love the lighting……
Staff Review:
Imran: So a few days before we were to travel, I messaged the hotel using the booking.com app & Imran replied to me. I was somewhat surprised, as I was not expecting to get receive the kind of customer service. I asked for directions to the hotel from LaGuardia airport & what bus or shuttle to take. He explained by messages how to get there, what bus & subway to take & was so nice & kind & I could tell through the messages that I chose the best hotel. Imran was also the person that checked us in. He was so pleasant, assisted us with a smile & told us how to use the key card, about their snacks that you can purchase & add to your room & how to enter after 11Pm. He was just a delight & so nice. Imran exemplified excellent customer service in person & by message. 

Nikko: Always said hello, have a good day, he chatted with my son who vlogs, always assisting & doing so with a smile. I am big on customer service and I definitely received it here. Nikko, helped us & gave us the best directions back to LaGuardia, as we did not want to use the subway. It was hot that day & we wanted to use the bus only. He took his time looking up the directions & we got there without any delays thanks to Nikko. We had an adventure every day & each day we left, he greeted us with a smile & told us to have a good day. He is just an overall nice, kind person. 

Andres: He is one the houseman & whenever we needed towels or extra toilet tissue he provided would bring them to out room. He always did so with a smile. There was three of us & he brought a set of two towels once, & I told him we need one more & he brought it right up. Such a nice sweet young man. Good service & always provided with smile & always asked was there anything else we needed. Great service. 

Rafael: This hotel was so clean like a said in the beginning. I decided to sit in the lobby one night & eat my dinner & I saw Rafael, cleaning & sanitizing everything. All the local places guest touch. He kept the place clean & I waved hello to him & he waived back with a smile. Everyone here is just so pleasant & I attribute that to Hilton. Again, a very nice young man & while he was cleaning I asked if I could sit & he nodded yes. I sat in the lobby for an hour or so, it was quiet & so clean. Like I stated earlier the hotel smells so good & is so clean. 

Martin: Finally, if you need help bringing up bags or any other kind of assistance you can ask Martin. Always there to assist in any way. 

Final thoughts: If you are planning to travel to NYC stay at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/Manhattan Downtown located at 6 Waters Street, New York, NY 10004. I promise you will not be disappointed. The next time we are in NYC, we will stay here & anytime I take a vacation I plan to stay at a Hilton Hotel. This is by far the best hotel that I have ever stayed, but it will not be my last. Lastly, I booked our hotel using Booking.com & I always use them when I travel. As they do not charge your card ahead of time which I prefer. This was such a fun vacation & we had a blast. Thank you to all the staff. 

*Please excuse any typos…I have on nails…thank you.

title: Amazing!

title: Horrible

title: Excelente trato

title: Solo Trip
text: Everything was super clean. Staff was so nice and very accommodating. Had to wait for my room to be ready for 30 minutes but that wasn’t a big deal at all. Just a great over all experience. Clean room, comfy bed, fantastic

title: Hotel stay
text: Good costumer service, average hotel. Stayed in downtown Manhattan area, food expensive. Parking not on premises, had to park in garage or find a park on the street on weekend when meters were free. Rooms small

title: Not safe
text: Tried to stay here. I walked from the Staten Island ferry and noticed they turned it into a homeless shelter. There were lots of riff raff hanging around outside drinking and smoking weed being loud. It did not feel safe. Such a shame that a night class hotel would stoop to this level. Would never stay here in the future.

title: Well cared for
text:
I am a nurse and I spent eight weeks in New York working at hospitals there during the Covid crisis. I spent five weeks of those eight weeks at the Hilton Garden Inn financial center location. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. 

I stayed in a king room for the first few weeks and then I moved to a double room when a member of my family came to visit. Both rooms were great, standard hotel rooms. My only suggestion of how to make the rooms better, is the closet. The bar in the closet faces front to back, instead of side to side. It was not at all easily accessible. But since I was staying there for so long, I ended up buying a little clothing rack off of Amazon and putting it in my room so that worked out fine. 

The front desk personnel were very kind and helpful. I had a lot of packages coming to me from family and friends and they always were quick to let me know when something had arrived. They also had many nurses to deal with during this time and I think they did a great job of finding ways to help during this extremely stressful time. 

The location of this hotel was great. You can see the Staten Island Ferry Directly across the street. There are several subway lines within 1 to 2 blocks. There is a city bike dock location less than half a block away. It’s a two block walk to the bike trail that goes all the way up the east side. It’s about 1 1/2 blocks to battery Park. I really love this area. It’s also easily accessible to the FDR and the W. Side Highway, depending on which way you are driving. But definitely no need to drive here, there is so much available through public transportation.

I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York. I know this area is not normally thought of as where you would stay if you were coming for a tourist visit, but because of the easy access to trains that run of the east side of the island and the west side, it’s actually a very accessible location. I will be staying there again.

title: RN covid relief
text:
thank you again for hosting me during my relief covid nursing experience.

Your staff made it uniquely wonderful to have the comfort of home while providing fresh linen and free food options and a place to sleep that was clean and so comfortable.  I will be forever indebted to ya'll for your hospitality.  

This was my favorite location I stayed at due to the convenience of location to explore NYC on my time off work and proximity to the subway system.  Thank you again you have a wonderful team and I can't wait to come back and visit in a years' time or so and share my experience with my kids one day.  Thank you for your commitment to excellence. I will never forget this experience nor the friendliness of the staff and huge hearts each of you share daily with your clients.

May God Continue to Bless You all,
Stephanie Rose

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I was one of many nurses who stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Financial District while working the Covid-19 crisis in NYC during the spring of 2020.  The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially Alex who works the front desk during the night shift.  Rooms were clean updated, and the higher floors have a great view of the harbor.  There is a large lobby that is great if you’re looking to hang out with friends, and also gives guests somewhere to go to socialize other than their rooms, which means noisy neighbors are not a problem.  Parking is available under the building across the street, and nearby Battery Park is a a nice place to walk around.  Highly recommend this hotel if you’re looking for a safe, clean, comfortable place to stay in the city!

title: Register nurse
text: Wonderful people, wonderful welcome, clean environment even in the middle of a crisis, Hilton and all personnel stays professional at all time and did a great job welcoming us in the hotel. I really appreciate how they treated us with no discrimination at all. God  bless you all. I’ve been a member off Hilton and I will gladly and respectively stay a member of Hilton. Again, thank you.

title: Frontline Healthcare worker
text: The staff at the hotel went above and beyond to assure that my accommodations were safe, clean and home-like during my stay in NYC. The staff tended to all of my requests in a timely and very efficient manner. The staff were extremely friendly, supportive and professional. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Financial Distric in NYC.

title: CRNP
text:
I enjoyed my say. The only issue is getting my room clean. It was supposed to be cleaned once per week, which was already a long stretch and at least once it didn’t happen. Even though, I gave my work schedule, and was out at least 14 hours per day three days per week. I do understand people scared due to COVID-19.
Otherwise, it was a lovely stay, and I appreciate the hospitality.

title: Travel Nurse During The Beginning of the Pandemic Can't Say Thank You Enough
text: First, thank you to Hilton for their generosity in. providing medical professionals with places to stay while we were gone from our hometowns to different locations around the country.
