I was fortunate to have stayed at some of the biggest names in the Hilton Brand, but if i were to come back to New York on vacation there is one place (okay maybe two )that would get my travel dollars and that was the Hilton Garden Inn in the financial center. not only was the location perfect for me and my worksites located either in Queens or on Staten Island, but the area is also gorgeous and I loved being able to walk along the water. the Ferry is within sight and easily reached with minimal effort. But most importantly (and this is why it wins out over the other Hiltons I stayed at) the staff. We didn't feel like we were an imposition to them. We felt like we were all a family and a team battling the virus. They were professional, friendly, accommodating and I can't say enough awesome things about all of them from housekeeping, maintenance to the front desk. thank you to all of you for putting yourselves out there to enable us to go work on the front lines. We wouldn't have been able to do it without you.

title: Registered Nurse
text: Hands down 5 out of 5 stars. I cannot say enough good things about my stay at the HGI. The staff was phenomenal. I had an extended stay for 6 weeks in NYC. I had stayed at a few other hotels in the area prior to checking in to the HGI and i ended up canceling the reservation i had at the hotel i had booked after staying at the HGI (the Millennium) after only staying one night  to go back to the HGI. The staff was great, customer service was phenomenal, and they just always went the extra mile to make sure i had everything i needed for my stay. Parking was also super easy. There are two garages across the street that offer great discounts for hotel guests. The hotel restaurant and bar had amazing food and beverage choices, and the hotel is in one of the best neighborhoods in the city. With easy access to multiple trains and ferries. Literally can see the ferry out of my window. Battery park is also right there and i had frequented the park multiple times. Also my room was so clean and fresh and QUIET! Literally i had the best night sleep there compared to the other places i had stayed prior. When i have to go back to NyC for work i will def only stay at the HGI.

title: Thank you!
text: I can not thank the staff and management of this hotel enough for taking care of us frontline workers during some of the most challenging shifts as a registered nurse that I have ever had! You gave us a place to stay with as little headache as possible and protected us when things worsened in the streets of NYC. I believe I racked up over 50 nights in this hotel and wouldn’t have wanted to stay anywhere else.

title: Covid response
text: During our deployment to nyc to help our fellow nurse with giving care to covid patient Hilton offered us housing.  The staff was very friendly and helpful made sure we were safe throughout our stay and made sure all common areas were clean.

title: Covid Response 2k19
text: Loved my stay here! The staff were super nice and helpful. I stayed here for 28 days while in NYC on a covid response assignment. The room was big and spacious as well as nice and clean. They still offered food at the hotel restaurant and even would bring it to your room. The location was close to everything I needed such as a grocery store, restaurants and train station. I would come back to stay no questions asked.

title: Amazing hotel at a perfect location.
text:
I stayed here for a week in January 2020. The hotel is located just opposite the Staten Island Ferry. Location is amazing on Water Street. There are multiple subway stations within 2 mins of walk. Right outside the hotel is the Citibike Docking station. There is a starbucks in the opposite office building. There is Dunkin Donuts and few more outlets in the Ferry station. Hop on Hop off buses start from Battery Park which is just opposite the hotel and the park has a great walking/running/cycling trail. The Wall Street Raging bull is few mins walk and the Westfield mall Oculus is about a 7 min walk. I can keep going on about the excellent location of the hotel its so centrally located. Times Square is a 15min subway ride.

The rooms are compact with great amenities and superb housekeeping. There is a Microwave Coffee Maker and Locker in the room along with the mini refrigerator. Beds are nice and comfy. The water view rooms have an amazing view especially the top floor rooms. Lobby is well appointed with flavoured water. There is a well stocked mini market. There is laundry facilities as well. We did not have breakfast included in our room rate.

Front desk staff were great and very helpful especially Imran who i would like to thank for the hospitality, Another guy Martin he is the concierge guy helped us with our bags while checking out. In the morning hours there was a different bell man whose name I do not remember he was also very helpful.

I highly recommend this hotel in New York.

title: Very clean and beautiful property.
text: This property is so nice. I stayed here for a week and the room was a good size and very clean. The hotel has a restaurant /bar in it with a lot of seating. This totel is in walking distance from the ferry and the subway.

title: Covid nurse
text: Loved my stay at this hotel!! The receptionist Regina is so friendly and helpful!! In fact, everyone there was amazing! There's on site laundry machines that accept quarters. I wish they had more machines because 2 definitely wasn't enough for the amount of people in the hotel. Shoutout to the cgef that cooked and packaged free meals for us!!! Greatly appreciated!!! Im so thankful for all the resources they provided! Amazing team!

title: Covid 19 RN Stay
text: Imran C., Nikko O., Elbert S., An Phan, Regina J., Max C., Gabriel M., Lee, Rafael, Martin H., manager of housekeeping, housekeeping services, the maintenance man (tall A.American male, he's so sweet). Each of them have been absoluetly amazing during my stay during COVID. they took us nurses in, they made sure we were comfortable, asked how we were doing, allowed us to be somewhat social while maintaining distance, kept up with our mail and packages, kept up with each and every food delivery. Anything broke, the maintenance man was swift in fixing it. Needing new sheets or a vacuum or my toilet cleaned or something, housekeeping was on it! They even made schedules for us so if the nurses worked day shift or night shift, they made sure they cleaned while we were working to not interrupt our sleep. I'm so grateful to have stayed there for 8 weeks. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel staff. Also, the Hilton is with the black community and i couldn't be more proud to be their customer and I have vowed to not stay at another hotel chain!

title: Excellent service and staffs
text: I'm one of the nurses that was fortunate to stay in Hilton garden inn for covid- 19 free. The staffs were very caring, helpful and they were always ready to be assits to you at anytime . They where very accommodating and welcoming.i had few staffs names, they are Mark, An, Imran, Rafael and the house keepers.i hated to leave because I felt like they were my family.i just want to say thank you and God bless.

title: Very Homey
text: This place is great! We stayed here for about a month and a half for a contract and it was very clean and the staff were very hospitable. The location is very convenient because it's close to restaurants, bars, convenient stores, you name it. It was also by the waters too so it had a very nice view. The staff there were very helpful in renewing our rooms, providing guests services, and kept the place so clean and sanitized. The room was beautiful, the elevators were quick, laundry machines were provided, and happy hour was so fun! 10/10 would definitely come again!

title: Great stay!
text: Myself and a bunch of other nurses stayed at this hotel and it was an overall GREAT stay! Every single one of the hotel staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. Would def recommend staying here!

title: Amazing safehaven for nurses!
text: Absolutely amazing time while staying here and working a 3 month contract. In fact Im extending my contract and staying  at this hotel another month! This place feels like a home away from home. Comfy beds , professional staff & just a general overall amazing experience. One person stands out tho that has been there for all of us nurses needs time and time again no matter day or night... MAX! Amazing night manager! He and everybody else here have been amazing. I highly recommend the stay here!

title: 立地抜群
text: ニューヨーク滞在時に利用。バッテリーパークや地下鉄駅に近く立地は抜群、部屋も清潔感があって近くのダブルツリーよりはこちらの方が良かったです。隣の部屋の音が聞こえてきたのが少し気になったかな…

title: Highly recommend
text: Although I stay at this Hilton Garden Inn for work, I often add in personal nights because the hotel is so conveniently located in southern Manhattan, but more importantly, the hotel/rooms are clean, and the customer service at all levels consistently top-notch. Manhattan hotels are expensive, period, and so it's hard to assess their cost/benefit, but I never leave this hotel feeling like I've gotten a bad deal. Highly recommend!

title: Situation top de l’hôtel
text: Situé à 2 min de wall street, 4 stations de métros autours, service top ainsi que les chambres aussi. Personnels l’écoute, peut trouver de la place facilement au parking extérieur. A conseiller à tout le monde

title: Long Week-end à New York
text:
Hôtel propre, situé dans le chic Financial discrit (sud de Manhattan) proche commerces, restaurants, métro, bus, navette ferry..etc personnel professionnel et réactif.

Je recommande vivement cet hôtel pour une première visite de la ville de New-York.

title: Vollkommen zufrieden
text: Personal war sehr nett und hilfsbereit bei jeglichen Anliegen. Zimmer war immer im top Zustand und das Bett mehr als gemütlich! Der einzige kleine Kritikpunkt ist, dass das Zimmer etwas größer hätte sein können. Aber das ist wirklich nur eine Kleinigkeit da man ja immer den ganzen Tag unterwegs ist. Sehr empfehlenswert

title: short trip
text: Staff was very helpful and accomodating, location was good for why we were there. Beds were comfortable and clean.  elevators were a little slow but not a big deal.  Close to several restaurants and subway stations.

title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff Amazing Location
text:
My recent trip to New York as a solo traveller, this hotel was surpassed all expectations. From the moment I checked in the team was welcoming, engaging and friendly you really couldn't ask any more. I had a wonderful water view on the 25th floor the room was immaculate, super comfy crisp white cotton clean king bed with all amenities you need and ample storage.
Rooms cleaned daily to a great standard and it was nice to be able to open the window that seemed very secure for those travelling with a child. Every day the team were courtious and polite. 
The location I loved right on the subway train number 1 which hits all key points in the city, staten Island ferry and a 25minute leasurely walk along the river to the New Jersey ferry, if your returning to New York done the key sights come to shop and enjoy great food and night life the location either way is great.
I ate on my first night as I 2as tired after a long flight the restaurant staff extremely attentive and listened as I am gluten free along with good prices and a great cocktail. 
For me I have found my preferred hotel in the city for my future visits. I wish to thank all of the team for a great stay and look forward to seeing you all next time.

title: Comfortable and Excellent View
text:
Located across the street from the ferry to Staten Island. Very clean area, quiet, many restaurants, and bars around. Close to the 4 train, across the street from the 1 train. Very friendly customer service, they offer coffee and tea in the mornings and infused water during the day. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, and bar are offered but personally, the cost was very high for basic food especially breakfast (dinner was more reasonable). Better to eat at a restaurant nearby or order food. After check-out they offered to store bags for the day, we declined because we were not going to explore or do anything we were simply going home but it's good to know they offer that. We had a very relaxing time. This was the perfect weekend getaway.

The room was small but enough for two people. We had a king room water view. The closet was super tiny, too small for two people even if it was only for a weekend. BUT, we did not have many things and honestly the view and the service outshined that space. The room was extremely clean. The bathroom was as well. And I am PICKY with the cleanliness of sheets and bathrooms to the point that I ALWAYS bring my own towel, pillowcase, and shower shoes. I felt comfortable, clean, and as though I could step everywhere with my bare feet. 

I gave it a 4 because it was pricy to book and the space was small, there was no mini-bar in the room, and the menu prices were a bit over the top, BUT, I would return to this hotel again and probably will.

title: Primo viaggio a NY
text:
Si trova nella zona di Wall Street (distretto finanziario), zona molto sicura e più tranquilla, meno caotica, rispetto alla zona più centrale di Time Square.In pochissimi minuti di passeggiata si raggiungono le fermate per tutte le principali linee della metro (verde, gialla, rossa), di fronte al molo da cui parte lo Staten Island Ferry (totalmente gratuito e che consiglio per avere una visione dello skyline di NY). Posizione eccezionale per spostarsi ovunque e velocemente che ti dà la possibilità di poter far ritorno in Hotel se necessario per fare una sosta durante la giornata. Proprio accanto si trova Battery Park, parco favoloso che si affaccia sul fiume Hudson e poter godere della vista statua della Libertà.
L' Hotel è moderno, personale molto cortese, professionale e veramente disponibile.
Camera 2505 molto più grande dello standard di New York, curata e pulizia impeccabile. Presenti frigorifero, microonde, ferro da stiro, grande TV e il necessario per prepararsi te/caffè riforniti quotidianamente. Anche il bagno all'interno è moderno, molto pulito, dotato di una doccia molto spaziosa e un asciugacapelli degno di essere chiamato tale. Lenzuola e asciugamani di ottima qualità e letto super super comodo, l'armadio magari è un po' troppo piccolo per un soggiorno di 2 o più persone. Condizionatore silenzioso, wi-fi gratuito. Appena siamo entrati ho trovato con immensa gioia una grande finestra, con possibilità di essere aperta, che affaccia all'esterno della struttura e da cui è possibile vedere uno scorcio dell'East River e della partenza dei battelli per Staten Island.
Nella hall ci sono a disposizione degli ospiti latte, caffè e te durante la mattina e acqua fresca nel pomeriggio. Nel piano interrato c'è una lavanderia automatica a gettoni e una palestra. Non abbiamo utilizzato il ristorante poichè ci piaceva mangiare in giro per la città
Al check out abbiamo potuto lasciare le nostre valigie fino alla partenza per poter passeggiare tranquillamente.
Lo consiglio veramente e ci tornerò sicuramente se un giorno dovessi tornare a NY.

title: Great location and nice hotel
text: The location of this hotel is great. Very close to subway entrances and other places we wanted to see and visit. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. Regina (front desk), Lee, and Nathan in the cafe were especially instrumental in making our stay here a memorable and enjoyable experience!

title: 5 Tage New York
text:
Hotel: super lage mit direkter Anbindung zur subway und fähre.

Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit, im besonderen Regina and Martin am Empfang.

Wir würden das Hotel sofort wieder buchen.

Gruß  Dennis

title: Best HGI ever!
text: By far the best HGI ever stayed in. Breakfast (Avocado toast!!!) is fantastic! Service was exceptional from front desk staff to food and beverage manager! Can't get any better value in NYC, especially in that location!

title: Lovely Experience!
text:
It was my first ever visit to the states. I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks for my business trip. The entire experience was nothing less than perfect. I was pleasantly greeted by staff , throughout. 

Nathan and Vincent were pleasant at the restaurant and ensured I was treated well. I loved the breakfast specials and the traditional Scrambled eggs and Bacon. The Bar was cozy in the evenings with a good range of cocktails.

The best part of my experience was how my room was maintained, throughout my stay. I was always greeted to a very clean and cozy room , after a tiring day at work. The first few days were so great staying in my room , I needed to thank Mariela Sanchez from the house keeping staff for taking great care of my room. I wasn't doing a great job keeping it tidy all the time , but was never disappointed coming back to my hotel room, thanks to Mariela. 

Overall , I had a great trip and I thank the staff of Hilton Garden inn , NYC Financial Center and I would definitely come back here for my next trip.

title: Great Experience.
text: We had a family visit in this Hotel during a long weekend in February (President's Day) and we are so glad that we picked this Hotel. I am extremely likely to choose this hotel in future when I visit NY.

title: good stay but didn't realize I booked with 3rd party
text: the hotel is nice, great location and the staff was great. we were frustrated to learn though we went directly to the hotel site to book and had issues getting it to go through and called but were redirected unknowingly to a 3rd party. the 3rd party lady was very nice, but i had no idea why my hilton card was frozen as potential fraud when she had to try repeatedly to obtain a room, and we were told breakfast was free, when actually breakfast was approx. $50 per day, and when we inquired, we were told we were given incorrect information and needed to talk with Hilton Honors and the 3rd party - that's how we learned that calling Hilton and going directly to the hotel website still landed us with a 3rd party. This was a negative experience with the booking process, but the hotel itself was totally fine.

title: Excellent location, service and staff
text:
We stayed for three nights recently and couldn't really fault the hotel. Staff were helpful from the moment we arrived and this set the tone. 
The hotel was spacious, clean and located within easy reach of many different subway lines for Midtown, Brooklyn and JFK. Staten Island Ferry is just across the street, Wall Street is just behind and the WTC is a few minutes walk away. The distance away from the chaos of Midtown was a blessing in many ways.
Lots of food options nearby as well so you  can get a bit of breakfast or a filling meal. We will try and stay here again when we visit NYC.
My only fault would be the water pressure in the shower wasn't great. Perhaps that was a consequence of being 17 floors up?

title: Bed Bugs on Thus Property!
text: Bed Bugs-Do not stay here! The hotel is supposed to be of reasonable quality and I actually used to stay at the Marriott but moved to the Hilton because of the location as it is close to the office. WhT a mistake.

title: The Employees Make The Difference
text:
I was here for a week in July 2019 and for two weeks in February 2020. It was absolutely my pleasure to return.

After checking in, I stopped up to the restaurant/bar on the 2nd floor to have dinner. Anna was bartending/serving and remembered me from my last visit. That felt so good! She made me feel right at home. I had dinner there most nights so I got to see Anna and fellow bartender Matthew in action. They are a well-oiled machine handling the bar and restaurant patrons. They knew their regulars and related well to all who stopped in.

Each morning I visited the restaurant for breakfast. Shawn and Vincent graciously made my Weight Watcher friendly breakfasts to start my day right. Agron was my server most mornings and always greeted me with a smile, decaf tea and cranberry juice while I waited for my omelet. Nathan and Efe rounded out the server team on different days. They offered smiles and good service.

Elbert is the food and beverage manager. He is personable, friendly and efficient. He runs a good operation. From Ann, Willie, David and others who worked behind the scenes in the kitchen to all who worked out front, thank you for everything. My meals never disappointed. 

Two weeks in a hotel is a long time. In order to pass time during the evenings and weekends, I brought a jigsaw puzzle with me. Special thanks to Anna for lending me a room service tray to use during my stay. It made puzzling easier and neater. Thank you for your thoughtfulness!

Thanks to Luis Torres of Engineering for helping me get my room cooler. It was very nice of you to check in the next morning to make sure all was still well. Nice job.

Thanks to Nikko, Abdel, and Lee for efficiency at the front desk. Special thanks to Martin for weighing my suitcase before I left for LGA to fly home. Turns out my bag was overweight, so by shuffling some things around, he saved me a hefty additional fee. 

Hassan Elbardei, General Manager: You have a great team here. I hope you'll take time to recognize them for their efforts. As someone who travels frequently, I know that a hotel can be just a hotel - it is the employees who make the difference. Your team surely made a difference for me during these two weeks.

title: Fabulous!
text:
First time in NY and loving the Hilton Garden Inn!. Staff is excellent, friendly & welcoming. Just had breakfast and our server Efe is so attentive and just plain wonderful! The chefs made us perfect omelette in a flash!
The front desk has been so helpful - their in-house cab service made sure my granddaughter and I made it to dinner at Sparks Steakhouse on time and safely!
I will stay here again and recommend this hotel totally!
Almost forgot to mention the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! And the shower is large with great water pressure and as hot as you can stand it!

title: Poor Choice
text:
Very noisy location. Poor blankets. Overly expensive restaurant. $26 for 2 pieces of bacon and a scoop of cold scrambled eggs.

Dining service was poor. Small staff.

I’m a Hilton member,but won’t recommend staying here again.

Try a room off the street.

title: Great experience !
text: We had an amazing time in this hotel. Hotel is in a very good location, tourist attractions are close by. Staff in this hotel is super friendly and helpful. Especially i would like to thank our breakfast manager Elbert for everything he did for us (Gumbo was delicious) . Also Ben, Agron and everybody for all the help and smiles. I would definitely recommend this hotel for everybody who wants to relax and enjoy their vacation.

title: Visit New York
text: Das Hotel hat uns und unseren Freunden sehr gut gefallen. Die Sauberkeit, der Service und die Lage sind super. Wir würden immer wieder in dem Hotel übernachten.Der nächste Aufenthalt ist schon sicher.

title: Such an amazing stay !
text: I enjoyed my stay and the rooms were as they should be. Workers were very nice we specially Max he was very helpful and resourceful with anything we needed. Amazing personality and such a sweet person . Would recommend this place to anyone . Will be staying here again

title: Smiling Faces Abound
text:
Had a fabulous three-night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Lower Manhattan.  The hotel is quite modern yet homey.  My guest room, although modest in terms of square feet, was spacious by NYC standards.  The bathroom was bright and very functional with good water pressure and temperature.  The living area included a lounge chair, a desk with an ergonomic chair, and a very comfy bed.  The closet was rather small requiring me to relocate the ironing board to fit all my dress clothes.  The dresser space is also limited.  However, the room had a mini fridge, microwave, and safe.

The lobby is surprisingly inviting.  In the morning, there is a station with coffee and teas.  During the day, you will find two drink dispensers containing fruit-infused water such as kiwi and mango.

Hilton Honors members get vouchers for complimentary breakfasts.  Make sure you stop by reception even if you check in yourself and use the Digital Key program.  I really enjoyed the made-to-order items like the avocado toast topped with fried eggs and the frittata with truffle shaving.  On various days, I noticed blueberry pancakes, a garden vegetable omelet, and even oeufs cocotte on the menu.  The weekend cafe staff is very laid back.  During the week, the cafe adopts the more business-like aura of the clientele by including visits to your table by the manager.

A few shout outs to staff members:  Thank you Ms. Lee at the front desk for getting me a room with a nice view, helping me navigate the pantry (convenience store), and going above-and-beyond on at least one occasion.  Also, Rafael was a joy.  Keep smiling!  Also, housekeeping nailed it.

The hotel is located at the lower tip of Manhattan.  Tip: Tell your taxi driver to take FDR Drive South to the Staten Island Ferry exit.  For those opting for public transportation, the last stop of the 1 train (which stops at Penn Station, Times Square, and popular areas of the Upper West Side) is a block from the hotel entrance.  South Ferry subway station is unmanned.  If you are not familiar with the area, you will feel safer at night with a ride share.

In spite of the warnings about construction outside the hotel, there were no noise issues.  There was just a slight diversion as you approach the entrance.

All in all, I would highly recommend the hotel for location, value, and comfort.

title: Amazing Hotel Experience in The Big Apple!
text: My fiancé and I stayed at this hotel and we received a complimentary upgrade.  The location was perfect affording is the opportunity to get to a number of locations with ease.  Gabriella and Nathaniel were awesome.  Can’t wait to return.

title: Buena experiencia
text:
El desayuno nos encantó. No hablamos inglés y ellos buscaron un empleado que nos ayudara a comunicarnos. El proceso de llegada y salida fue súper rápido. Céntrico y cerca de la
Estación del tren. Recomendado

title: Hotel lovely - staff: most are very good
text:
Overall I would have given top marks for everything, especially for breakfast when Efe was on (such a happy, pleasant and very efficient waitress), the chefs were also very cheerful and made us some  delicious omelettes and there was a very happy lady on reception on our arrival who always smiled along with the pleasantly mannered concierge staff.  Rooms were also very clean and when we called for someone to reset the safe they assisted promptly.
Unfortunately our experience with the breakfast facilities and service on the last day was extremely disappointing.  It was busy when we arrived but as it was during the middle of the time the restaurant was open this was expected.
However, there were no plates on the breakfast bar so I had to ask for some, I then had to ask for cutlery as there was not any laid out on the table but gave up waiting so had to go and find our own. We ended up getting our own coffee and had to go and get milk from the cereal area.  We don't have a problem with getting our own things, but this is not how this restaurant is set up.
On a Sunday they apparently don't offer sausages and the other two ready cooked items of potatoes and scrambled eggs had basically ran out, so we ordered an omelette each.  My husband waited that long for his he had to go and ask the chef where his omelette was only to be told it had already been sent out - don't know who got his order but the waiter/waitress had obviously given it to the wrong person even though we'd got the numbers on our table.  He had to re-order and wait again!  
On the fruit bar, apart from a couple of chunks that had been dropped around the edges the pineapple box was empty.  The melon was still available but I would have expected the pineapple to be replenished as the breakfast sitting was only part way through - only a tiny niggle, but I like pineapple.
Some of the tables were left "dirty" for quite a while before they were cleared for the next guests.
I did try to "complain" about this via the reception lady but she was very dismissive of me.
However, because of everything else that was good I would use this hotel again. Also at night time it is rather quiet, it is at the end of town (obviously if you're planning on staying here you can see that) and the main road is positioned around the edge of town so you can't hear the traffic on it.

title: Great Experience!
text: Hotel was in a great quiet area. The hotel staff were so helpful and very friendly. We were able to check in earlier than our check in time and were able to get an upgraded room. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in the quieter part of NY and it is literally down the street from the ferry. Will definitely come back in the future.

title: fist visit one night family stay
text: I paid $140 per one night they couldn't include breakfast I had to pay $50 extra for breakfast, they charged me $50 extra for deposit (I don't know for what), tiny room with a tiny closet but comfortable, two double beds I was pretty sure in the reservation said two queen beds, but nice view from room on 28th floor. besides that service was very good Mr Martinez attend us very well.

title: Second visit - still great!
text: This was our second visit to the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/Manhattan Downtown for work, and it was just as great as the first.  The rooms are spacious, nice and modern.  We had vouchers for breakfast during this visit, and enjoyed the avocado toast ever day!  There is always coffee or water in the lobby and sometimes tasty cookies!  The FiDi location is great, quick access to the subway and plenty of great things in walking distance.  Beyond all of this, my favorite thing about this hotel might be how the smiling faces at the front desk make sure you greet you every time you walk in the door - love that!  I'll be back!

title: Give my money back!
text:
I paid a $350 deposit upon checking in ($507 AUD) and was told this would be refunded within a month of checking out. That in itself is ridiculous. I feel for those who are counting on that deposit to be used for the next leg of their trip because no one is in any hurry to get it back to you. 
Two months later it STILL hasn’t been refunded to my bank account AND the hotel will not provide evidence of their receipt indicating the return to my account which they state they have done. I have escalated my complaint to Hilton head office who directed me straight back to the hotel. I am now looking into who the hotel industry answer to and will be escalating this again.

title: Nice Stay in Downtown Manhattan
text: We love staying in the Financial District and this is a first staying in the Hilton Garden Inn. The front desk was kind and helpful and gave us a hard copy key although I’d opted for a digital one. Good move as one time my phone died. The room was adequate though a bit small. Bed very comfortable with nice pillow choices. Loved the bathroom! Towels in the walk in shower worked out nicely as the shower size was long. A packet with shower cap and a few other essentials besides typical shampoo, conditioner and body lotion would have been nice. Several times we had a few needs, called the front desk who had them delivered in a reasonable time. The breakfast if not a higher level Hilton Honors member was a bit pricey so we opted for nearby Starbucks. Overall a very nice stay, steps away from Battery Park and a ride on the Stanton Island Ferry.

title: Well located and decent value for money
text: Well located for Staten Island ferry and South Ferry subway station. Bowling Green subway station not far, so easy to travel uptown. Walking distance to World Trade Center. Rooms comfortable but compact (especially if you have a lot of luggage), some east-facing rooms have a view of the river. Coffee and tea provided in room (with creamer packs). Breakfast is adequate. Staff friendly and helpful.

title: Anniversary trip
text: An excellent hotel. Wonderful location in fidi. Lee and other staff always smiling and saying hello! Very friendly and accommodating! My wife and I had a wonderful time in nyc exploring! Again, wonderful hotel with a nice staff! Early check in was great too!

title: Hilton.Water Street.Jan.16-23.20
text: It was exceptional good value.  On average $93/night (two people in a room).  Located nearly across from the Staten Island Ferry.  Good location for subways and walking distance to interesting places.  Room was good, with safe, microwave and fridge.  I liked that the Hilton had a nice lobby with coffee and tea in the morning.  Excellent value for NYC.

title: Lovely
text:
Really nice hotel, great location, wonderful staff. Very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfy. We enjoyed our breakfast and the waiting staff and chefs were great.
 Thank you for making us so welcome

title: Fantastic Experience
text:
We loved everything about this hotel. It's in a great location near many subway and ferry lines and the staff were wonderful. From Regina who met us when we arrived to every staff person we passed in the hall or lobby - everyone was friendly and helpful. 
Or room was clean and nicely decorated and the mattress and pillows were very comfortable. We slept great. We had a great view and the hotel was actually pretty quiet overall. We really loved this place and will be back whenever we stay in NYC from now on. No more trying to find a good hotel at a decent price - we found it! Thanks HGI!

title: Location is great!
text: Location is great. Breakfast is $15 per person and the wait staff only helps with drinks once and doesn't come back for refills. Rooms are clean with a pretty good view. Overall it was a nice room that was not too expensive but I would skip the breakfast option.

title: Lage, Lage, Lage...
text:
Für einen Entdeckungstrip nach NY hat das Hotel eine unschlagbare Lage. Staten Island Ferry und U-Bahn direkt vor der Haustür, viele Sehenswürdigkeiten fussläufig zu erreichen, toller Blick aus dem Fenster. Die Zimmer sind leider winzig,  die Klimaanlage sorgt dafür, dass es immer entweder zu kalt oder zu warm im Zimmer ist...ein Schrank fehlt völlig aber für 3 Nächte kann man darüber hinweg sehen und aus dem Koffer leben. Das Frühstück im Hotel sollte man vermeiden...nicht wirklich gut, dafür echt teuer. Besser schmeckt der Bagel gegenüber an der Bude vor der Station. (Tip: die Crepes an der Bude mit frischen Früchten)

Wer im Hilton einen "Hilton-Standart" erwartet, wird enttäuscht. Aber die Zimmerpreise sind günstig und - wie schon erwähnt - die Lage ist ideal für einen ersten Trip.

Unschlagbar aber - und das muss hier erwähnt werden - ist die Freundlichkeit und Hilfsbereitschaft des Personals. Ihr braucht einen Shuttle zum Airport? Martin regelt das. Ein klassisches Yellow Cab zum Centrsl Park? Fragt Martin...ein echter Schatz für das Hotel!

title: 'HGI' means Hospitality Guaranteed Indeed (Kudos to the best hotel staff I have ever interacted with!))
text:
When they say they want to deliver their Hilton Garden Inn Promise, they MEAN it. The staff at HGI Financial Center has continuously surpassed my expectations in terms of hospitality, care and respect. One must feel absolutely welcomed in the presence of their ever-so-welcoming staff; to name a few - Lee, Abdul, Imran, Regina amongst others who will be warmly greet you by the reception, along with bellhops like Martin who will always attend to you with an affectionate smile! 

Rest assured, their amenities and rooms are also equally welcoming and value-for-money. It's true what they say - 'No matter what level you are residing at, the HGI experience will take it to another level'

I've been loyal to this hotel for months now, and do not plan on discontinuing to do so anytime soon!

title: Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/Manhattan Downtown
text: Great central location, located in the center of everything. Great little restaurants just around the corner. Not far from the airport and just a short walk to Battery Park. Would stay here again in the near future.

title: Hotel mit sehr guter Lage
text:
Wir hatten einen Kurztrip nach New York. Das Hotel ist sehr zu empfehlen, da es optimal gelegen ist und ein super Service bietet. Es sind ca. 2 Gehminuten bis zur U-Bahn und zur Fähre. Die Aussicht war bei uns auf den Hudson, also sehr schön, vorallem am Morgen wenn die Sonne scheint. Die Zimmer sind großzügig, das Bett hat einen guten Schlafkomfort und das Bad ist sauber, wie auch der Rest des Zimmers.
Wir werden es wieder buchen.

title: Setting a new bar for “hotel breakfast”
text:
I was in town for business and extended my trip to visit with family and this was a great location. The rooms are very nice and the service from the time I checked in was typically what you’d experience at luxury brands like Ritz-Carlton, St. Regis, etc. The hotel breakfast was what you’d expect at a popular restaurant in town — with specials like Avocado Toast, Mushroom and Truffle Egg Frittata and more! The service is great and the team takes pride in everything from table service and food served, to the maitre’d / restaurant manager ensuring you are pleased with your meal and bringing you coffee, etc.  

Thank you to the front desk staff, evening bartender, restaurant manager and breakfast chefs who made this stay a wonderful experience!

title: Director
text: Huge shout out to chefs Willie and John for their amazing gumbo (glad I rode the elevator with you Willie, thanks for the recommendation!). And to Matthew and Anna behind the bar, I come down approximately once a quarter and they are always extremely friendly, professional, and great bartenders. Thank you for the hospitality, I’ll see you again soon.

title: The BEST HOTEL in the BEST AREA of NYC
text: We have nothing to complain about. The staff were brilliant at all times, the room was way bigger than i expected the bathroom was also very big and comfortable. They have a little kiosk downstairs that proved extremely helpful. My only suggestion would possibly be to gave 24hr room service. We found that the food service on an evening finished earlier than we would have liked it. But thats because we were never back before 10.30pm! 😅

title: We're coming back!
text:
For our weekend trip to NYC we were looking for cheap and well located airbnb's but couldn't really decide.. I checked Trip Advisor and saw this hotel with a very good price! The location was perfect - right across the S.I. Ferry, next to the subway and a lot of shops, restaurants and so on you could need during your stay. 
For our reservation we called the hotline where Ms. Regina proved so much patience and kindness with us!
The rooms are beautiful! Small, but extremely comfy, clean, bright and well equipped.
Emron (?) at the front desk served us perfectly and was a huge help during our first day. In general the whole staff we met was absolutely open and friendly.
For the next time we won't spend much time on looking for a place to stay, we'll definitely come back!
Big thank you to everyone! :)

title: congrats to Mariela Sanchez
text: my congrats to Mariela Sanchez, she cleaned the room precisely and optimally. Overall staff very courteous, always ready to help you or asking if you need help or how you doing, so I would suggest this hotel, great location and strategics to see Manhattan, subway close to the hotel

title: Toller Service und gute, aber ruhige Lage
text:
Wir hatten einen Kurztrip in NYC gebucht. Der Service war einwandfrei. Unser Zimmer hatte Blick (nicht ganz freien, zwischen zwei Hochhäusern durch) auf den Hudson und Gouvenor Island. Zur Staten Island Ferry und der Metro Station (South Ferry) sind es 2 Gehminuten. Im Hotel gibt es eine Kaffeemaschine, eine Mikrowelle und einen Kühlschrank. Frühstücken kann man ganz gut im "Essen". 
In der Lobby gibt es morgens Gratis-Kaffee und Nachmittags Wasser mit Früchten aromatisiert.
Für uns war es perfekt, um New York zu entdecken.

title: Breakfast was so tasty!
text: Went for breakfast this morning, got a voucher for two of us for 2 days for a great price. Then got a further voucher through the door offering a further discount on our main meal if we posted on insta on Facebook. It’s much easier to eat in the restaurant then to find food places elsewhere! Would definitely recommend!

title: Pleasant, considerate and friendly hotel
text:
Our first time in the united states and i’m glad we stayed here. The hotel was welcoming, helpful and friendly. I had trouble with my credit card upon arrival paying for the incidental hold and rather than embarrass us by demanding another card or method of payment the hotel staff allowed us to our room to sort it out with our bank and to come back down to pay when we were ready. 

I was pleased to find that there was no resort fee at this hotel, just an incidental deposit of $50 a night which is then refunded when you leave if no incidentals were charged.

Every day coming in and out staff would greet us and chat with us. The room was clean, comfy and well heated/cooled. Bathroom was spotless and toiletries were restocked every day. The subway is directly round the corner and Wall St, Statue of Liberty and Staten Island ferry are all within reasonable distance.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn’t mind a bit of subway travel or walking to get to the bigger attractions and to anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan but wants avoid the hustle, noise and tourist trap nature of Times Square.

title: nice hotel
text: La experiencia en general fue muy buena debido a localización, estábamos cerca del metro, cerca a muchos lugares turísticos. La recepcionista parece ser asiática y siempre te mira con una sonrisa. En general fue positivo. No puedo recordar algo malo

title: Great place to stay
text: First off I’d like to say that this is a wonderful location.. even though our stay was only one night I will definitely be staying again.. staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.. The views from the room was awesome as well as clean and comfortable..

title: Great location - small, but nice rooms.
text: The staff is fantastic. They are located very close to the ferry and I was there over what must have been the warmest January in the history of Manhattan. Parking is a bit of an issue, but I was able to find walking distance free parking for the whole weekend so I'm not complaining. Overall a fantastic experience. Probably $25-30 uber all the way up to central park. Anything closer is cheaper

title: Belle situation et bon rapport
text:
Nous étions bien situées à côté du ferry pour Staten Island, du métro. L'accueil est chaleureux, la chambre avec le lit king size est génial ! La chambre est très propre.
Je regrette les verres en plastiques à l'accueil,  les lampes allumées dans la chambre après le passage de la femme de ménage,  pas de notion de ne pas gaspiller l'eau, de ne pas utiliser pour rien les serviettes qui sont changées tous les jours.

title: Exactly what was needed
text: Clean, comfy rooms and really friendly staff. The location was great, so close to the subway and liberty Cruises with Battery Park a stone's throw away. Would absolutely recommend this hotel for a great base to explore NYC

title: Urlaub New York
text: Wir als Familie waren sehr zufrieden. Das Hotel hatte eine sehr ruhige Lage. Personal sehr hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend. Unser Zimmer hatte für eine Familie ausreichend Platz, da es zwei Doppelbetten hatte. Der Kleiderschrank könnte größer sein, was aber für uns nicht schlimm war. Alles in allem ist es dennoch ein sehr gutes Hotel.

title: Great location and very affordable
text: I stayed here while visiting Manhattan for a bender weeekend. It didn't really matter where I stayed, but I found this on a deal online. Super cheap nice room in the financial district. I was able to check in earlier than I even though possible, and the housecleaning was impeccable, working around my nocturnal sleep schedule.

title: Excelente experiencia
text:
Excelente hotel, habitaciones preciosas y nuevas, buenisima vista hacia la bahia, excelente atención de principio a fin, el servicio en habitación de lo mejor. El personal de calidad en su servicio. Si eres hispano hablante no te preocupes, ya que ellos te ayudan en todo para hacer tu estadía placentera y facil (agradezco a Don Martin que siempre estuvo atento en todo momento y dando servicio de calidad).

El entorno, al estar ubicado en Wall Street es muy tranquilo, a unos cuantos metros (cruzando la calle) tienes el subway Whilehall de la linea 1, R y W, ademas Battery Park donde tendras una vista genial a la bahia y estatua de la Libertad, ademas podras tomar el Ferry para ir a Staten Islands (donde encontraras un outlet si te interesa las compras). Esta cerca de la bolsa y del One World Observatory.

Recomendamos al 1000% el hospedarse aca!!!

title: Great Location and VFM
text:
Perfect location, with a view of the water. Comfortable beds with nice linen. Decent shower. All this for a fabulous price. Loads of great bars and restaurants within a 5 min walk 
Recommended . Would definitely return

title: Treated like family.
text: A nine day stay was easy to do given the location and winter pricing.  Hospitality industry is hard.  The staff, in particular housekeeping and the restaurant staff treated us like family from day one and never faltered. The fare was above average and made with love. Remodel scheduling should take care of the few housekeeping issues we noticed and concluding municipal street repairs in front should alleviate some noise encountered in ferry side rooms overlooking the water.  Godspeed!

title: Súper confortable and nice
text:
The hotel is very confortable and the staff is very nice and helpful. Martin and all the staff in the front desk made us  a great stay ,we will come back.
Very well situated in downtown close to attractions and subway.

title: Würde ich immer wieder buchen
text: Die Lage war super und das Zimmer für New Yorker Verhältnisse riesig! Das Hotel liegt im Financial District. In nur 2 Minuten Fußweg erreichen sie verschiedene U-Bahn Stationen, sowie eine Fähre. Das Hotel war sehr sauber und die Angestellten sehr nett und zuvorkommend

title: Perfect location, very friendly staff
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a business trip beginning of January. I definitely enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The price per night was very cheap for NY standards, but that was mainly due to staying there off-season. 

Particularly the location of the hotel is very good, very close to the South Ferry terminal. Multiple stops of the underground are within walking distance (1, R, ...), so you can get everywhere in Manhattan within 30 minutes. Multiple restaurants and shops/supermarkets can be found very close to the hotel. Only disadvantage is that a few of these are closed in the weekend, or only open later in the morning. Another thing to mention, is that the staff is very friendly and helpful, particularly Martin. 

Regarding the hotel room (which is of course the most important): the room was not very big, as could be expected in New York. But it was ok for a few days, the size did not bother me. Beds were very comfortable, and bathroom was also top. The curtains blocked the outside light very well, which is often not the case in other hotels. The bathroom has all the amenities one needs, and there were enough towels available (+ good quality). The water pressure could be maybe a little bit stronger, but again this did not bother me at all. Only negative point, hence the overall rating of 4 stars instead of 5, was that the room was quite noisy due to the airconditioning just outside the hotel. So one might want to avoid staying in room 605, definitely if you are a light sleeper.

title: Choose another hotel!!!
text:
I asked for a room accommodation before my arrival and was told I would receive it but upon my return, I was not given my room accommodation and the person at the front desk said there was only this one room in the entire hotel that was available - BS.

I asked about having some things in my room fixed, and nothing was properly done. The bed made a lot of noise, the lamp didnt work, the charger portal didnt work, the bed had a huge stain on it when we arrived, the hotel said they ran out of toothbrushes in the entire hotel! The room had crumbs on the carpet floor, the door between the microwave and fridge didnt close properly. It was just a ridiculous stay. I absolutely hated my stay. for my experience and service I received, I should have been paying $20/night.

Parking is $50 a night for valet for a smaller car and $60/night for a suv or larger car. The hotel did not provide us with alternative parking, they wanted to force us to only consider the valet option.

title: Perfect spot, near South Seaport and Wall Street
text:
After a few days in Europe, we arrived at JFK and stayed 4 days in this Hotel to rest our Europe trip. Far from the action in midtown, without the hasstle of crowds,  was a great decision. Just in front of Staten Island Ferry, Subway lines 1, W, R and a five minutes walk to 4 and 5 lines, it was a great spot. Also backwards was Wall Street, to the left South Seaport District and to the front the sidewalk to the river with an incredible view to Brooklyn Bridge. Near the area, there's a lot of Taverns with great ambiance and food. We use all time the Subway to go Midtown and Uptown visiting places and friends. We've been several times in New York. Always stay in a different place and area.
This is one of the best hotels we've stayed in NYC. Why? The staff was wonderful, always with a smile; a good morning, good afternoon and good evening. The smile was part of their uniform. I don't know who was the manager, all looked like working as they were. They were very comprehensive, because the vacation became a so so, not fault of the Hotel; in Puerto Rico happened an earthquake in those days, with all our family there. We start to worry and thought to go back as soon as possible.
But, by phone, reach our family and all was alright. We decide to stay but we had mixed feelings. The staff made all possible things for having a pleasant stay. They have coin washer machines and washed all of our clothes. We rest and slept until late but the maid in charge of 11 floor (a nice blond woman that can't took her name), always was checking we were fine. The room 1105 have a nice view to the river and the Staten Island Ferry Terminal. To her, thank you, your customer service makes you a great proffesional. You had a notable empathy.
Martin, thanks for your help and compromise with the customer. Willing to always help and very humble customer service representative.
And Ben, always with a smile in his face. Thanks for the help putting our large luggage in the sidewalk and always doing the best orienting and helping the customer. All the other person's that helped us: thank you. And the manager, I don't know who he was, but congrats for having such a team, all of them! The beautiful ladies in front desk, all of you. Thank you, thank you, thank you for a wonderful stay in such hard time for us.

title: excellent hollidays
text:
I stayed in this hotel 12 nights on christmas hollidays and it was an excellent choice, starting for the room, localization and the stuff, always helpfull and professional. Thank you so much to Victor Hoouseman for the help you are a star :) 
I trully recommend this hotel

title:
New Years Vacation With Our Favorite Hotel Clerk 

“REGINA”!!!!!! 👩🏻‍🦱
text:
My stay at this hotel was amazing especially because of the top notch service I received from the front desk clerk! Her name was Regina and she made our first experience in NYC one we will never forget! She always greeted us with a smile and gave us the best recommendations from anything from where the best affordable places to eat or to the most exciting places to have some fun...! I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone that plans on visiting NYC for any reason especially if you plan on going with your family because the location is away from the crowded streets and is probably the safest part of Manhattan... But the subway station is directly across the street which is where the #1 & #2 train run which will take you anywhere in Manhattan that you need to go because it runs from the tip of the financial district all the way to the north end of the island. So if you want to go to the World Trade Center it’s about a 5 minute ride in the train, Times Square is about 15 minutes, and Central Park is about 20 minutes. Which the #2 or #1 train will take you right too it. Also all the ferries that take you too Eli’s island or Statue of Liberty or both are directly across the street as well... and there is helicopter ride to it as well across the street and pier 17 which is walking distance from the room too has ice skating on a roof top with an amazing view above like 4 floors of restaurants and bars.. You can also see the Brooklyn bridge right from your room and if you walk across it you will have the best pizza or Philly cheese steaks in NYC. If you plan on going to NYC anytime soon this is a must stay location. I’d say it’s the best affordable hotel in Manhattan!! I stayed at the Michelangelo right in Times Square for $1,000 a night and didn’t even get a quilt to sleep with..! I barely paid that for 4 nights at the Hilton and it was very peaceful there!! I liked it because it was in a very nice part of town without thousands of people everywhere but if you wanted to go to Times Square to party it was only a 15 minute ride on the train which was directly across the street..! Then when you were ready to get some rest this hotel was nice and quiet so you wouldn’t have any issues getting rest!! Next time I go I will stay here my entire stay and save a ton of money in comfort!!!! Also the food was excellent as well! 

P.S. 
The photos below are all within 5 minutes of this hotel and the picture of the water was from my window on the 19th floor but you pretty much had the same view on any floor..!

title: location location
text: this place is all about location for tourists. right across the road  is the staten island ferry (free of charge) and the brooklyn bridge  and liberty island are down the road on each side. multiple  small eateries around the area along with the subway but you can easily walk to most tourism areas. the room is small but clean. if you are staying long dont take the room with breakfast option as it is the same breakfast every day and you will get tired eating it.

title: Generally so good. Some additional items may be a little expensive
text: Generally, the Financial District inn is very good and convienient. The location is only 2min away from the Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park and you can even see a view of the sea bay, so it is the best place if you want to stay in the heart of the financial district or next to the bay area. Infrastructures are also very clean. Additional services may cost much. Breakfast is $18 or $23 and it is too expensive. But you may find many more restaurants in the very near district.

title: Restaurant
text:
I have been staying at this hotel over the past 3 months 
My breakfast is beyond amazing 
It’s not just the quality of food but it’s the amazing service 
Everyone is so attentive and friendly 
Special shout out to my freinds Shawn, Vincent, Jordan and argon they are always happy and provide such great service 
Thank you

title: Muy buen Hotel
text:
Es un hotel con habitaciones relativamente nuevas, muy bien aseadas, cerca de estaciones del metro, rodeado de edificios muy bonitos y lugares para comer.

Cerca de la salida para staten island (gratis) y para ver la estatua de la libertad así como del brooklyn bridge al cual se puede llegar caminando desde el hotel.

title: Relación precio calidad excelente
text: Excelente atención , me resultó súper cómodo, la ubicación excelente al lado de dos bocas del metro, la comida del hotel súper rica y en precio, el gimnasio súper completo , y el café gratis a la mañana suplía lo caro del desayuno

title: Unkompliziertes Hotel in toller Lage
text: Hotel mit guter Lage (mehrer Subway-Linien in unmittelbarer Nähe,  Wall Street, Island Ferry und Battery Park ebenso) und dazu freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal am Front Desk. Stimmiges Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text:
The hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms were quite spacious, modern and clean. The location is a real advantage: it combines a quiet area with easy access to any place in NYC thanks to the nearby metro stations. There are some excellent bars within walking distance from the hotel.

Last but not least, the hotel staff really deserves a praise. Their helpfulness was always accompanied by a smile! Thank you!

title: Hotel ótimo, mas localização não tão boa assim
text: O hotel em si é ótimo, porém a localização não é das melhores pra quem vai a turismo. Fica no extremo sul da ilha de Manhattan. Se vc quer fazer compras pela Quinta Avenida, fazer passeios pelo Central Park, enfim, ficar no burburinho de Midtown que é onde ficam a maioria dos pontos turísticos e locais de compra, esse não é o local mais adequado. Tem uma estação de metrô a 2 minutos de caminhada da porta do hotel, e isso te leva pra qualquer canto de Manhattan, mas vc gasta uns 20min pra chegar lá. A região do hotel é o centro financeiro de NY, então a noite fica tudo meio vazio e deserto. Não é nada inseguro, mas se vc busca barzinhos e restaurantes a noite, nessa região não vai encontrar muita coisa. Se vai a negócios, o local é excelente, mas se vai turistar como a maioria dos brasileiros, eu recomendaria ficar mais na área de Midtown, mesmo que vc precise pegar um hotel um pouco inferior.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We stayed here for four nights after Christmas and hand a wonderful stay! We were traveling as a family with our two children ages seven and 12. The location of the hotel is very close to multiple subway stops, restaurants and drug stores But it is very quiet and in a safe area. We were also very close to the Statue of Liberty ferry, the iconic Wall Street bull, Trinity church, and the 911 Memorial.  It took about 15 to 20 minutes to get into Midtown Manhattan from our subway stop And it was very easy for us to navigate. Other than the taxi ride from the airport to the hotel we took the subway or walked the entire time and had no difficulty. The hotel staff was wonderful and accommodating our needs, which included connecting rooms and storing our luggage on the day of departure while we visited the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Comodo e pulito
text: Ottima accoglienza, ci hanno dato la stanza prima dell'orario previsto. Situato in una zona abbastanza tranquilla, accanto a Wall Street e di fronte all'ingresso per i battelli che fanno visita alla Statua della Libertà. La fermata della metro è situata di fronte l'albergo ed è l'ultima fermata della linea che porta alle più importanti zone della città. La sera non c'è molto essendo una zona lavorativa e di uffici in maggioranza. Albergo molto pulito, offrono acqua in dispensar aromatizzata ed al mattino caffè. Stanza pulita, letto supercomodo, bagno pulito con ampia doccia e prodotti da bagno. Ottima la predisposizione alla carica usb in mancanza di prese adatte. Ci ritornerei assolutamente

title: Excelente atención al cliente
text: Recomiendo encarecidamente la estancia en este hotel, y, en especial, la atención de la recepcionista Lee, del botones Martín y del cocinero Saul. Siempre que los hemos necesitado, nos han complacido en todo.

title: Best Hotel Ive Ever Been
text: It was just AMAZING, everything was perfect in our stay, honestly the best hotel ive ever been to.  The room was really good and really clean, we had an amazing view, and rhe 2nd floor restaurant/bar was better than lots of restaurants we visited in NY, me and my gf simply loved our stay! Thank u Hilton Garden FiDi

title: NY trip during Christmas
text: It’s very nice location we loved it. It was our friend’s family group tour. We traveled from PA. It was nice we got room early 12 noon due that we didn’t have any trouble with language and we had resting time prior to roaming around.

title: Great hotel at Financial District!
text: Located in front of Staten Island ferry terminal and beside Battery Park, this hotel had very friendly staffs and clean rooms. Location is very convenient with Subways all around. Eateries are all around!

title: 2nd time I trusted TripAdvisor reviewers (2/2!)
text:
Needed a hotel in the Financial District area for convenience (wedding guest), and this hotel was perfect - located near many subway lines.  The hotel staff were very accomodating and welcoming! The hotel itself is modern and clean. The room and bathroom were together larger than the studio I once lived in in NYC!! Overall the room was great, though the closet/armoir was a bit small (iron in the way). I opted for a city view and was was even able to see a sliver of the water at a certain angle.
Stayed at the hotel for a long weekend, and felt very comfortable and safe. 
Definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Christmas vacation to NYC
text:
Regina was so helpful getting us settled in and making sure our accommodations were correct! Even though she was working on Christmas Eve, she was full of smiles and very helpful! Thank you, Regina and Hilton for such a nice stay! 

TIP: Do NOT use the company that Hilton recommends for shuttle service to the airport. Choose Uber! The driver was dangerous and almost hit a cement wall barrier on the way to the airport and was on his phone the whole drive.

title: Another excellent stay
text: The hotel remains an excellent stay in Lower Manhattan, within an easy walk to the World Trade Center and many of the connection points to Manhattan. The easy in-and-out, excellent restaurant, and close access to other restaurants make this a winner. The rooms are always clean, and any issue addressed promptly.

title: Great hotel
text: This is a really nice hotel. New, clean, modern. Room was a little small for a king bed but the bed was very comfortable and we are used to tight rooms in NYC  Great staff. Great location with  Subway across the street and lots of places to eat nearby. Terrific view overlooking Ellis Island. Good value. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great hotel close to the subway with excellent staff
text:
This hotel was great! Reasonable price, close to subway few stops from center. Breakfast was the best experience due to the superb staff namely Nathan and Agron. They were interested about you not just as a customer. Really appreciated them. Great job! They went the extra mile.
Marcus and Patricia.

title: One night stay
text:
We stayed one night and found the location to be better than the other Hilton locations, only because we love to walk and see the sights.
The price was better than others too.
The closet/wardrobe was a little tight.
Nice hotel, clean, friendly staff, I’d stay there again.

title: Excellent séjour
text: Très propre. Bien situé, proche des Metro pour se rendre partout. Déjeuner bon mais beaucoup trop dispendieux pour ce qu’il est. Hôtel a conseillé, sauf le déjeuner. 60$ le déjeuner pour 2 personnes. Beaucoup trop cher selon moi pour des céréales, muffins et œufs.

title: Поезда в Нью Йорк
text: Отель расположен удачно. Парковка рядом, метро тоже. Экскурсия на статую Свобода начинаются у порога отеля. Несмотря на расположение - юг Манхеттена, тихо в отеле. Завтрак отличный, после завтрака сил хвптало до обеда.

title: Great Staff, ok rooms.
text: Shawn, Vincent, Agdon(not sure of spelling, Nathan, All provided an awesome experience. They were all in the restaurant with Nathan working the bar. Breakfast was very good and if you want to stay close to lower Manhattan, it's great.

title: Great Location in Lower Manhattan (Downtown)
text: This is a location in the heart of the Financial District ("Wall Street") that provides easy access to both Brookyn and to EWR (Newark Airport).  It's blocks from the waterfront which provides nice views from select rooms.  The room I stayed in was small but impeccable--if they've done a recent remodel, I give them special kudos for doing a nice job!  I've stayed in similar places where the work is shoddy and the "upgrades" are suspect.  Overall, I'd recommend this place if you're in town on business or just need a good spot to navigate in any direction.

title: Restaurant/Bar Service levels surpassed expectations
text: We were pleasantly surprised by the super high service levels of everyone on the 2nd floor restaurant/bar. They were quick, went the extra mile, remembered our names and drink preferences and took time to have real conversation. Thank you for making our trip memorable Shawn, Vincent, Argon and Nathan!

title: Good location
text: I really liked the location of this hotel. Within walking distance of two subway lines. And many coffee shops on Broad Street. Plus being in the financial district it was a little quieter than the rest of NY!

title: Great stay, hidden gem.
text: Extremely close to subway and some amazing eateries and shops, including great bagels and an awesome 2 story bookshop in a historic old stone building. The hotel is in a quiet (especially on the weekend) but safe neighborhood.

title: Nice area but small rooms.
text: The area is conveniently located in the financial district of NY, right across the street from Staten Island Ferry and sits in between 2 metro stations. Rooms are nice but extremely small. Guess you get the real NY living experience that way!!

title: Nos alojemos en una habitacion ruidosa y minuscula
text:
habitacion pequeñissima
, no cabian ni dos maletas abiertas al suelo.. en armario no cabia nada porque habia una tabla de planchar y una plancha. solo cabian 2 chaquetas y una maleta. El baño bien. Ruido del pasillo de algun aparato..

title: Great View just above the Staten Island ferry terminal
text: very up to date hotel, very vertical with nice rooms,  very close to subway station and park.  has a computer and printer for airline check in and boarding passes.  nice beds . fast elevators . nice lobby.

title: Best of the mid range hotels downtown
text: Head and shoulders above the Doubletree/Hampton Inns in the neighbourhood. Proper cooked breakfast, decent rooms, handy for transport. And not one, not two, but three elevators (the worst feature of most midrange ‘pencil’ style hotels downtown).

title: Great hotel
text:
Visited November 2019, lovely hotel and really friendly staff. Hotel is within walking distance from tourist attractions and subways near by. Area is nice and quiet and just across the road from Staten Island Ferries. 
Our hotel room was lovely and bed was really comfortable. Would definitely return.

title: Jederzeit gerne wieder!
text:
Sehr gute Lage mit direkter Anbindung zu den U-Bahn-Stationen. Kostenfreie Getränke in der Lobby (Morgens Tee und Kaffee, abends Wasser mit Früchten).
Sauber Zimmer mit einem sehr bequemen Bett.
Jederzeit wieder!

title: Muy buena opción
text: Estuvimos 4 días alojados. Hotel situado en el lower Manhattan. Muy bien conectado. La zona es de negocios (distrito financiero) con lo que ello tiene de bueno. El desayuno es bueno y la atención de Shawn and Vincent excelente. Volveremos!

title: NY family trip
text: Great experience. Hotel is close to Wall Street. Walking distance to lots of great restaurants. The fairy and the subways are minutes away. I will definitely recommend to family and friends. Great hotel, very clean!

title: Super Hotel mit direktem ÖPNV Anschluss
text:
Das Hotel liegt an der Spitze Manhattans, im Umkreis gibt es mehrere U Bahnstationen von verschiedenen Linien. Die anlegestelle der kostenfreien Staten Island Fähre befindet sich in Sichtweite. Die Zimmer sind komfortabel ausgestattet. Erfreulich neben der Kaffeemaschine gibt es auch einen Kühlschrank.
Da einzig Negative. Das Frühstück ist für das angebotene mit 25.- $ pro Person völlig überteuert. Auch unprofesionell. Das Teewasser schmeckt leicht nach Kaffee, da es keine getrennten kannen für Tee und Kaffee gibt.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Great location, good services. Will stay again. Breakfast staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was nice with views and very comfortable beds. Next door to our friends’ apartment so it was very convenient too. Hilton is reliable.

title: Exceptional Hotel in a fantastic location
text: This hotel is a little gem. The staff (Regina) are so friendly and approachable and the location is perfect for subway lines and ferry, hardly any sirens or horns at night so had a great sleep.. you can walk outside and have space to get your bearings rather than just being swept along in a sea of people. rooms are fresh, very clean and comfortable with everything I needed (microwave and fridge were so handy) and easily controllable heating. Overall it was fantastic and as a female solo traveller I’ll definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

title: Great experience
text:
I can’t praise enough how friendly and accommodating the staff is. Everyone!
That already makes it a pleasant stay. 
Also: very clean, great location, good rates, newer facility. The rooms are nicely decorated. Mattress is good, too. I’ll be back on my next trip to NYC.  Thank you!

title: Nice place
text: We wanted to try staying in the financial district this trip and it was a great place to stay.  Close to subway, lots of restaurants, quiet at night.  I am a Hilton Honors member and I always check there first, and I was very happy with the staff and the hotel.  Will stay there again in the future.

title: Amazing Staff!!!!  Found a Home in NYC
text: Just stayed at this beautiful hotel. However, the true beauty of the hotel is their amazing staff! Every single breakfast employee was wonderful. Thank you Saul, Jordan, and Vincent for cooking up such a delicious breakfast for our family! Thank you Agron and Nate for your great wait service! Finally, Thank you Elbert, the restaurant manager, for creating such a welcoming team for breakfast! While I did not catch the names of the front desk staff, they too were outstanding! Can’t imagine staying anywhere else in NYC!!!

title: A WONDERFUL hotel experience.
text: This was without a doubt the BEST hotel experience we had in NYC. The staff was AMAZING, the rooms were clean and bigger than I expected for NYC. The staff accommodated my request for an early check in and a room on their lowest floor...and did I say the staff was AWESOME. The only suggestion would be free breakfast or a package that included breakfast but overall BRAVO!...BRAVO!

title: Wee but Winsome
text: Our quick weekend to see The Lion King led us to another of the Hilton hotels in NYC, where we have always encountered lovely rooms and amenities. Our room at the Hilton Garden Inn at the Financial Center in January was smaller than we had experienced elsewhere, but the positives far surpassed the few negatives. To begin with, the door entry uses an easy touch card instead of a slot.  I loved the ingenuity of the bathroom barn door, leaving lots of space in the bathroom and the hall.  The large shower and the very quiet toilet flush were a bonus, along with the nearly soundless HVAC which was quickly responsive when changing the temperature.  We arrived having walked in the cold for a while, and I was ready for a nice hot tea.  Unfortunately, the coffeemaker did not respond.  I went to the restaurant and An fixed a lovely tray with pot, cup and saucer to take to our room.  As always, the staff was friendly and eager to assist, especially Kelvis and Abdel.  The only hitch was the wardrobe:  just big enough for our two winter coats, but the handles were very difficult to grasp to open the doors (see photo).  All in all, we enjoyed our weekend, and grew to love the neighborhood restaurants and shops.  Surprises were the Bowne & Co. Stationers, Bowne Printing Office, and Trinity Church, where we could see Alexander Hamilton’s tomb and family plots.

title: Good location and nice amenities, but not very friendly staff
text: If you are looking for a Hilton experience at this hotel, the only good thing is location and facility, but the tipical HiltonHonors welcome and friendliness does not exist here. The premium price for a NY location does not pay off here. Hotel is nice and well located, but you will not feel welcomed. I selected it due to location and beause I always go the HILTON chain. Not here the next time. If you do not care about service and just want a nice hotel at good location, this is a good choice.

title: GREAT location in Downtown Manhattan.....
text: GREAT location in Downtown Manhattan......Financial District. The Hotel is steps away from a Subway Station who will take You EVERYWHERE. The Hotel is just 1 year old so everything is relative NEW. No bad smells, no ugly carpets or rear stains. The Breakfast Buffet is really good. Book the room with the breakfast included so You will pay less at the end of the day. No hidden fees or charges. Very, very GOOD Customer Service from ALL the Staff at this Hilton Hotel. A  couple of very nice bars extremely near the Hotel,. Staten Island Ferry, Ferry to Brooklyn or the Water Taxi to the Statue of Liberty CLOSE, CLOSE, CLOSE so the L;OCATION of this Hilton Garden Inn is AMAZING. The RIGHT price to pay for this Hotel should be from $130 to $230 depending on the SEASON.

title: Clean, quick, convenient
text: Located very close to two main subway stations. Easy to get anywhere in the city from here. Centrally located to allow you to visit brooklyn for the day, come back to rest/change, and then go uptown for dinner.

title: Good hotel.  Great breakfast.
text: The Hotel is solid.    There was construction in front of the hotel and it was not easy getting into but that's not the hotels fault.  Rooms are good we had a great view of the East river.  Best party of the stay was the omelet I had for breakfast.   Chef Sean makes an amazing omelet.  The only problem with breakfast is they were out of half and half for the coffee.  Great place to stay when visiting the Statue of Liberty.

title: Friendly, helpful staff, clean hotel
text: The staff was so friendly and accommodating!! We were delayed checking out and the front desk were so understanding and incredibly nice. They were always there to help us out with anything we needed. Hotel was clean and convenient to everywhere. We really enjoyed our visit there! Also great views from 11th floor!  Highly recommend!!

title: Great stay in FiDi
text: The staff and location of the HGI in Manhattan's Financial District are spot on.  Always friendly and efficient.  If you have business in the Financial District, or activities in Battery Park, the Garden Inn is a great choice.

title: Clean, relaxing, superior staff
text: We were excited to find a hotel with 2 double beds for nana and 16yo grandson. This hotel surpassed our expectations for cleanliness, relaxation, and superior staff. A special thanks to restaurant staff Matthew and Ana who went out of their way to make our dinners top notch. On my grandson's birthday, they conjured magic to make him a chocolate and vanilla ice cream parfait.

title: S&P Global Senior Director and Analytical Manager
text: The entire staff was remarkable, and they made our stay in NYC the best we have had in years. As a frequent visitor to lower Manhattan, I appreciate the exceptional service that we received, especially from Nate at breakfast. He was attentive, accommodating, and “sunshine on this dreary day.” Nate represents the Hilton Corporation well and is an excellent example of what superior customer service looks like. Thank you, Nate, and the entire staff of the Hilton Garden Inn Financial Center. This has become my go to spot for future accommodations in lower Manhattan.

title: Hilton Garden Inn
text: Nice price compared to other Hilton’s in NYC. Our room had a view of the States Island Ferry. I liked the location close to subway stops, the Brooklyn Bridge, and Battery Park. We walked from our hotel to Ground Zero our first night in NYC. The rooms are smaller but to be expected in NYC. Clean and comfortable as well.

title: Very happy
text:
Very nice, new, clean hotel near the Staten Island ferry. 

My gold membership was acknowledged and I received free buffet breakfast and an upgrade to a high floor with river views.

The room was sparkling new and very clean.

I knew the hotel wouldn't be in the most amazing tourist area, but it was perfectly fine for exploring downtown NYC, and a few stops on the subway from Midtown Manhattan. Quiet at night.

title: Very clean!
text: Hotel was very clean, employees were nice, prompt service. After check out our bags were stored until we needed to go to airport. Hotel is confidently located to subway and Staten Island ferry. Would definitely come back to this hotel again.

title: Best Manager Max
text: This is the best hotel in downtown NYC.  Max is great. He actually printed documents out and reloaded the printer    Regina at the front desk is also great    Excellent Restuarant    Clean and accessible and has a great view. Of the water and the ferry.  I will stay there again no doubt.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Overall the experience was excellent. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean and well maintained. This was for business so I was the only person staying in my room. If I need to come back again for meetings in the Financial District I will stay at this hotel for sure.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: We were here with my family for 3 nights in October 2019. The area is very nice and quiet, the staff was professional and friendly and the service was excellent. Special thanks to waitress Efe, who was so warm-hearted and kind to us.

title: Best in class service for Hilton
text: Service was best I’ve had in a NYC Hilton. I had Breakfast / Dinner and stayed for just a few nights. Check in was super efficient, breakfast (specials) were creative. I’ll try and stay here again. Thank you!

title: Great Staff
text: Excellent Hospitality!!!!!! I was extremely happy with my stay at The Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/ Manhattan Downtown....The food was very good and the service was execptional. The staff I spoked with were very helpful friendly and very professional.. Tiffanie, Gabby, Shawn, Savl, Max and Jonathan. I miss you guys! Thanks Again for your Hospitality!

title: Great getaway
text: Needed a quick, one night stay in conjunction with a family Birthday celebration. This Hilton was the perfect spot. Great location on the water, right across from the ferry terminal. Beautiful room, very clean with nice amenities, and spectacular views of the water. Excellent value for the money, especially compared to other, nearby hotels. Super friendly staff, especially Kelvin, at the front desk. He made us feel welcomed, and informed us on the local attractions to make sure we were all set for dinner, etc. Checkout wasn't until 11:00, and they provide a secure place to hold your luggage for no charge. Being able to head out for brunch without having to lug around our suitcase and local purchases was a beneficial courtesy. Hopefully, the GM, Mr. Elbardei, appreciates the great staff he has.
