Besides Kelvin, everyone we met was friendly and courteous. We will definitely be staying here again.

title: 舒適及方便
text: 飯店的服務人員非常親切及友善，打掃房間的清潔度非常乾淨，房間舒適，地點方便且能放心的使用飯店設施，非常值得再來！

title: Great Dinner at Hilton Garden Inn
text:
Shout out to Matthew and Willie for a great dinner last night.  We went to the restaurant and had a good bottle of wine.  Our waiter was very helpful and honest about what we should have for dinner.

The chef had made his own marinade for ribs and they were the best I have had in a long time.  My friend had the chicken sandwich and he said it was good but he wished he had also gotten the ribs.

Don't miss the vanilla crunch cake, it was the perfect way to end the meal.

Thanks again for a fun, relaxing and excellent meal.

title: Great Stay
text: We loved our stay in the FD. The hotel was convenient, clean and the staff was very helpful. We left a nice pair of sunglasses in our room but didn’t realize until we were at the airport. My husband called & asked them to look in the room. They found them & had them sent FedEx overnight to our home!

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text:
This hotel is in a prime location for business or sightseeing - the staff are really friendly and helpful and the attached Italian restaurant is decent too. Perfect for a short NYC trip.

As it’s in the financial district expect the area to be quiet at weekends - however that’s a good thing in a lot of ways!

title: Southern Ribs in NYC
text: Hotel was clean and the people friendly and helpful.  One of the best surprises though were "Willy's Ribs" in their restaurant one evening.  Having had ribs over the years in places like Memphis, New Orleans and Texas...I was very surprised that the ribs I had at this hotel were outstanding!  Wasn't expecting that, but they were 'falling off the bone' delicious and couldn't have been better!  This hotel has good food....but these ribs stood out for a super star rating....6 stars....not just 5!

title: Great stay!
text: Very comfortable and clean space to stay in. A group rate made it affordable for me. The location is terrific! Good to be near South Ferry as well as Wall St and the World Trade Tower area. Would come here again if the price is right.

title: Great Value
text: We were welcomed with friendly staff. They took our bags & then told us where the bathrooms were.  The front desk person read my mind. The room was very quiet & comfortable. Great location & value for our money.

title: Fantastic
text: Our first time in NYC but we were very happy with this hotel. I’d chosen a room on the app in advance as a Hilton member, but the front desk upgraded us to a “better”!room and it certainly was! Room 2907 was the top floor with an amazing view of the east River and the Staten Island ferry.  The room was specious enough for us although the wardrobe was tiny! It was clean, had a king size bed and the a/c worked perfectly. We didn’t eat breakfast at the hotel as we wanted to try local deli’s and didn’t  use the bar either as we were out on each  of our 4 nights. The front desk staff were great and helped us to sort out a metro card for the bus and also to arrange a car back to the airport. They always said hello whenever we came in and we’re a pleasure to deal with. We liked staying in a quieter area of the city and used the local M15 bus to get to Midtown, which was fine and only took 45 mins. We liked being near the water and popped on the Staten Island ferry and the east River ferry over the Brooklyn. Local bars and restaurants were within easy walking distance as is the 9/11 museum and memorial, and Battery park. We were more than happy with the hotel and would happily recommend it as a base to stay away from the madness of the Time Square area.

title: Ótima opção de hotel
text: Ótima opção seguindo o padrão da rede Hilton Garden Inn. Funcionários simpáticos e atenciosos, ótimas instalações e a localização do hotel é perfeita, com as linhas do metrô 1 e R/W a uma quadra de distância. Alguns outros pontos positivos: hotel possui lavanderia e academia, os quartos são espaçosos e o hotel conta com 3 elevadores, o que evita congestionamentos durante os horários de pico. Destaque para a srta. Lee da recepção. Podem ir tranquilos, eu recomendo.

title: Garden Grill - Anna and Matthew
text: The food and service at the Garden Grill was great every night.  Anna and Matthew made it feel more friendly and welcoming environment each night.  They work with any diet the best they can. Thank you for the great time.

title: Well Appointed and Sizable Room
text: If you visit NYC and stay in a hotel, you know that some rooms are stiflingly small. Not here! Great size, comfy and pristine beds, and a shower to die for!  The hotel reception personnel went above and beyond requirements to ensure a pleasurable stay. The 2nd Floor restaurant has ample and the food was surprisingly fresh and delicious. The service not so much. They were very short-staffed on my recent visit. I waited for nearly two hours for a salad with grilled chicken. I mentioned my concerns and the inability to be served in a reasonable amount of time at the two meals I ordered. The manager removed my breakfast charge as I had to leave before getting a complete meal and I was there for quite a while. Overall this is a wonderful hotel and notwithstanding the staffing problem, it was one of my nicest hotel experiences in the city in decades. I will return again.

title: Nice hotel and staff
text: The hotel was in a great location - right across the street from the subway. It was downtown so at night during the weekends it was quiet. We were up on the 29th floor with a water view which was worth it. Room was clean and had enough room for the two of us. I liked that they had a regular trash and one for recycling. Closet was small but not a deal breaker. There were also two drawers for clothes. The microwave was a nice touch. We appreciated the free WiFi and bottles of water (silver level Hilton members). Bed and pillows were comfortable. All staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Price was good and we would stay here again.

title: Great location
text: We stayed for 2 nights in a twin double bed room with water view. Room was compact but clean. As a base in Lower Manhattan, the location was perfect. Front desk staff friendly. Could not have asked for more. Recommended.

title: On-Site Restaurant Hidden Gem
text:
I've stayed at this hotel many times - quality and cleanliness of the rooms and restaurant is always great. Love the made to order hot breakfast. Dinner always has the dependable standbys - and be sure to check out the nightly specials. Chef Willie serves some really great comfort food dishes. For example, last week - Baby Back Ribs that were as good as (if not better) than any I've had in the deep south. The week before, lamb kabobs with paneer curry that rivaled any Mediterranean restaurant. When you don't want anything fancy, the burgers are as good as any downtown tavern. While you are there, be sure to say hello to Matthew, tending bar. He knows his regulars well and greats me with my anticipated drink order by the time I've barely arrived at my table.
Hotel is one block from subway station. Very safe area of the city.

title: Excellent hotel option
text:
I very much enjoyed my stay at this Hilton Garden Inn. While the room was typically small (like most new hotels in NYC), it was functional for my purpose. The only big problem was the size of the closet, which barely held three shirts along with the full size ironing board. The bed and pillows were comfortable, and there was little outside noise for a hotel in NYC.

The hotel was very accommodating with my early check-in, which was helpful after a cross-country overnight flight. The breakfast was pretty standard for HGI's, but the chef cooked my eggs perfectly.

The hotel is also directly across the street from a Financial District subway station, which made it convenient to get to Times Square to meet coworkers and to Brooklyn to visit my client.

title: Great hotel
text:
loved my view and the restaurant was friendly and food yummy, good service and clean room

the restaurant service with Shawn and Vincent was especially good at breakfast, early morning due to work but they were ready for me!

title: Weekend getaway
text: Most of the staff was very pleasant and friendly. Check in was great. Valet parking was convenient. One guy at the front desk later that evening was rather abrasive. It was a very convenient location for what we were there to see.

title: Great Staff!
text: The hotel seems typical for a New York City hotel; the standard rooms seem small, but nevertheless sufficient. However, what stands out - and this seems to be true across the spectrum of Hilton Garden Inn hotels - the personnel are incredibly friendly and helpful. In this case, I mention Regina, Lee and Brandon as being particularly helpful and pleasant - kudos to them!

title: Small Room Near Battery Park & Financial District
text:
The Manhattan Hilton Financail District is located conviently near the Ferry Terminal, Battery Park and at the south end of the Financial District. The hotel is well appointed and is well maintained; however the guest rooms are tiny. If you need a one or two night stay and need to be in this location then this hotel would be could for you; however if you like a litle space to stretch out or do some work these rooms accomaditing. 
If you are driving to this hotel and need to park your car be sure to check local garages ahead of time as rates around this hotel range from $30-$80 per day.

title: Lots of problems. Key card never worked. Smelly sheets. Service ignore the problems.
text: This place needs to learn from its mistakes. Every time I went to my room someone had to meet me to let me in. Several times it took 10-15 minutes. When I got into bed the comforter smelled like sweat. Whenever I talked to the staff they did not help me.

title: Great experience, definitely recommend
text:
I really enjoyed my stay here. Check in was easy and the room was clean and modern. The location is right down at the bottom of Manhattan so you are near the Trade Center, Battery Park, South Street Seaport and the Staten Island Ferry. Highly suggest walking to Stone Street nearby for all the bars and restaurants. Many subways run through the area and can be taken uptown to other touristy sights.
I would definitely stay again.

title: My first experience
text: For this being my first time here it was a very pleasant experience.. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I had the Eggs Benedict with crab and my boys had the regular breakfast. The danishes and muffins we fresh as was the fruit .... Chef’s Shawn & Saul were great as well as the rest of the staff Efe and Tiffanie ... This will not be my last visit to the Hilton Garden Inn ........

title: Great location, great service, great rooms
text: First time in New York and we are so happy we chose this hotel for our stay. We spent a week here and truly loved the experience. The staff are friendly and will assist with any request. Check in was easy and quick and we received an upgrade to room with water view. The rooms are spacious enough with the lobby being a cosy and comfortable waiting area. The free morning coffee and afternoon flavoured waters are a nice touch. The hotel is in a great quiet and safe location and within short walking distance to many of the sights in Lower Manhatten. There are 2 subway stations across the road making the rest of Manhatten easily accessed. The hotel is around the corner from old New York that has a village feel with many eateries close by and far from the busy crowds in the mid town/Times square area. So glad we chose this hotel and would definitely recommend to anyone travelling to New York.

title: Tunnel2Tower Race
text: This hotel is awesome! Everyone at the from desk was so kind and happy and helpful. Regina, in particular, was fantastic. We needed a late checkout and that was no problem at all. The hotel is clean and the rooms are comfy. Great stay!

title: One night stay
text: Stayed at this hotel on September 15th prior to our cruise out of Brooklyn port on the on the 16th. Check in was quick. Staff were great. Told us places of interest within walking distance of hotel. Our room was very clean and had a great city view. Would recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to be in the area.

title: Pretty crappy even for NYC
text: I accept this is NYC. But my check in experience was awful. Took 20 mins to find my reservation and check me in, making me late for a meeting. I had requested a soft mattress or a mattress topper but they didn't have any. Was allegedly upgraded as i am HH Gold, but room was very basic. Just not really what u expect from Hilton and not the experience u expect as HH Gold member. Wouldn't come again or recommend tbh.

title: Wonderful service and very nice facility
text:
Lovely comfortable hotel steps away from the staten island ferry terminal at the southern most tip of Manhattan island.  Rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet (I am on 27 floor...not sure about low levels).  Staff is wonderfully nice and helpful.  Shawn and Vincent who work in kitchen on the the 2nd floor make the best breakfast and always put a smile on my face with their excellent service.  Each day I seem to have some special request and they always take care of me with a smile.  A+++

Oh and laundry on site, gym on site, restaurant and bar on site.  All excellent!

title: A reliable point in the Financial District.
text: Room 1308. Nice view on Water St. The room is fine, the look suggests relax. It is clean, some minor problem has been fixed immediately by an efficient staff. The restaurant offers a short, but nice menu. The meals were properly made. Also breakfast has been great. Finally, all the staff has been genuine, supportive and friendly which is gold today. The hotel is yards from the line R subway station.

title: Top notch service, cleanest room, and friendliest staff
text: Being from the south, we were not expecting “southern” hospitality in a NYC hotel, but let me just say, hands down the nicest and friendliest staff we’ve ever had.  I can’t say enough nice things about the restaurant staff and management.  The food and service were amazing!  Efe was on top of her game, she remembered our names, room and everything we liked.  Shawn, Vincent, and  Saul cooked up some of the best omelets ever and they came out to visit with us and really made us feel welcome.  And, as for managers, Elbert leads by example.  Elbert has one of the friendliest and most genuine personalities and always made us feel like family when in his restaurant.  We could not have been happier with how we were treated, as we are leaving feeling as if we have new family.

title: San Gennaro weekend
text: We had a very nice stay, hotels clean and very friendly staff. Parking was very convenient. We went to the San gennaro festival and had Sunday jog and battery Park. Transportation is very convenient..

title: Across from 1 NYP
text: Hilton Diamond and Marriott Titanium traveler loves this hotel.  Was not impressed with the "reasonable" hotel offerings in NYC Financial District, but finally gave the HGI a shot and was amazingly surprised. Very clean, the staff is very courteous and above all the breakfast rocks! The wait staff and chefs Shawn and Vincent knocked it out of the park.

title: soggiorno new york
text:
hotel estremamente pulito comodo e in una posizione strategica.
camera insonorizzata vista fiume. stazione metro a 100metri dall'hotel. personale molto professionale e motivato. Rapporto qualita'/prezzo accettabile.

title: Decent
text: Thermostat didnt work. Had to have maintenance come to change temp, eventhough the thermostat allows for changes. I tried to increase the room temp from 67 to 71 before leaving for the evening.  When I returned the room temp was 55!

title: Relaxing visit to NYC
text:
Shout out to whoever does the hiring at this hotel! We had a great 5 day stay and really lucked out on the service from your hotel staff. Efe, Shaun, Vincent, Wilkins, and Tiffany took such great care of us at breakfast. Also,  the front desk personnel were very quick to react when we had an issue with the sink in our room. 

We have stayed in other NYC area hotels, but will most definitely call this one home next time we are in town.

title: Always Return to This Hotel - The staff is the Best!!
text: I again have to stress that this is my go to hotel when in NYC FiDI. I am a Hilton Honors Diamond Member and Marriott/BonVoy Platinum member so I have my choice of hotels in NYC. The staff at this establishment is the reason we choose this hotel EVERY TIME. The kitchen staff is like no other, starting with Elbert the manager and Egran the server. The cooks Shaun, Willie, Ann and John are amazing. Mathew, who manages the bar at night, always goes above and beyond and Anna also treats us special. If you want to be treated like family from check-in to check-out, there is no reason to look for any further than this hotel.

title: Great location with Lots to do!!
text: Located in NYC but not with the feel of craziness. Front desk and restaurant staff were very helpful and accommodating. Right across the street from the Gov Island Ferry. Tons a restaurants and bars within walking distance. Great spot would definitely recommend and go back!

title: Emplacement top mais le reste très décevant
text:
L'emplacement est idéal à Manhattan, accès FERRY, métro etc, mais déçus de l'hôtel et du personnel. Extrêmement bruyant la nuit , très gênant , personnel hermétique. Avons du changer de chambre cause douche défectueuse et sol inondé.
Le personnel n'est pas à l'écoute. 
Rapport qualité prix médiocre.
Hôtel vieillissant et mal entretenu.
Draps empestent la javel, rugueux et irritants pour les peux sensibles. Idem serviettes de bain et de toilette.
Pas de pression dans la douche. Eau tiédasse.
Seul atout l'emplacement. Je déconseille pour tout le reste. Hyper cher, on s'attend à autre chose pour un Hilton !! Celui de Double Tree est nettement mieux !

title: New, clean and functional
text: Newer HGI property I used twice this week situated near two subway stations at the Staten Island Ferry Terminal. A negotiated rate with our corporate HQ around the corner makes this a smart choice. Rooms are typically sized for New York, with furnishings in good condition. The basement gym is also consistent with the HGI brand, while breakfast was served with a smile by Efe and her colleagues. It seems rooms on the front have noisier PTAC heating and air conditioning units, while ones one the back have quieter VTAC ones. I chose rear-facing rooms ending in 01 and 09, since a restful sleep is worth more to me than a semi-obstructed water view.

title: Ottimo hotel
text: Sono stato a NY tantissime volte e non avevo mai soggiornato prima nella downtown. Devo dire di esserne rimasto entusiasta. Questo hotel è posizionato di fronte alla stazione di partenza del traghetto per Staten Island.  Camere spaziose, pulite e confortevoli. Personale qualificato e disponibile. Ci ritornerò

title: Great stay and would return
text: Loved the Hilton Garden Inn FiDi.   The location is awesome.    Close to Battery Park and numerous subway stops nearby.   Also lots of great restaurants in the area as well.    Rooms were very clean.   Bed was very comfortable.    Shower was great.    Staff was very friendly.   No complaints at all.    Would definitely stay here again.    It will probably be the first place I check out next time.

title: Great Customer Service
text:
Our stay was great. Regina at the front desk was AWESOME! All of my guests raved about how great her customer service was, we really appreciated it. 

Only thing that stood out was that our bathroom in room 1906 smelt like a locker room, it wasn't unbearable but you could definitely smell the odor. 

But other than that, our stay was really great. Thank you!

title: actual address is 45 e 33rd street
text:
very convenient to subway. we stayed for us open. if you want to experience tiny home living here is your chance. room is about 180 sq ft. bed, bathroom, mini-fridge, microwave and desk. 
staff is nice and helpful. room was clean.

title: Great Location
text:
Shawn  at the 2 FL  restaurant saved this Hotel from getting a lower rating. The entire wait staff was very friendly, but Shawn went out of his way to make my breakfast special.
My room looked clean, the bed was comfortable, however; the room had a stale odor. Could have been easily fix by air freshener. When I got in the small fridge was left open, all the drawers were left open, as if the cleaning crew forgot to closed them when they were cleaning, strange. No big deal since the room was clean, but the stale smell took way from the room cleanliness. The TV didn't turn on when I wanted to see the news about hurricane Dorian hitting FL. Not a big deal, but for a $277.75 per night room, you expect a working tv and clean smelling room. The other problem when the 1st room they gave my with the king bed I reserved smelled like cigarettes , so they moved me to another room with twin beds with the stale odor I mentioned above. Not cool for $277.75 . Thanks to Shawn, my negative experience was 'forgotten' by his attention to detail and great breakfast.

title: Great visit
text: Our family loved this visit. We stayed here for easy proximity to ferry to Statue of Liberty. The breakfast (included with our stay) was excellent. Agron, Shawn and Vincent were wonderful (great food and super friendly). Everyone at the front desk were helpful and good humored.

title: Girls NYC Trip 2019
text: We loved the Hilton Garden Inn. It was very convenient to the train & subway. The staff was great. We got in early & they stored our luggage so we could start our trip. We got in late for check in & Gabriela at the front desk was awesome.  She comped us breakfast that we did not expect. I  would recommend this for anyone who is wanting to stay away from the hustle & bustle of Time Square.  The hotel was beautiful, very clean, & really up to date.

title: Superb!!! Can’t praise the staff and facilities enough, great.
text: This hotel, although away from the main attractions is ideal for those wishing to still have that New York City feel (with it being in the high rise financial district) but away from the main hustle and bustle of Uptown. The hotel breakfast (of which there is continental or cooked) although looked delicious was a little on the expensive side for our budget so we chose to eat in town as there were restaurants, cafes and diners within 5 minutes walk.

title: 나쁘지 않았어요.
text:
1. 체류기간: 2박 3일(2019년 8월 말)

2. 방: 25층 바다가 보이는 킹베드 1개

3. 이용 후기 요약: 

 카드로 결제할 때 제가 알고 있던 가격보다 더 많이 나오길래
눈탱이 먹이는 줄 알았는데 1박당 $50의 보증금이 있습니다.
대략 2주 후에 보증금 확인 가능하다고 하네요.
이 호텔을 이용하고 2주가 지나지 않아서 아직 확인 불가합니다.

 한국인 직원분이 계셨고 이분 덕분에
정말 좋은 서비스를 받았습니다(정말 고마웠습니다).
그 외에 다른 직원분들은 그닥...
다른 손님들한테는 정중하게 인사하던데 ...왜??

 세탁기 사용은 동전 쿼터(25센트)만 가능하고
동전이 없어도 현금 들고 프런트에서 바꿔달라고 하면 해주고요.
건조기 있습니다. 그런데, 세탁기를 사용했는데
세탁기가 이상하게 작동해서 헹굼이 제대로 되지 않았습니다.
그래서 그냥 손빨래 했고요.
옷은 건조기를 사용하면 안되는 재질이라서
건조기는 사용하지 않았습니다.
헬스장은 정말 조그만합니다.

 2층에 식당이 있는데 이용하지 않았고요.
방으로도 식사 요청할 수 있지만 저는 신청하지 않았습니다.
고층이 29층까지 있는데 엘레베이터 속도 빠릅니다.
올라갈 때 귀가 먹먹할 정도로 엘레베이터 속도는 빠릅니다.

 미니바에는 아무것도 없습니다.
물이 냉장고가 아닌 TV 옆에 놓여져 있는데 개당 $3 였습니다.
프런트에 간단한 과자와 음료수를 팔긴 하지만
호텔 주변에 음식점이나 편의시설이 많기 때문에 추천하지 않아요. 물론 프런트에서 파는 거는 비쌉니다. 그리고,
로비에 인터넷 가능한 컴퓨터 3대가 있고요.
프린터는 사용하지는 않았지만 프린터기가 있습니다.
USB 포트가 있는지는 확인 못했습니다.

 뉴욕 지도나 그 외 뉴욕 관련 브로슈어가 프런트에 있으니
필요하면 달라고 하시면 됩니다. 
아니면 본인이 보고서 달라고 하셔도 되고요.
방 열쇠는 키가 아니라 카드입니다.
센서로 문을 열고 닫는 방식이고요. 
이 카드가 있어야 세탁실, 헬스장 등등 이용할 수 있다는 거
알아두시고요. 

 저는 바다가 보이는 방으로 이용했는데 
앞에 원 뉴욕 플라자 건물이 있어서 그 건물 옆으로만 물을 볼 수
있었습니다. 방은 그리 크진 않습니다.
욕실 용품은 뉴트로지나고요.
샴푸, 린스, 바디로션, 샤워실용 비누, 기본 비누, 헤어드라이어가
비치되어 있습니다.
샤워타월 3개, 풋 타월 1개, 핸드타월 5개(이거는 헷갈림) 있습니다.

다리미, 다리미 판, 간이 의자, 세탁 봉지, 세탁물 표시 용지, 옷걸이
여러개 있고요. 에어컨 빵빵합니다. 물론 조절 가능합니다.

한국분들이 사용한 후기가 많지 않아서 최대한 제가 아는 선에서
자세하게 적으려고 노력했습니다.

이 호텔에 대한 점수를 약하게 주는 이유는
제가 감정이 메마른 놈이라서 그렇습니다.
그리고 이런 것들은 주관적이라고 생각하기 때문에
모든 사람들에게 똑같이 적용이 되지는 않다고 생각합니다.

아무튼 길이 길었는데 읽어주셔서 감사하고
좋은 여행 추억 만드시길 바랍니다. 안녕!

title: Séjour de 10 jours
text: Hôtel très bien situé, en face des lignes de métro ainsi que du ferry. La chambre était propre et le personnel très aimable (ne parlant pas très bien l'anglais ils ont fait l'effort de parler francais). Le restaurant de l'hôtel est bon et les prix tout a fait correct.

title: Welcoming,immaculent,great location hotel !
text: A warm welcome from Lee ,who remembered our names and acknowledge us every time we came and went by name. Our large room was extremely clean, fine linens and view.The location was perfect for myself and grandson to sight see taking tours across the street from Battery Park to Stature of Liberty and Ellis island and financial district.

title: Great Service, Pleasant Staff
text: I stayed in New York for a few days. We chose to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn on Water St. One of the luxuries was the breakfast and staff. I would suggest having breakfast here before starting your day. We enjoyed breakfast each morning of our stay from Vincent and Shawn. They were quick and accommodating. Thanks!

title: One night stay at Hilton Manhattan downtown
text: I stayed here with my wife for one night, we booked the night late and came to sleep only but the room was great quit comfortable and very clean, also the location was great. I would be happy to stay in this hotel again.

title: Breakfast w/ Chef Shawn
text: Great customer service and very helpful. Almost no wait for cook to order, awesome timing. All with very fresh ingredients and tasty. Everything was placed conveniently. The staff was funny & friendly. Thank you for the great experience !

title: Great hotel, excellent service!!
text: I have been staying at this hotel very frequently for the past 6 months and the entire month of August. The property is far superior to the other hotels nearby - trust me, I have stayed in them all! The hotel is newer or recently refreshed which is great! Rooms are spacious and clean, and the the front desk staff are super nice and accommodating. Best part of staying here for me though are Matt and Willie in the restaurant. I am frequently at my client 10+ hour days, and so I usually arrive right before they close. Some places give you attitude for coming in late, but my server Matt is always smiling and always takes great care of me. The chef Willie also never grumbles about staying late and makes some seriously delicious food. When I am working in this part of NYC, I will not stay anywhere else! Thanks to all of the staff for making this truly a home away from home!

title: Delicious and friendly staff
text: Had a wonderful meal at their dining room. Efe was extremely friendly and helpful and Shawn the chef was very accommodating to our very specific order. Overall, a delicious meal. Would eat here again!

title: バスタブないって言われた
text: バスタブあると思って予約したのですがないって言われました。またシティービューを指定したのに全く、どこが！？ って感じなので敢えて指定するのはやめておいたほうがいいかと。前半は自由の女神やブルックリンなどの観光を予定してたのでここに決めたのですが静かでよかった。夜遅くまで開いてるお店は少ないのでデュエインリード(24h)にお世話になりまくりました。

title: Très bien situé. Vue sur L'Hudson !
text: Accueil en français : le seul de notre voyage d'un mois aux Etats-Unis ! Belle vue sur l'Hudson. Chambres  modernes et propres. Un super petit-déj. qui vaut bien $23 : un cuisinier qui réalise des plats à la demande. Un régal ! Attention : chambre avec "city view" bruyante. Chambre 2 lits pour 4 : trop petite (pas la place pour 4 valises sur le sol).

title: Great stay once again
text: Great stay once again! This was my second summer staying at this location, and once again, I was extremely satisfied! Perfect location, clean, friendly, and quiet.  It's near so many subway lines, it's easy to get anywhere you want in the city.

title: Good services
text: As we had a 4night stay the staff was very friendly and helping we enjoy our stay as connected to Subways so that's a big benefit for us and cost effective.keep it Up Hilton .food around there is easy accessible

title: Favorite Hilton Property in NYC
text:
I travel to NYC on a regular basis and have stayed in quite a few of the Hilton properties in the city. I find myself always coming back to the HGI FiDi because it has everything I look for in a hotel. The staff is always friendly and helpful, the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in at a hotel, the fitness center is adequate for keeping in shape, the location is ideally situated downtown with some great views, and as an added bonus they have in-house coin operated laundry machines.

But, what really takes the cake for me is the breakfast at the Garden Inn. There are a handful of really awesome options that you don't normally find at your standard hotel breakfast. My personal favorite is the Huevos Rancheros. It is consistently delicious every day of the week and you can even specify how spicy you want it. If you get the chance, talk to Elbert - the head of dining at the hotel - to describe to you what he puts into the sauces. It is evident that food is his passion and it really shows in the quality of the food. Even the presentation of the food is exceptional, making for an awesome experience. I have not eaten at the restaurant for Dinner, but I can imagine that it would be just as good. If you get a chance, you might want to check out their taco Tuesday

title: Best service with Efe, Shawn, and Saul
text: As diamond members, we travel to a ton of Hilton’s. They are always great, but the service at the restaurant for breakfast was amazing. The waitress Efe was AMAZING—so kind— and Shawn & Saul made the best breakfast! Thank you for making our stay such a treat!

title: You Service is the best ever
text: You are the best poeple I’ve ever met thank you for your services i wish i could stay more with you but i can’t your kitchen is on top i wish it stay the same way when i come back because i will coming more often! And i want to take a minute to congratulate the front desk ! They are the best only the best !

title: Battery Park
text: Battery Park was exceptional.  So much withing walking distance and incredible views.  The harbor was grand and the weather was wonderful.  We could watch the Staten Island Ferry come and go.  The view of the Statue of Liberty was one block.  Historical buildings all around.

title: A Real Gem!
text: I was pleasantly surprised at how great this hotel was.  It appears to be recently renovated and the rooms were nice, fresh and modern.  We had a great view of the river. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Ordered room service and it was fast and very good.  It is right across the street from Battery Park and the Staten Island Ferry Station.  Will definitely come back!

title: Thieves !!!! GO ELSEWHERE
text:
It is a really nice hotel and nice location.

However- they are thieves and I am very upset about this.

We checked out at 1pm on August 11th and forgot that we left a bag containing a pair of sneakers and three hats. We called them ASAP and they said they will look into this. We were told that a manager will call us back. We did not receive a call and had to call back. We were told the cleaning ladies did not see anything left behind. This is complete B.S! We were shocked that in a matter of hours a bag with sneakers and hats were “not found”. 

We asked to speak to the manager ......he called us back and said that they did not find anything . This is not an establishment that I would recommend to anyone. These people are dishonest and thieves. Highly upset about this.

title: Great stay
text: The hotel is within close proximity of the MTA subway and the Staten Island Ferry boarding station.  The overall check in and check out process was seamless.  When comparing the room size to my experience in Times Square, I would say the Hilton Garden is definitely catered to the business traveler.  However, the amenities will still work well for friends and couples.  There is a restaurant on the 2nd floor that serves breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks.  Light refreshments (water & cookies) were in the lobby waiting area.  Convenience snack area is next to the receptionist counter.  The “business center” is nothing spectacular but located conveniently to the side of the lobby area.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel at south end of manhattan. My first trip to nyc and the staff was great. Inquired about leaving bags there for the day and they were more than pleased to hold them until 10:30 that night. .

title: Great weekend stay!
text: Clean, fresh property close to the major cultural landmarks and several subway stations. Friendly and helpful front desk staff went above and beyond to assist with every request we had. Breakfast was tasty and service was fast at the restaurant located on the 2nd floor

title: Hilton Garden Inn Hotel
text: This was my best experience of staying at a hotel ever in my entire life. They did everything than coming to my house to take me to their hotel. The Hilton is modern, elegant and clean. The staff is knowledgeable and act as a concierge for your stay.

title: Awesome!!!
text: Stayed here for a night while in town for business; Amenities were great, room was clean and the customer service was unparalleled. Regina at the front desk in particular was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Definitely will stay here next time I’m in town!

title: The staff at the restaurant gave us excellent service, especially breakfast
text: Shawn & Vincent, the cooks at the breakfast were  excellent, they took care of our needs and requests with a smile. The waiters were also courteous and very helpful. The rooms were clean, and the bay views were amazing from the hotel windows

title: Bon plan
text: Un hotel très bien dans Financial district, donc un endroit plus calme en comparaison de beaucoup d'endroit dans Manhattan.A 2 pas de l'embarcadère  pour la statut de la liberté et au début de Broadway. Une ligne de métro pas loin. Donc pratique, avec des chambres agréables, propres. Bref, un bon plan

title: Clean, Comfortable and Great Service
text: Great place to stay while in New York. Parking garage nearby with reasonable rates. Front desk at the hotel were very nice and helpful. Rooms were a good size and very clean. Walking distance to subway, 911 memorial and restaurants. Would definitely stay here again when in New York.

title: Awesome staff and great experience overall
text: This truly was my very best hotel experience ever! The staff was, by far, the most friendliest and helpful that I have ever encountered - especially Brandon! Clean rooms - great sleep! I cannot say enough good things! A+

title: Efe waitress at Hilton Garden Inn
text:
Great waitress Efe in the cafe!
8/10/19.  Very pleasant and personable. Food was great!  Nice room.  Great view.  Need exhaust fan in bathroom.  Beds were very comfortable.  Rooms (4 of us) was a bit tight, but very clean and comfortable.

title: Efe from Hilton Garden inn New York Financial Center Manhattan/Downtown
text:
Efe, is this beautiful kind lady from Nigeria who gave us superb service on our first day of our 5-day stay. breakfast was superb and the service excellent ! Thank you Efe! We appreciate your hospitality and sincerity . You are an asset to the hotel. It’s just too bad she only works there for 2 days a week...thank you for your hospitality and dedication, we look forward to seeing you more! 
Carol M from LA 😃

title: Tremendous Customer Service
text: Efe was a bright and charming disposition to start our day in the wonderfully accommodated breakfast lounge.  Her service and personality was a beautiful addition to the start of our day and we hope to see her again!

title: My Home in NYC
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel several times and for lengthy periods whilst on business in the city. Staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and functional - small yes, but that’s New York, and I’ve been in smaller!
The location is good with subway stations a few steps away, the Staten Island Ferry opposite the hotel entrance and World Trade Center an easy 10 minute walk. There’s plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and the option to eat and drink in the hotel. Breakfast is good and servers are attentive friendly - special mention to Agron who does a terrific job.
This is a good value hotel in FiDi and you’ll be made welcome and feel comfortable during your stay.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Es un hotel muy cómodo, queda a pasos del subway, tiene un desayuno buffet exquisito. El personal muy amable a todas horas. La habitación tiene aire acondicionado, cama muy cómoda y mucho espacio. Definitivamente volvería a quedarme aquí.

title: Nice room
text: The stay was great. Our room had a nice view of the water depots the building that obstructed our view ...but that’s New York for you! The room was nice and clean besides the hair ball found on the floor and the random mosquitos that popped up in the room. Besides those issues everything was great and I would stay there again. The location was great!!

title: 1st time NYC
text: This was our 1st time in NYC, we met our son & his family in NYC. We had connecting rooms and the grandchildren love it. The rooms were very clean and appeared to be recently renovated and did not show any signs of wear. The location was great for our needs and if we go back to NYC we would stay here again.

title: Modern clean hotel - the omlets by Shawn & Vincent are the BOMB
text: Rooms are nice, modern and clean.  Location is great.  Easy access with car/uber.  Easy walk over to Battery Park.  But the best thing the fresh omelets made by Shawn & Vincent.  I had an egg-white omelet with all the 4-legged animals (bacon, sausage, ham) and cheese - YUMMY!

title: Not all satisfied
text: Staff wasn’t friendly I have to ask couple times for my concerns they was not clear, the room was so small. The parking is a problem. The room was clean and the amenities too. For travel alone without transportation this hotel will be fine.

title: Great Hotel
text: the hotel was very nice and subway entrance was right across the street, walking distance to wall street, the gold bull, shops, and the 911 memorial and museum. Brandon was very helpful and friendly made the stay fun, always willing to help with directions, food ideas, and places to see. Hotel is very nice and new, but he rooms are really small but they served the purpose and bed was comfortable, didnt like the barn door on bathroom, doesnt close well or stay closed, ok for self or relationship, not great for sharing room with a friend. Maybe need add lock, or something to hold door closed.

title: very satisfied
text: Very good location. Nice service. Clean and nice rooms. Modern design. View from the room on East River. Subway Station and Sout Ferry Station directly across from the hotel. I would visit the hotel again and again.

title: Encontre 2 veces la puerta abierta
text: En la noche cuando llegue encontre 2 encontre 2 veces la puerta de la habitacion abierta, deberian mirar si la puerta quedo cerrada para que no le pase a ningun cliente. y la limpieza en li habitacion fue regular gracias.

title: Absolutely stellar
text: While I am happy to write a review here, the quality of my stay dictates I send a detailed letter to the GM of the hotel. It will be my pleasure to do so. This team could not have done a better job. Front desk, engineering, the bar/restaurant on the 2nd floor. Well done, all very well done.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Great location! Price was phenomenal! Rooms were spacious for New York and extremely clean! Staff was very helpful, pleasant, and informative! Parking was very easy.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great breakfast!
text: The breakfast is fantastic; Shawn does an especially good job on omelettes.  They are made with quality ingredients, taste great, and come out quickly (made to order).  The entire staff also is very outgoing and friendly.

title: Absolutely LOVED our stay
text:
We stayed at this property for six nights around the Fourth of July and found it to be a wonderful place to stay.

Our first night started with a middle-of-the-night arrival. Our flight into Newark was delayed several hours and then the subsequent train rides from there to the South Street area took a while. The woman who checked us in at 3 a.m. was very friendly. It turned out our room had the ice machine located right outside. As we were trying to finally get to sleep, others were starting their days early and getting ice. When we got up a few hours later, my husband went to the front desk while I was getting ready and asked about moving rooms because we didn't want to listen to the ice machine for the next five nights and our TV wasn't working. Imram, the manager he spoke with, was apologetic and said they would get us moved if we didn't mind storing our luggage while another room was cleaned. We were thrilled they would be able to move us, so packing up was not an issue.

When we got back that day, we had a new room on a floor without an ice machine and still the amazing view of the East River and the Staten Island Ferry terminal. Within minutes of settling in, Gabrielle stopped by to make sure we were happy with our new room and offered us complimentary hot breakfast for the inconvenience. It was so nice to have staff who genuinely cared about our satisfaction!

The rest of our stay went very well and we didn't have any other issues. We only did breakfast the one morning it was complimentary. It was $17 for continental and $23 for hot breakfast, otherwise. The offerings were good--pastries, fresh fruit, made-to-order omelets and so much more. 

The location is very convenient for tourists and business travelers. There are two subway lines right there and the Staten Island Ferry. It's a short walk to Battery Park to get on the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island ferry, and the Wall Street Bull is a couple of blocks away. There are lots of historical places in the area as well. There were also a fair number of places to dine in the area.

title: Appalling customer service
text:
My husband and I checked in today.  We were assigned to Rm 2703 and given 2 rooms keys .  My husband had a question for the front desk staff so I gave him one key and went up to the room with our luggage.  The room key I was given did not work and since there were 2 house keeping staff, Navidad and another lady cleaning Room 2704, I asked if they can use their master key to help open my door.  They tried my key and confirmed that it was not working and said they had to call their manager.  While on the phone with their manager, they asked for verification of my name, saw that I was holding a key packet stating Room 2703, told me that my husband was on his way up, and refused to open the door for me.  15 minutes later, Navidad and colleague had finished cleaning Room 2704, saw me still stranded in the non-air conditioned hallway with my 3 pcs of luggage and did nothing.  Walking past me as if I was invisible so they can move across the hall to clean Room 2708.  15 more minutes later, my husband finally comes up the elevator and was surprised to see me stranded in the hallway as he had heard the manger tell Navidad and colleague over the phone to help open the door for me.
While I understand that glitches can sometimes cause key cards not to work, hotels with good customer service generally has someone run up a new set of key cards in within 5-10 minutes.  To have staff like Navidad and colleague pretend to help a paying customer by calling their manager yet purposely leave the customer

title: Hotel Breakfast
text: My friends and I visited and were quickly met by Efe, who is very sweet and pleasant! There weren’t many options and the price of $23 was a bit steep, but Efe made us feel very welcome and addressed every need. THANK YOU, EFE!!!

title: Breakfast Service
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our leisurely breakfast on a sunny Saturday morning. Everyone on staff was very friendly and helpful but we especially appreciated Efe’s service and attention to detail. Would definitely recommend!

title: Hotel breakfast & service
text: My experience was quite pleasant. The hot breakfast was $23, which I thought was a bit pricey, but Efe’s service made the experience worth it. She was so kind, welcoming, and accommodating! Such great service.

title: Great Staff & breakfast
text: We had a wonderful breakfast this morning. Our server Efe was very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. The two chefs were great as well. The food was delicious. My friend and I enjoyed. I highly recommend it!

title: Danke !!!
text: Die Bedienung war sehr nett während unseres Aufenthalts. Sowohl an der Rezeption als auch im Service beim Frühstück. Insbesondere Efe war sehr zuvorkommend am letzten Tag. Schönes Hotel mit wunderbarem Ausblick und exzellenter Lage.

title: Shawn and Vincent
text: Friendly, attentive. Made an awesome omelette!!! Good way to start my day. The staff has been helpful and all are approachable. A caring attitude and obvious commitment to customer service. My first time here and I will be back

title: NYC with a Water View!
text: The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and greeted us each time we entered or exited the property.  The rooms were surprising large for  NYC.  We had an upper level room with a terrific view of the water.  Staying so close to the Ferry, the subway and attractions, it was easy to get everywhere we wanted to go.  Being downtown, we had the added benefit of quiet nights.  The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean.

title: Great hotel at super convenient location
text: We stayed at Hilton Garden Inn at the Financial District. This is a great hotel! The location is primo! 5 minutes walk to the Charging Bull, Battery Park. Minutes walk to subway stations, lots of restaurants within walking distance. 10 minutes to Brooklyn bridge. Hotel rooms are quite roomy with all the necessary amenities. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Overall, it offers superb value, certainly will make your NYC trip very memorable.

title: Gute Location, sauberes Hotel
text: Ich bin Hilton Honors Mitglied und übernachte demzufolge immer in Hilton Hotels. Derzeit sind wir auf einer Reise die in New York gestartet hat und uns noch nach Florida führen wird. Anfangs hatten wir ein paar Probleme wegen des Frühstücks, die aber innerhalb 24 Stunden vom Hotel Staff schnell und unproblematisch gelöst wurden. Das Frühstück ist ok wenn auch nicht sehr unterschiedlich, aber speziell Shawn Vincent ist ein toller Koch hinterm Tresen dessen Omeletts super schmecken. Die Location des Hotels ist klasse und von dort aus kann man super in die Stadt starten.

title: Great location, great value
text: Located essentially next to the R, W, and L lines as well as the Staten Island Ferry. Less than 5 minutes from Battery Park and Statue of Liberty. Very clean. Avoid the hotel breakfast, as the pastries looked sad and the juice was watered down.

title: Efficient hotel in the Financial District
text: Great Hilton brand hotel conveniently located in the NYC Financial District. Clean rooms, great cook to order breakfast restaurant, and economical. Wish that my digital key had worked, but that was the only glitch.

title: Wall street hotel
text:
Pros
I have been a Hilton member for awhile and can say this is one of their best properties I have stayed at in NYC. Typical rooms with exceptional bathroom/shower. Walking distance from subway, free downtown shuttle, and NY Waterway (really recommend the waterway ferries). Staff at the hotel are very friendly. Best part of my experience was the breakfast at the hotel (free for Gold/ Diamond members). Chefs were great for the entire stay especially Shawn & Vincent. Super friendly and make dynamite omelets.

Cons
Small hotel gym typical of NYC hotels. There is a planet fitness right up the street though.

title: Great hotel! Perfect Location!
text: This hotel is clean, the staff is extremely helpful, and the location is wonderful.  We chose to stay in the financial district because it's cheaper on the weekends in NYC.  This hotel is located close to the subway, the Staten Island Ferry, and lots of restaurants.

title: Great customer service and great hotel overall
text: Great customer service and great hotel overall.  I recommend this hotel and the staff, specifically Imran whom was very accommodating when my travel was booked incorrectly through a well known travel website. Thank you and highly recommend this hotel for you business and/or personal stays.

title: Hotel perfecto para visitar Downtown
text: Fue el segundo hotel que tuvimos en NY. La localización me pareció ideal para visitar la estatua de la libertad, ya que esta a 10 min. andando del ferry que te lleva allí. El hotel moderno y muy cómodo. Desde nuestra habitación se veía el mar por un lateral. En general muy contenta con la elección.

title: A Valued Guest
text: I had my 91 year old mother stay at this amazing Hotel for 7 nights.   The customer service was spot on.  The staff in the dining room were amazing.  When I would visit, I was greeted by either Effe or Agron each morning.  They make an amazing team and make you feel like a true valued guest!  I should also mention the Chef's - Vincent and Shawn, prepared amazing Specials each morning.  And a special thanks to Regina at the front desk, who not made checking in seamless but she too was very attentive to my mom and myself.

title: Great location Great Breakfast
text: Thanks for awesome omelette to Shawn and Vincent !! Great staff - very attentive —room was just big enough — very clean — close to Ferry and subway — Battery Park was very nice to explore — had a great stay

title: Excelente hotel para descanso aunque un poco alejado del movimiento
text:
Hotel excelente para descansar, tranquilo, muy buen servicio, reciben paquetes. Habitaciones con microondas, frigobar, caja fuerte. Un poco flojo el servicio domestico porque un par de veces no han dejado un extra de papel higiénico y uno tiene que estar reclamando.
Ubicado frente a estaciones de metro que acercan a todo Manhattan pero alejado de la movida nocturna, de hecho por las noches no hay nada cerca para comer y esta bastante desolada la zona Sin embargo lo recomiendo por su nivel de descanso, buena atención. 
Ofrecen por cafe de cortesía para desayunar y durante el día limonadas.
Volveríamos

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: The assistant manager was rude, callous and unsympathetic. Otherwise, the room was fairly clean; however, the insulation was terrible, and there was loud jack-hammering outside of the hotel until 1:00 AM. Would not return. The Hilton should be ashamed.

title: Limpio, cómodo y bien ubicado
text:
Está muy cercano a varias estaciones del metro y de autobus. En lo personal creo que es mejor zona que Time Square. (Más tranquilo, económico y calles limpias).

El hotel parece nuevo. Las habitaciones son chicas, pero me imagino que así es en todo Nueva York. Solo estábamos en las noches para descansar. Camas muy cómodas y con buena vista al agua. Hotel en muy buen estado. La habitación le faltan más cajones para acomodar la ropa.

El desayuno buffet es muy rico, aunque solo era un mesero o dos para todos los huéspedes, por lo que el servicio no era suficiente. Siempre fueron muy amables!

En Front Desk, muy bien Nico/Emron que nos ayudó y escuchó con un problema que tuvimos...  Kevin también, se nota la pasión por el servicio.   Muy alegre.

La limpieza de las habitaciones muy bien, aunque el personal le falta cordialidad. No saludan, no sonríen, parece como si estuvieran enojadas constantemente.

Si lo recomiendo a quien quiera visitar Nueva York

title: Great location
text: This Hilton Garden Inn is in a great location to visit lower Manhattan.  5 minute walk to Battery Park and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island and a 15 minute walk to the 9/11 memorial.  Great food options surround.  If you drive, make sure to get your parking garage ticket stamped at the front desk prior to departure.

title: excellent stay, highly recommend
text:
Just spent six nights here and cannot fault this hotel. The staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful. the rooms were clean and we had a water view which was fabulous. The breakfast, not the cheapest, but a great choice of buffet.
The location is ideal. the subway across the road gets you uptown in less than 15 minutes.
Will definitely be staying there again.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Great hotel, great location. I stayed just one night, but everything was great. Nice room, nice staff, nice location. The hotel is very close to the Fraunces Tavern, the Staten Island Ferry terminal, the Statue of Liberty ferry, Battery Park, Wall Street, Federal Hall, and all the restaurants on Stone Street.

title: Good hotel
text: This is so far the best hotel I’ve ever had in New York.Good location. Close to World Trade Center and South Ferry. Service quality is good as always. Definitely recommend the breakfast in this hotel.

title: Decevant
text:
Personne ne parle francais
Personnel peu agreable
Atm en panne
Ascenseurs en panne
Systeme de fermeture des portes en panne
3 serviettes pour 4 personnes
Devoor demander une serviette 5 fois et attendre 4 heures pour l’avoir
Pc du hall en panne
Pas de rhe dans les chambres
Grosse deception

title: Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center
text:
Special thanks to Martin who has a wonderful personality and was very professional 
My family and I have enjoyed this trip to NYC.
It was the first time my parents came to USA and they were very happy and enjoyed their stay in the hotel

title: Супер Отель!
text:
Понравился Отель. Быстро заселили. Достойные номера. 
Очень чисто. На втором этаже Кафе и ресторан. Кормят достойно. Очень вежливый персонал. После выезда из отеля вспомнили что забыли в номере вещи. Вернулись через час . Нам оперативно вручили ключи. И мы были очень рады что не нужно было уговаривать. А всё сделали профессионально и быстро. Спасибо. Всех с праздником!

title: Friendly Hotel in a Great Location
text:
We had an overnight layover in New York and wanted to see Ellis Island. We chose this Hilton Garden Inn because it is only about a 10 minute walk to where the Statue Cruises boats leave for Liberty Island and Ellis Island. It also had the benefit of a much better than expected rate, so it turned out to be a perfect location!

The lobby is actually one level above the street, but help is available to assist with taking care of your bags. We found this hotel to be super-friendly, and everyone was happy to help with directions and travel advice. As is the norm for New York, the room was not large, but we liked the digital key and found a place for everything. High points included a Kureig coffeemaker, good internet access, lots of channels on the TV and plenty of power and USB charging ports. 

If there was a downside, it would be that the bath was pretty small, but overall we were won over by the great staff and convenient location.

title: Great location and room with a view and a hiccup
text: Stayed for two nights in June. Great location near Battery Park. Hotel is 3-star but clean, safe and near everything in lower Manhattan. We arrived at 1 p.m. and room not ready so dropped luggage and came back at night. Room was great, overlooking East River and Staten Island Ferry Terminal and harbor. Quiet and clean. At night walked to local restaurants or pubs or took the 4/5 uptown at Bowling Green stop (5 minute walk). Go to Leo's bagel nearby for authentic NY bagels and toppings. Only hiccup was that the doorman (very nice) reserved a car for us to JFK to leave and misquoted price by saying tip included. Very nice ride to airport but surprised when we got there and were asked to tip...Would think a reputable hotel in NYC would not misquote. However, I would stay again.

title: Ottimo hotel per una vacanza da sogno
text:
Si trova nel distretto finanziario, zona molto sicura, più tranquilla e meno caotica rispetto al pieno centro. In 2-10  minuti massimo di passeggiata lungo strade piacevoli si raggiungono le fermate per tutte le principali linee della metro (verde, gialla, rossa), l'autobus e lo Staten Island Ferry, posizione eccezionale per spostarsi ovunque e velocemente che ti dà la possibilità di poter far ritorno in Hotel se necessario per fare una sosta durante la giornata. Proprio accanto si trova Battery Park, parco favoloso che si affaccia sul mare in cui puoi rilassarti con il rumore delle onde e vista statua della Libertà.
L' Hotel è nuovo e moderno, personale cortese, professionale e disponibile. 
Camera king 307: non molto grande ma nello standard di New York, curata e pulizia impeccabile. Presenti frigorifero, microonde, ferro da stiro, grande TV e il necessario per prepararsi te/caffè riforniti quotidianamente. Anche il bagno all'interno è moderno, molto pulito, dotato di una doccia molto spaziosa e un asciugacapelli degno di essere chiamato tale. Lenzuola e asciugamani di ottima qualità e letto super super comodo anche se l'armadio è un po' troppo piccolo per un soggiorno di 10 giorni per 2 persone. Condizionatore silenzioso, wi-fi gratuito. Appena siamo entrati ho trovato con immensa gioia una grande finestra, con possibilità di essere aperta, che affaccia all'esterno della struttura e da cui è possibile vedere, nonostante ci sia stato assegnato un piano basso, uno scorcio dell'East River e della partenza dei battelli per Staten Island. 
Nella hall ci sono a disposizione degli ospiti latte, caffè e te durante la mattina e acqua fresca nel pomeriggio. Nel piano interrato c'è una lavanderia automatica a gettoni  e una palestra. Non abbiamo utilizzato il ristorante poichè ci piaceva fare colazione e mangiare in giro per la città
Al ceck out abbiamo potuto lasciare gratuitamente le nostre valigie fino alla partenza per poter passeggiare tranquillamente. 
Lo consiglio e ci tornerò sicuramente

title: Great Stay By Battery Park/911 Memorial
text:
I had a wedding to attend to by the Pier in Battery Park. Awesome location for my needs. Got early check-in by 1pm as it was available. 13th floor room facing the water. Could see the ferry terminal. King Bed was comfy and the room was clean and modern bathroom. Spacious shower, easily fit three adults standing. Free waters for Hilton Gold and wifi!
Did some sightseeing before getting ready. Very close to Wall St, stock exchange and of course the 9/11 Memorial. Needed to pick up a few amenities to help me get ready and Duane Reed/CVS are only a few blocks away, as well as Century 21/H&M.
If hungry you have a ton of dinning options from street carts and regular restaurants that cater to the wall st crowd. Also Smorgasburg WTC is right around the corner by the WTC memorial (open air Food stall vendors on Fridays).

Thanks Hilton, Would stay again if the opportunity called for it.

title: Good location
text: This hotel has a great location with lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby, friendly staff and clean. Breakfast at the Grill restaurant was very disappointing. Pricey and uninspired. Coffee barely drinkable.

title: Overnight stay
text:
Crashed last night at this Hilton property located  diagonally opposite the Staten Island Ferry terminal. Enjoyed a post work steak and wine dinner and did not want to travel home late hence had booked this overnight stay.
The hotel is not quite 2 years old and maintains a “fresh” appearance. I was greeted at the front desk by a most professional and classy hotel manager who made the check-in process effortless. Had booked a “room with a view” which placed me on the 23rd floor. Hallways are clean, nicely lit with plush carpet. A king size bed sat on the back wall of the room with a large window looking outside by the furthest side of the room. When lying on the bed you face a narrow corner “armoire” on your right side and moving left a desk and chair which attached to a modular dresser holding 2 small top to bottom  drawers and a cabinet holding an in-room safe and mini fridge.
I could not use the safe as one compartment for the 4 AAA batteries was broke however this was a minor inconvenience. At the end of this combination modular desk and dresser sat a Keurig coffee machine and 2 bottles of water each holding a tag listing $3.00 cost.The tiled bathroom was well constructed and contained a sizable shower with thick (lucite ?) sliding doors, a wall sized vanity with a large mirror hung above and Neutrogena toiletries on the counter-top. I will say bathroom lighting was not bright enough for my needs however the shower provided ample water flow and water as hot as you like.
The mattress, sheets, pillows, etc were quite comfortable and the in-room thermostat worked well to provide occupants temperatures to their liking.
All in all a pleasant stay however I deducted a star for the undersized armoire, lack of free bottled water, inoperable safe and poor bathroom lighting.

title: Exceptional Staff and Service
text:
I stayed there Monday thru Thursday of this week. The front desk staff were super friendly and always greeted me with a "hello" and a smile when I walked by. The bartender was also very friendly and I enjoyed my conversation with him. I liked that he was attentive to other guests as they walked in without being rude to  me or them. I did think that the breakfast was too expensive at $23.99 so I went out and got some eggs and fruit somewhere else to eat in my room. I realized that I didn't have any salt/pepper so I stopped in the restaurant to see if they had little packages and the manager was very accommodating (I was waiting for him to tell me to get lost since I had another restaurant's food in my hand).
The BIG deal came though after I had returned home I discovered I left something very important for work at the hotel. I called and spoke with Imran who personally walked two blocks to FedEx and had it shipped to me. HE SAVED MY BUTT! Not only did he save me but he was super nice the whole time we were trying to figure out what to do. Not once did he make me feel like I was inconveniencing him (which I was). 
The room was clean and comfortable but honestly, I'd sleep in a cardboard box under a bridge if it had service like this! Excellent. Simply EXCELLENT!

title: Below expecation
text: Apart from the location don't see a real reason to appreciate. Oh yes the staff at reception Were good. Very crampy rooms rooms not properly sealed lots of noise particularly the room near ice maker Machine. Too costly for that room quality.

title: Convenient Location, Good Value
text: Great location if you want to be down by the Battery.  Responsive staff, clean rooms, nice modern bathrooms.  Bedroom is small, but typical of NYC.  We had a problem with the A/C not cooling the room.  After a protracted discussion with the front desk the manager moved us.  A/C in new room worked well.

title: Location Can't Be Beat
text: The location was perfect for what we were doing in NYC.  The ferry and subway are close by.  I was also impressed with the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff.  My only issue was the price of the breakfast.  Ask before purchasing!

title: Toller Aufenthalt
text:
Wir hatten ein Zimmer für eine Woche aufgrund der positiven Bewertungen bei Tripadvisor gebucht. Das Zimmer 1303 mit Blick nach vorne war sehr sauber, ausreichend groß und technisch und optisch bis auf kleine Gebrauchsspuren, die sich eben nicht vermeiden lassen,  völlig in Ordnung. Das Personal war stets aufmerksam und freundlich. 
Das Hotel war eine ausgezeichneter Ausgangspunkt für unsere täglichen Aktivitäten, einfach mit der roten Route der Subway 1 in die City. Obwohl die Straßen auch abends belebt waren, konnte man sich dort sehr gut vom Tag erholen. Optimal war auch der kurze Weg zur Fähre nach Staten Island. Rundum im Hotel ein toller Aufenthalt. 
Tip: Um die Ecke am o.a. Hotel ist der Supermarkt Essen ( 24 Sunden geöffnet ), Warm-Kaltes-Buffet und alles war man braucht.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Staff was extremely kind, friendly and helpful.  Hotel was able to accommodate  our disability request. We felt right at home! Walking distance to Statue of Liberty boat which is what we needed. Quiet part of town.

title: Wonderful service all around
text: Wonderful service Entire Staff , Front Desk providing a Room with a Wonderful view , Housekeeping Room was exceptional , PBX pleasant Food and Beverage, especially Chef Chris with his Breakfast specials

title: Nice stay
text:
The beds are comfy, the black out blinds are a nice touch, and this is a surprisingly quiet hotel given the location. The hotel room wasn't the cleanest and the WiFi was OK. 

I'd stay here again if I need to.

title: da consigliare
text: ottima posizione per utilizzare le metro e i traghetti per raggiungere la statua della libertà, non lontanissimo dal ponte di Brooklyn. Le camere sono confortevoli e pulite! Da consigliare per una vacanza

title: Staff makes this our “go to” for any time spent in lower Manhattan
text: I’ve reviewed this establishment before but want to add how special Willie’s asparagus soup is! Like the rest of the staff, Willie is kind, courteous and always goes the extra mile.  If staying here, I recommend asking Willie for his special asparagus soup!

title: Excellent stay, would recommend.
text:
We had a great stay at this hotel and found it clean, comfortable with friendly & helpful staff. The room was excellent with a very comfortable bed and was well equipped with coffee maker, fridge, microwave, safe, toiletries etc. 
Slight issue with our shower door which did not completely close so allowed a slight leak though this was only a minor inconvenience. 
There are lots of floors but we found the lifts to be very quick and readily available. WiFi was very good and reliable. 
We did not use the bar or restaurant and similar to many hotels breakfast was expensive so we went to one of the many other local options. 
The location of the hotel is also excellent, within 1-5 minutes of a number of subway stations so well connected and with many cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. 
Overall price was high but it is NYC and was comparative to other hotels in the area.

title: Hotel non sicuro
text: Al nostro rientro in camera abbiamo trovato il portafoglio in un punto diverso da dove l'avevamo lasciato e dallo stesso mancavano 50 Euro. Abbiamo segnalato subito l'accaduto ma dalle loro verifiche fatte alla serratura risultavano accessi alla nostra stanza solo con la nostra chiave. Per loro è tutto in regola ma a noi sono spariti 50 Euro...

title: loved the location
text: We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. We were on the 9th floor and had a view of the ferry terminal and the water. It was quiet and comfortable. We liked walking around the neighbourhood. The following morning, we were heading for the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal. We walked from the hotel to Pier 11/Wall Street (about 5 minutes) and took the ferry to Red Hook for $2.75. Red Hook is just next to the Cruise Terminal, so very convenient.

title: Great Stay
text: Selected this hotel based on other online reviews.  We were extremely satisfied.  Hotel staff was excellent, always greeted with a smile.  Area was quiet, you do not hear all the sirens like you do in midtown.  Subways are close by and some very good restaurants are close by.

title: Superb Cleanliness
text: We stayed here for an extended weekend and were pleased with how nice and clean our room (and the hotel in general) is kept. The room was small and the view was non-existent (the "city view" was a the side of the building next door :/) but it was clean in all aspects which is most important to us. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful. Their restaurant offers breakfast and dinner, but be aware there are no lunch options on site, not even room service. There is no onsite parking but self parking is $40/night at a garage about 3 blocks away.

title: A solid choice for a couple of nights
text: We chose this location to be near both the ferries to Liberty and Ellis Islands and to Brooklyn, where we were headed two days later. We were promptly checked in by Lee who was wonderfully efficient, dropped our bags with an equally efficient and courteous bellman, and headed north to a matinee in the theater district. When we returned, we were taken to our room (which had been upgraded) on the 29th floor. The room, like many NYC hotel rooms, was small but had all the necessities...coffee maker, small fridge, safe, window that opened a bit, black out shades, great A/C, and spotlessly clean. We visited the bar/restaurant on the second floor which was bright and open. Bar staff did not seem to be quite as friendly as the front desk, but they made good drinks and served us promptly. We did not have any food here. The only minor issue we found with the room was the incredibly small closet space that barely held our clothes. It could not have been more than 2 feet x 2 feet and also had an ironing board and iron in it. Otherwise, the room was fine for a short (2 night) stay.

title: Clean hotel, reasonable rates
text: Stayed here for the weekend, the hotel is pretty convenient for transportation - it's close to the metro stations (Whitehall / South Ferry) and also the ferry terminals. The staff are friendly, rooms are pretty new and clean. I'd recommend staying in a higher floor, as we stayed on the 3rd floor and the noise from the street level are pretty apparent. We didn't stay in the hotel most of the time so it didn't affect us too much, just the odd motorcycle or something that drives by randomly at night.

title: Excellent Property
text: Clean, Spacious room with a great view. The staff was attentive and helpful. The food was tasty and well cooked. I felt like a valued guest the entire stay. The free internet was strong and maintained the connections.

title: Quick NYC Getaway
text: The staff was courteous.  The Hotel was across the street from the Staten Island Ferry in Manhattan.  The area was clean and felt very safe.  I enjoyed my experience and would probably stay there again.  The room and bathroom was small but very clean with modern/ sleek decor.  The breakfast was overpriced, but there is food in the area.  The hotel was not very busy and the staff was very attentive.

title: Got the job done
text: This hotel was nice. I enjoyed being on a high floor. I didn't spend much time in the room/hotel, but the bed was very comfortable, and the front desk staff was friendly. The breakfast was not included in the rate, so I did not eat at the hotel. The one odd thing I found was the public bathrooms were on the 2nd floor, which seemed odd. The hotel is very close to a lot of bars and restaurants and around the corner from the Subway station and Ferry. If I needed to stay in the financial district in the future, I’d stay here again. The rate was reasonable, as well.

title: Very happy I chose to stay here
text:
I was unsure of picking this hotel as Hilton Garden's can be a little hit or miss.  Usually I stay a doubletree that is a couple blocks away, but the rooms had gotten way too expensive there.

I was very happy that I ended up staying here.  While the rooms were on the small side, this is typical for NYC... and actually these rooms were a little larger than I am used to (in NYC).

The staff were all VERY attentive and helpful... Everybody was great.  When I checked in, I had a raging Migraine and the person at the front desk worked to find me a room that was available (the one I selected for mobile check in wasn't).  and that really helped a lot as I was able to go right to my room and go to bed.

The restaurant was fantastic.  The waitstaff was great, and the food was much better than I was expecting.  I ended up eating there almost every night (rather than go out).  In fact I was so impressed with the ribs and the mashed potatoes that I asked who the chef was (Willie) because I wanted to tell him how much I enjoyed it.

And while it's not close to Time's square or any of the sites, the south ferry subway stop is right outside the main door, making it incredible easy to get wherever you need to.

title: Overall good stay
text: Didnt like bathroom sliding door that faced the beds, you can see through cracks and it didnt close right, awkward when your there with friends, if it was just spouse might not be as bad, no coffee in room,had to keep asking for it,  only had 2 towels for 4 of us, overall it was ok, being a NY'er it is great location for resturants, ferry, subway, being a NY,

title: こちらも便利な立地
text:
NY〜フェラデルフィア、DC〜NYと旅行の最終日の5/2の1泊のみ利用。
ワシントンからアムトラックの移動で夜遅く着いたのでチェックインも21時回りました。
26階でエレベーターの目の前の部屋でした。
シービューで予約しましたが目の前にビルがあって自由の女神は見れませんでした。でも海は見れます。

朝 フェリー乗り場の周りを散歩してグラウンドゼロまで歩いてその近くのモールでランチをとってホテルに戻りました。(私達は結構歩くの平気なので、ホテルからチャイナタウンも歩いて行けます)タイムズスクエア周辺にもNY旅行の最初に3泊しましたが、こちらも歩いて色々出れるので便利で良いと思います。空の冷蔵庫も在るので買って来たものを入れられるのでNYで最初に泊まったホテルより、此方のヒルトンのホテルの方が私は良いですね。

title: Wonderful weekend stay
text: I stayed two night in this Hilton.  The staff was super accommodating and friendly, the room was clean spacious and well appointed, the location was superb for downtown.  It is close to some great restaurants, and lot's of things to do.  It is a short walk to the 9/11 memorial, Wall Street and the Statue of Liberty ferry.  We even went to the Brooklyn Bridge, SoHo and Canal Street by foot since we love to walk. New Yorkers walk everywhere.  A $20-$25 cab ride will get you further uptown if you prefer not to walk.  The location is super quiet on the weekends with almost no street noise at all.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Could not have been happier
text: I could not have been happier with my choice of the Hilton Garden Inn in the Financial District. Great location, great service (very helpful and friendly front desk staff), small-ish but very comfortable, clean and well appointed room. Nice breakfast.

title: My go to
text: very clean and comfortable room, great view, great location..I really enjoyed my stay and the price was reasonable as well this is my go to place from now on anytime i'm in New York.  I would most definitely recommend!!!

title: Great hotel!
text:
Prior to the opening of this hotel, there were a few other mediocre places to stay in FiDi. I'm so glad I tried this hotel on my recent trip. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is very clean and the staff is superb - and I mean all of the staff. The rooms are large by NYC standards and have a mini fridge and safe. I was travelling on business so I made use of the onsite restaurant daily. My breakfast was comped as a Hilton Honor's member and it was a full breakfast. Each morning, not only was the staff welcoming - the restaurant manager was greeting guests, serving the made to order omelets, and even cleaning tables. Everyone at this hotel is committed to a high quality standard - they are amazing! I will definitely be back at this location.
Even if you are not in the city for FiDi business, this hotel is located across from the Staten Island Ferry and all major subways are as close as 1/2 block away. It's a great location, even for tourists.

title: Bright rooms and good bathroom counter space.  Small bar and restaurant on the property.
text: Staff very responsive.  Located in area that allows to walk to several local restaurants and bars.   The hotel is located close to the Staten Island Ferry which is a great free experience.  Ferry takes you by the Statue of Liberty and once you arrive at Staten Inland you immediately take a return ferry.  A nice quick experience in NY.

title: Déception...
text:
Assez déçu de cet hôtel. Je m'attendais à beaucoup mieux. 
Déjà, j'étais juste à côté des ascenseurs dans une chambre handicapée... Merci ! Vraiment super. 
La voisine a téléphoné jusqu'à 4h du matin et j'étais fatigué le lendemain. 
La Salle de Bain (pour handicapé) était pleine d'eau après la douche. 
Ajoutez à cela que la personne à l'accueil voulait me faire payer le parking 40$ alors qu'il y avait une place devant l'hôtel, ce n'est pas très cool...
Enfin, le petit déjeuner est pas mal mais beaucoup trop cher : 25$.
Bref, je dois retourner dans ce coin dans 1 mois et demi, je ne suis pas sûr du tout de retourner à cet hôtel, je vais peut-être en chercher un autre... Déception ! 
Notez qu'il est parfaitement bien placé et qu'il permet de faire beaucoup de choses à pied.

title: Love the stay
text: This place has great amenities and has a great staff. The room and the hotel were very clean. Very close to Wall Street and very good restaurants around the area. The State Island fairy is front of the hotel. Highly recommended to stay.

title: Cillian Murphy Weekend
text: We had a wonderful time in NYC we came in for a play in the Dumbo area at St. Ann's Warehouse in Brooklyn. Grief Is A Thing With Feathers starring Cillian Murphy ... He is a Great Actor. We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn financial Center Downtown Manhattan. This hotel has for the most part everything you need for the stay. The hotel is very clean,food is good, front desk is great.I would recommend this to everyone. The bartender Matthew was very nice and helpful and service was wonderful. All the employees in the dinning and bar area were very very good at their jobs. I will stay here again....

title: Great weekend trip
text: Location was perfect for the 9 of us. We were near Battery Park but just a few blocks away from the hustle and bustle of New York. We were close to the train station which was good for the kids to travel to different locations. Uber was a breeze also. But train more cost effective.

title: Super clean Manhattan hotel.
text: Easy access to many restaurants in the Financial District, and subways.  Friendly, helpful staff, impeccably clean room.  Restaurant in the hotel was actually very good.  Short walk to Battery Park for a stroll with views of Lady Liberty and Ellis Island.

title: 2 szép éjszaka Manhattenben
text: Több metróvonal több megállója is elérhető gyalog. Sajnos a korai bejelentkezésre nem volt most lehetőség, a szobatípus megtartása mellett, a vállalt időben viszont rendelkezésre állt. Nagyon kedves volt a személyzet ki és bejelentkezésnél, a reggelinél többen még ennél is kedvesebbek voltak, itt nagyon jó volt a választék, sok frissen készült étel is választható volt. A szoba szép állapotban volt, kellemes kilátással. A víznyomás nem volt a legjobb a zuhanyban. Nem volt ne zavarj tábla a szobában. A csomagok tárolásáról gondolkodtak. Csak ajánlani tudom.

title: Exceptional Stay at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/Manhattan Downtown
text: My experience at the Hilton Garden Inn, in the Financial District, was exceptional from start to finish. My family was greeted and welcomed in, our room was clean and with a wonderful view, and each day the staff was kind and interactive. Checkout was easy and helpful, including arranging our car service. I have stayed in many hotels over the years for both business and pleasure, and our experience in New York was top notch! Thank you to your staff!

title: Great location. Small rooms.
text: We went from an Airbnb near Central Park that is 4x the size of their double full room. Room was mostly clean. They didn't vacuum one of the days my wife requested, but otherwise probably the best location in the Financial District for tourists.

title: Great Business hotel
text: Very convenient, hotel staff very friendly and knowledgeable.  Great dinner recommendation. Fitness center was up to date and clean.  Breakfast was on the second floor so didn't have time to go and get breakfast

title: Great value in downtown NYC
