text: Great location. Convenient but much less congested than Midtown. Walking distance to Ellis Island and lots of good restaurants. Everyone on the staff who we encountered during our four-night stay was extremely friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

title: A Great Hotel, Location, and Experience
text: If you're looking to beat the crowds at the Statue of Liberty, you'll need to get there early!   This hotel serves that purpose extremely well.  It's a very short 5-minute walk to Battery Park, where the ferries board, and it's also easily accessible to a few subway lines and also some great restaurants.  In my experience, the pricing is very fair for Manhattan, and I would gladly recommend this to others.  Clean, comfortable, quiet, and a great staff.

title: Great Location Great Staff
text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, the location was perfect for visiting lower Manhattan, so many restaurants nearby, also subway and ferry right next door!! The front desk staff were so nice and helpful, no wait to check in , the room was a good size for Manhattan! We had a Great Time!!!

title: Amazing location and service
text: The location was excellent, the ferry was around the corner, the One WTC was 15 minutes walking! Everything was amazing and this hotel was helpful in my trip to NYC. Totally recommended. The room was neat and very quiet.

title: Great location near 9-11 Memorial
text: We had a lovely stay at this hotel recently (March 2019).  It is a rather new hotel with a view of the Hudson and walking distance to the 9-11 Memorial and museum, Battery Park, Wall Street, South Street Seaport, Oculus Center, and numerous restaurants.  Close to subway.  The hotel is very clean, modern, & well appointed with comfortable beds, in room fridge, Keurig coffee pot, tv, and larger rooms than most NY hotels.  We will stay here again!

title: Great hotel but BEWARE the parking
text: Self-park does NOT mean self-park: it means self-drive to a location that is confusing to get to, and then hand over your key anyway. Save yourself the aggravation and just valet park instead.  The rest of the stay was excellent; great rooms - tiny of course, but clean and very well designed to not FEEL tiny :)

title: Best Stay
text: The staff was amazing, the room was very clean Food was amazing thank you. Being in a wheelchair is not easy but you made it easy. So much space and the bed was so comfortable and soft and clean Thanks. You

title: They tried really hard to get this trip off to a bad start
text: I wish I could give this hotel a proper review, but the truth is they canceled my reso and had no other rooms available. The hotel had called me but didn’t leave a message. When I called back to see if there was a problem with my room, they had already canceled everything. What? Why? Because a month ago I had deactivated the card used for the booking due to fraud charges. I guess waiting until I could update the card info wasn’t an option. So that’s what Gold status gets you. I travel frequently and this was my first bad experience with a Hilton.

title: Good location, but not up to the Hilton standards
text:
I stayed here for business. The room was clean, but the restaurant was not that great. 

The restaurant staff was okay, but not that attentive.

The staff was okay, but when I asked for a late checkout ( 1/2 hour), I was denied. I have been Hilton Honors member since 2000. I was very disappointed, as I never encountered this problem at any other Hilton. I was told that the hotel was sold out, this was a Friday in NYC. I really did not believe that excuse.

The most puzzling issue was that there were no rest rooms on the first floor. There were 2 unisex bathrooms near the restaurant on the second, but only one was available. Another guest and I waited about 15 minutes while there appeared to be some young ladies in the bathroom, laughing and having a good time. We both complained and were told that there was another guest bathroom on the third floor. So we went there. I found this lack of rest rooms very odd. Management should address this issue ASAP.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights and were extremely happy with our stay. The room was small but it was big enough for the two of us. The bed was firm but comfortable. Front desk staff was friendly and even called us when we had a delivery. The view was nice and the hotel was close to the subway and ferry. The only con is the parking garage was a few blocks away but walkable. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Perfekte Lage
text: Schönes modernes Hotel direkt an der Staten Island Fähre und dem batterypark gelegen. Bett war ein riesiges sehr bequemes boxspringbett, begehbare Dusche, ansonsten eher kleines Zimmer aber für New York wohl normal und völlig ausreichend. Sehr schön ist die Kaffee/Tee Maschine auf dem Zimmer, danach kann man dann auswärts frühstücken gehen, nach rechts zum Starbucks, nach links zum Buffetrestaurant "essen" auch nicht billig, aber billiger wie 17bzw 23 $ im Hotel! Personal war stets freundlich und zuvorkommend. Würde jederzeit wieder hier Einchecken!

title: Terrible Guest Services
text:
My stay at this hotel was a 3 day, 2 night headache. I was very dissatisfied with the guest services and I strongly discourage anyone needing a hotel in NYC (especially FiDi/ lower Manhattan) from staying here.

 

To preface this review and to save others from a headache, I am a Hilton Honors member and have stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton in FiDi (5 minutes away) and the Hilton Garden Inn in Long Island City. Both of these are excellent alternatives/ substitutes to Hilton Garden Inn Financial District.

 

My main issue with this Hilton was that guest services just plainly did not carry out any of our requests, all of which were reasonable requests that every and any hotel, no matter the caliber or price point, should provide in exchange for our payment. On three separate occasions, we had to wait over 30 minutes for them to bring up random toiletries that we requested (e.g., toothpaste, shampoo, shaving kit). Every time, without fail, the employee would bring the wrong item which meant we had to wait an additional 15 minutes for him to go back and bring us the correct item.

 

Another major inconvenience was when we requested to have our room cleaned in the 2-hour morning period of 9:30 am to 11:30 am when we knew we would be out of the room. We called housekeeping and they said they would send someone right away. When we left our room, there was a maid cart right outside of our door and the employee staff even made eye contact with us as we departed. Of course, when we returned 2.5 hours later, nobody had cleaned our room. When we called down to the front desk, they offered no explanation for this slip up and noted that they had indeed received a request from us (they even showed it to us on the call log) but they could not offer any explanation for why the ball was completely dropped. No apology or even acknowledgement of the inconveniences caused from the front desk manager either. Instead, they offered to send up toiletries and towels which again took 30 minutes and the toiletries sent up were not the ones we requested either.

 

On our last night, we had a pile up of garbage in our room because housekeeping neglected to clean our room. We had a huge carton of trash including food to throw out. I knew better by the final night not to bother calling guest services, so I walked around the entire floor looking for a trash chute. Since I could not find one, I then called downstairs asking for assistance in picking up the garbage.

title: Super Lage, Preis-Leistung naja
text:
Katastrophales Frühstück.
Zimmer wurde unregelmäßig gereinigt! Preis-Leistung miserabel!      
Da profitiert wieder mal ein Hotel von der Lage in der es sich befindet! Leider viel zu oft der Fall in NYC!!!!

title: Nice Hotel
text:
I arrived into La Guardia airport and got the Q70 bus and train to Whitehall Subway station. The hotel is just around the corner
This way is definitely cheaper than a $70 Uber, but wouldn’t be the easiest if you had a lot of luggage
I booked a water view room and from the app I chose one on the 28th floor.
I checked in on the app and downloaded a digital key so didn’t have much interaction with the reception staff, although as my flight home was in the evening I asked for a late check out. Normal check out is 12pm and they were only able to give me to 1pm

The room was a nice size, (I’ve been in smaller rooms in New York) with king bed, which was very comfortable, work table, flat screen TV, coffee maker, microwave, fridge and room to move around
The bathroom was small, although the walk in shower was large. There was 2 sets of lighting in the bathroom which really helped when putting on makeup
You could hear some road traffic on the 28th floor, but it wasn’t loud.
The window faced the large building opposite and the water view was at either side of the building. The window had a light blind and curtains but when fully open I don’t know how much the building opposite could see. One thing I didn’t like was that the curtains hung to the bottom of the window and the gaps at the bottom and the sides let a lot of light in, even when the blind was also closed

I didn’t spend a lot of time in the hotel so didn’t have breakfast, use the bar or gym.
The bar doesn’t open until 4pm though.
There is a small convenience store, Subway and bars on the next block

Overall this was a nice hotel to use as a base when visiting New York

title: Ny marzo 2019
text:
Hotel pulito, metro vicina, bar e ristoranti, personale disponibile. 
Unico punto debole essendo l'hotel in zona distretto finanziario dopo le 19 c'è il coprifuoco, per cenare bisogna spostarsi più a nord.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We enjoyed our stay.  Close to subway station, very clean, extremely friendly staff.  My only drawback was street noise but they don’t control that.  We were very impressed with everything about this hotel.

title: Great Location, Service
text:
Great Location. The hotel is right across the South Ferry Terminal which is a principal station to take the ferry, a bus or a train. Good neighborhood.
Also, the hotel staff is very friendly and customer oriented. Pretty and clean decoration throughout the hotel.
The breakfast is custom made and for a hilton honors member is included. One of the weekends mornings it was busy, so the staff seemed a little overwhelmed. But during the week day, at a slower pace the service was excellent.
We have stayed before and stayed there again for the reasons mentioned above and because of its great value.

title: Very Disappointed
text:
Rooms were EXTREMELY small. Not
There was not enough room for more than one person to unpack their luggage. For a Hilton the bed was very hard. There was hair all over the bed and bathroom counter when we arrived.

title: Good for business travel
text: Located in the downtown financial  District. Not much activity at the weekend . Room size is decent . Bring bottles water when you check in. The hotel Don’t  provide any water, also there is no convenience store is around either. Little for from the main  attractions. Need subway system. Overall it’s ok.

title: Best hotel in Downtown Manhattan
text:
I booked a room through a supplier and everything was allright when I arrived there. Check-in was quick, the staff very helpful. I stayed at 18th floor, the room was very nice and clean, the bed was big, breakfast very good. I reccomend this hotel to everyone, very close to metro station - take about 30 minutes to the city centre.
Thank you, Hilton!

title: Extremely Clean + Great Views
text: The location is fantastic, really close to South Ferry. A great neighborhood with restaurants and parks. The room was amazingly clean, and I really enjoyed the layout. However, bring ear plugs, the traffic noise starts late night and lasts till early morning.

title: Top Hotel in sehr guter Lager
text: Wir haben 1 Woche in dem Hotel verbracht. Unser Hotel lag im 18. Stock. Zimmer war klein aber sauber und alles nötige war vorhanden. Lage ist wirklich top. Mit der U-Bahn kam man überall schnell hin. Gute Restaurants Bzw. Imbiss Möglichkeiten in direkter Nähe.Frühstück haben wir einmal ausprobiert. An den restlichen Tagen haben wir uns unterwegs Frühstück geholt.

title: Perfect Location with Excellent Service
text: This hotel is literally on the corner across the street from the Metro Station and the Staten Island Ferry. It's immaculately clean with an incredibly kind and friendly staff. They upgraded us to a room with a view on the top floor. It was worth every penny! I would love to stay here again next time we visit NYC.

title: Amazing location and staff
text: Right across the street from the Staten Island Ferry and down the block from battery park!  Close to several subway lines.  An ideal place to stay for a vacation to Manhattan.  Staff were very professional and helpful

title: Great Hotel
text: What a great hotel. Surprisingly quiet for Manhattan (we were on the 25th floor though) and a great location for exploring the city with pretty quick access to a number of subway stations and the Staten Island ferry and the piers with sightseeing tours. Very clean hotel and rooms and the family room we had was a fair size for the city and comfortably accommodated our family of four. However, storage in the room is limited for families but that’s the only minor fault with the room. Great facilities in the rooms like a microwave, safe, tv with good channels and a coffee machine. Our only minor issue with the hotel is the children’s breakfasts were a bit expensive for the amount most children eat. Still, that’s an option anyway and there are loads of other places to get breakfast. All in all pleasantly surprised with the hotel and will definitely stay there again if we choose a hotel over an apartment for the next time we visit.

title: Amazing Service!
text:
The service was great! Everyone was super nice and helpful. The location is great, as well. Felt safe. 

Overall, for this being our first time being in New York, we felt as if we were at home. Thank you everyone!

title: Kellemes szálloda dél-Manhattanben
text: A szálloda előnyös helyen, az üzleti negyedben van. Közelben van metró megálló, komp kikötő, a Battery Park. A személyzet kedves és figyelmes. A szoba kényelmes. Ha valaki szeret kinézni az ablakon, érdemes a "Kilátással vízre" típusú szobát választani.

title: NYC
text: Fantastic property and staff.  I love staying here while in the city for business.   The hotel is comfortable and safe.  It is the perfect location for the office and meeting friends for dinner.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Spacious and great location
text: This hotel is in the perfect location and conveniently close to multiple subway lines. The room was spacious and clean and the staff was very friendly! I could not have asked for a better stay. Overall, it was fantastic.

title: 1st experience in New York
text: The location was perfect. I wish the desk staff was more knowledgeable of the area. I would stay here again. The property does not have a pool. They do have coffee and news papers in the lobby for guest.

title: Clean, Polite and Convenient
text: This is a great hotel right near everything!! I am a native New Yorker - and wanted a clean convenient hotel for a concert at the Barkley Center - this place is Perfect!!! Battery Park is directly across the street, The Ferry to Governor's Island, South Street Seaport, The Oculus, Great Bars! I could go on and on!! Also the people at the front desk are very helpful!!! I would return in a heart beat!!

title: Nice hotel
text: Good location close to subway station. The rooms are not too big, but well organized. We had breakfast in the restaurant that has a decent selection of items and excellent omelettes prepared with a smile. Everything was clean, beds were very comfortable and the staff super nice.

title: Great option on Financial District
text: The area where the hotel is located is pretty good. All trains , groceries and restaurants near by. The hotel is it self is high quality, great, clean and quiet rooms with everything you mean need included. Great value for money.

title: wesome trip
text: Maybe 10th time at New York, but never had accomdation from this location. Peaceful location near everything. Easyto find. Stores and restaurants near by. I definately choose this hotel/location during my next trip to NY. Very nice hotel with clean rooms and great beds

title: Ótimo Custo Beneficio
text:
Pesquisei muito antes de reservar meu hotel em NY. Eu queria unir uma boa localização com um bom custo. Todas as avaliações sobre esse hotel eram positivas. Minha percepção também não foi diferente, mas com algumas ressalvas. Ficamos hospedamos por duas semanas em pleno inverno e consequentemente estávamos com muitos casacos. Senti muita falta de armários maiores para acomodar nossas roupas. O armário é muito pequeno, não tem nenhum gaveteiro e pra ajudar dentro do armário fica uma taboa é um ferro de passar roupas. Tivemos que nos virar pra conseguir acomodar todas as nossas roupas, sapatos e malas. Confesso que não foi fácil. O guarda-roupa tem menos de um metro de largura e a profundidade é mínima. O apartamento é equipado com microondas, frigobar e cofre (o que é muito útil). Tivemos um problema com o serviço de quarto quando pedimos uma pizza e inicialmente foi dito que seria entregue em 30 minutos, mas demorou mais de 1 hora.
O staff é muito bom... funcionários muito educados e simpáticos à todo momento.
Resumindo, para estadia de curto prazo, o hotel é sensacional, mas para nós que ficamos 2 semanas sentimos muita falta de local para armazenar as roupas e outros itens.

title: Excellent
text: I loved everythin during my stay.The room was tidy up every day and so much clean.Coffe machine was very usefull and tea coffe provided by the hotel.I realy enjoyed my stay thank you to all staf and management.

title: Great location and cleanliness
text: Everything else was really great! Room is modern and very clean. The view of the city and the water was awesome. Minutes walk from some of the top cocktail bars in the world. Disappointed with breakfast service.

title: Superb Hotel👌🏻
text:
Just got home from new york, had a great time. It was made so much better staying in a superb hotel. We arrived midnight and the staff were brilliant and quick getting us to our room. We stayed on the 19th floor and had a view of the very tall offices at the back, we wasnt there for a room view, thats why we went out to see the sights. The room was very clean, very big comfortable bed, very clean bathroom with big shower. There are numerous subways around the hotel, bowling green and south ferry the closest which are easy to use and buy metro cards, the bus stops for local buses and the hop on hop off outside aswell.
The room was cleaned every day of our 4 day stay and towels changed. Good selection of Neutrogena products aswell. 
We only had breakfast the 1st morning, was a bit pricey but the choice is very good, the chef even cooked me a fresh egg benedicts which was out of this world, would reccomend at least once. My wife can be fussy and had nothing but praise.
There is fresh takaway coffee, papers etc in the lobby every morning. On our checkout they stored our cases and ordered us an airport transfer as we had a later flight. 
Would go back here without doubt on another visit to new york. Definatley reccomend 10/10.

title: Very clean and efficient Hotel
text: Highly recommended very clean and efficient. No defects whatsoever. This hotel is also very quiet and we got a lot of good rest after full days of walking around New York. It is close to 2 subway stops as well as the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Highly recommended

title: Ok Hotel, modern but could be better.
text:
Hotel feels modern and clean. Location is good for the financial district.
Things that I didn't love...
The bed is comfy but the bedding (sheets, blanket) are dreadful. Feels like sleeping in a plastic bag and the blanket looks dirty (I am sure it is clean but would rather have a plain white cotton duvet).
The air conditioning is super noisy.
The blackout blind is not very effective and let's a lot of light though.
Tiny gym. Good there is one but was packed all the time.

title: Hilton Financial District
text: Great location to downtown Manhattan, right across from Battery Park.  Friendly staff, and very clean rooms, and hotel lobby. Would stay there again. Plenty of restaurants in the area that were very good.

title: Great stay!
text: The staff was very professional and friendly. We were upgraded to a room with a view which was pretty cool since this was our first trip to NYC! The room was spotless and everything worked as it should. Definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Great Hotel in Financial District
text: This is a great hotel if you have business in the Financial District. The staff is always kind and helpful and my room had a beautiful view of the river. The rooms and hotel are very very clean. I have stayed there twice in the last two months.

title: Manhattan Home
text: I love this hotel. Location, staff, and services are excellent. Walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. The location is convenient, easy to get downtown with Uber or Lyft. I have stayed here many times and am always happy!

title: The Parking
text: My stay here was all good, the rooms were nice. The view was beautiful and you can walk to the shopping strip. Here are the cons- No free breakfast and you have to park in the garage..each time you go out of the garage is a 40.00 fee. Don't ask about street parking because nobody knows anything about that. They just know about the garage.

title: Amazing Staff
text: What people say about New Yorkers is NOT true. The staff at this hotel is so friendly and accommodating. I travel for a living and have high standards for hotels because of the number of nights I spend in them. This hotel exceeds my expectations.

title: Great stay and affordable!
text: Great location, clean room, and property. Front desk staff is friendly and welcoming. I would absolutely stay here again for business and pleasure! I had a great room overlooking the river which was given as an upgrade!

title: Nice hotel, Great location
text: Nice, clean hotel in a Great location.  Didn't have much time to try the other amenities as we were busy doing NY stuff.  Staff was nice and fast check in/out.  Would stay here again.  Internet worked good.

title: My stay was awesome
text: I sometimes take time away to escape and my stay here is always amazing....the staff is great and attentive.the food selection is good , the breakfast selection is always vast and the best thing about all of this is the location...right downtown Manhattan  around a lot of interesting amenities.

title: Very nice hotel!
text: This must have been a fairly new hotel; everything was nice, new, clean.   Very happy with my stay.   The staff were very helpful and super nice.  I'd stay here again without any hesitation.  (Ok...it was cold outside but that had nothing to do with the hotel)

title: Nice hotel
text:
I have been in Hilton Garden Inn for 5 days on a business trip. I haven't stayed much in the hotel, but nights. My overall experience was good, but I had a few issues therefore I gave 4 out of 5.
What I liked:
- Bathroom is high spec
- Everything in the room is brand new / good quality
- Room size is OK (not large/not too small)
- Location is perfect for me (as I visited Brooklyn/Jersey City/Mid-town Manhattan)

What I didn't like:
- there is not enough room to store your clothes (a few suits/1 coats/shirts/etc) therefore you need to live from your suitcase
- heating system is noisy
- main entrance is not attractive at all

title: Great Rates, Great Service, Great Location
text:
NYC is busy, so finding a hotel with a great rate, quite location, and modern space was important.

Ms. Lee and Calvin at the front desk were all so professional and helpful.

Our room had ample space, very clean, updated, and on the 29th floor. The prixe paid was worth it.. We enjoyed our stay!!

Only cons... No major city view, our room faced other tall buildings. Unsure if a view of the water was available. We were not in the for more than 7 hours at a time.

 Parking is off site, $40 a day to self park, with hotel discount. The garage is walking distance,not a long walk.
 We dropped our items off at check in and walked the three two short blocks. 

Breakfast buffet about $25 a person. Continental about $17. There is a bar and restaurant on the 2nd floor. 

Many options in the area as well. Sites to see are within walking distance. Ferry to the statue of liberty is across tbe street. Minutes to the charging bull, Brooklyn Bridge, and the 9/11 memorial.

Less than 30 mins train ride to time square. Everything is in good proximity. I'd recommend the stay at this location with all the pro's.

title: Nice stay
text: We are pleased with the stay and have booked the hotel for our next visit to NY. The hotel is in good shape, the room we had is comfortable with all facilities. The staff are more then kind. We actually felt welcomed by them in the way you feel when staying at some small familyrun hotel. The hotel is close to the subway so its easy to get around. And...the room was quiet! No trafic bothering us. :-)

title: Fun times in NYC
text: We love staying at this hotel while visiting NYC. at the end of our long days we like the easy going pace of the financial district on the weekend. Trains easy to get to also. Having the new Oculus nearby opened up a lot of new options for food since some restaurants are closed in this are on weekends. Can’t say enough good things about our stay

title: Wonderful Staff, comfortable and practical
text: This is a great hotel for business and  tourism. We had a team meeting there and they made all possible to please us, during entire period, regardless of how difficult they were. Really felt welcome and supported!

title: Great staff, comfy beds
text: I loved staying at this hotel. The staff were super friendly and very welcoming. They allowed us to check out late, held keys for pickup and was just really courteous. The lobby is super chic and perfect for relaxing and taking pictures. The beds were very comfortable as well and with huge pillows. The rooms were clean and the shower head was strong. This might be one of my favorite places to stay in the city.

title: Excellent position
text: Very easy to get the subway, or take Uber/Lyft/Juno. Quite in Financing Center during evening & weekends. However, do not expect for a full river view. Another huge building blocks in front and you would see the docks on side of it.

title: Outstanding and Affordable
text: Hilton Garden Inn in the financial district was perfect! The location was fantastic, the staff showed a genuine interest in caring for their guests, the room was cozy and clean. This is one of the best Hilton experiences I have had.

title: Loved the location
text: the location was perfect. I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was set up nicely, due to extremely cold weather,I stayed in as much as possible. I will definitely be returning to this particular hotel during my next trip .

title: Nice and Clean Hotel
text: The hotel is very nice and clean. All staff were friendly. The bar tender (Matthew, I believe) was great!! Only issue we had was we placed the "do not disturb" sign on our door and the maid entered anyways.

title: Good Hotel with Great View
text:
This hotel is on the very tip of Manhattan.
Pros include great views, moderately priced, convenient to subway, Staten Island Ferry, Downtown Brooklyn, Wall Street, and all points below 14th Street. Rooms are clean, housekeeping was very good. Kurig machine, microwave, refer, and safe all in room. Bed was comfortable. Front desk staff, and kitchen staff all were nice.Area very quiet on weekends and holidays.
Cons include windy location, not convenient to anything above Union Square, coffee at breakfast was not that good, breakfast could use better ingredients, but I ate it anyway. There were 3 elevators but sometimes the linen service will take over 2 of the 3. That wasn't fun.
All in all very good. Given the choices Hilton has in Manhattan, this one was pretty nice.

title: The staff is great!!!
text: The staff is great from the front desk to the restaurant. The room is clean and modern. The location is perfect to visit some spots that are far from Times Square like Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge and 9/11 Memorial.

title: 3 day weekend trip
text: Hotel was very cozy and accommodating! Check in was fast easy and welcoming! Had a minor issue with the thermostat and they fixed it immediately with no issue! Would highly recommend this location, close to the subway and no complaints! Perfect location in the financial district!

title: Best stay ever!!
text: This was the best hotel I have ever stayed at in New York City! Excellent staff and very clean! Excellent food as well! Love being so close to everything such as the Staten Island ferry and great restaurants.

title: Einfach nur PERFEKT!
text: Sehr freundliches Personal, große saubere Zimmer. Alles sehr mordern und neu. Super Extraleistungen und geniales Frühstück! Lage ist einfach nur perfekt! Kann diese Hotel nur jedem Empfehlen! Ich komme wieder!!

title: High quality, plus great value on weekends!
text:
Spend our first NYC night (1/18/19) here and was totally pleased with all aspects.   This is one of the closest hotels to the ferry terminals and Battery Park, with lower Broadway, Wall Street, and the rest of the financial district (plus South Street Seaport) just a short walk away.   Closest subway stop (Whitehall / South Ferry) is across Water Street and around the corner.   From that stop or others a bit further away, it's roughly a 20-30 minute ride to uptown/Midtown areas of Manhattan.

It's a tall but narrow hotel wedged-in between office and residential towers, so you might or might not get a room with a decent view.    We were greeted as Gold Honors members, which also entitled us to free buffet breakfast in the hotel's Garden Grill.   Food and service were excellent;   special shout-out to Christian and chef Chris for their warm service and helpfulness.

Lots of history, restaurants and shops nearby;  this is a quality hotel that provides a great base for financial district visits.

title: Great place to stay in New York
text:
We really enjoyed this hotel. The location was great. It wasn't too far from Times Square and was nice because it wasn't as busy as there.
You could walk to 9/11 memorial from here - we even walked to SOHO from the hotel (through the Hudson River Park). Front desk was nice - helpful with directions when needed. Overall a good stay.

title: Enjoyed a pleasant stay
text: The staff was very helpful, friendly, and professional, and overall we enjoyed our stay. The coffee machine in the room was broken, but the front desk assisted with obtaining a new one. Having coffee, water, and occasionally cookies available in the lobby was also very much appreciated. The rooms are small and odd configuration - the bathroom door opens into the main part of the room, only a couple feet from the bed - but I'm used to Manhattan hotel rooms being small. There is no fan in the bathroom - that was weird and may eventually lead to mildew issues from the lack of ventilation, but I didn't see or smell any mildew during our stay. The ice machines are only every 5 floors - that fact could be communicated better and/or better signage posted near the elevator so you don't have to go on a wild goose chase to find ice. Bed was comfortable and you can't beat the location (minutes walk from the Stanton Island Ferry, Wall St., etc). Hotel staff was gracious about us parking temporarily to unload our bags.

title: Rooms are great but the breakfast is excellent
text:
The morning chef makes what ever you want for breakfast.  My favorites are the huevos rancheros and crabmeat benedict. Extra personable wait staff and manager. Can't beat the location, either.
Hotel rooms are spacious and very comfortable.

title: Fremragende opevelse, til en god pris.
text: Fremragende oplevelse til en fornuftig pris. Super fint værelse, rent, venlig personale og god beliggenhed, tæt på Wall Street og færge-terminalen til Staten Island. I forhold til hvad man ellers skal betale for hotelværelser på Manhatten, får man meget for pengene.

title: Work Stays
text: I work downtown, and sometimes need to stay late and be up early for meetings so this  hotel is perfect.  Its relatively new to the area, and is a very nice addition.  The rooms are really comfortable.  As a diamond member they always provide upgrades when able to and the breakfast is always delicious.

title: Amazing river view!!
text: I wanted a hotel close to a river, only for the river view. Hilton garden inn delivered!! Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is close to staten island ferry, bk bridge, and wall street. I will definitely come back to visit!!

title: Very comfortable
text: Very nice room, so soft bed, the only disadvantage was a fixed shower, which was not possible to take into hand and move. All other service was fine. The hotel is located in a financial district, close to Charging Bull, World Trade Center and 9/11 memorial, and Statue of Liberty as well.

title: Great hotel great location
text:
You always expect a certain level of quality in a Hilton and this hotel is no exception. Great service from friendly staff, very clean and comfortable rooms.
The location is great - right across from the staten island ferry with the 1 line subway right outside and other lines within a 5 minute walk. 
We didn't eat in the hotel - but there was an Essen round the back of the hotel which was like a supermarket/food court which was great for breakfast. 
Very happy with my stay and would recommend to anyone visiting NYC

title: Отличный вариант в Downtown
text: Удачное расположение. Все необходимое рядом: метро, автобусные остановки, паром, магазины. 5 минут до ВТЦ.Хорошие сытные завтраки, однако, однообразные.Следует быть готовым при заезде оставить депозит 300$,который должны вернуть на карту при выезде.

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Bonne situation, à proximité de la station de métro South Ferry.
Café dans la chambre et à la réception. Micro-ondes dans la chambre. Personnel très sympathique. Bon rapport qualité / prix. A recommander.

title: Nice Room and great location
text: Very good location.  Close to several subway lines so easy to get everywhere and lots of restaurants and bars nearby. The room was clean and comfortable.  Free coffee in the lobby every morning which was appreciated.

title: Conforto acima de tudo
text: do check in na recepção ao check out a equipe desse hotel foi sensacional, O quarto desse hotel era extremamente confortável e limpo por se tratar de um hotel novo, a cama era algo positivo do hotel e o principal sua localização em frente a uma estação de metro o que me faz pensar que mesmo que esse hotel esteja na primeira rua da ilha e afastado dos pontos turisticos vale muito a pena o custo beneficio da qualidade e conforto oferecido sendo que você pode se hospedar longe e fazendo tudo de metro.

title: Wonderful staff, clean rooms, spacious for Manhattan hotels.
text: The location was perfect.  Cobblestone streets nearby with wonderful pubs and plenty of places to eat.  Lots of tourist areas nearby including the 911 Memorial.  Easy to get from one place to the next either by walking or car.

title: Excelente estadía en Wall Street
text: La ubicación del hotel es muy buena, cercana a varias estaciones del metro y cerca del One World. El hotel está en excelentes condiciones de mantenimiento, ofrecen máquina de café en la habitación y además ofrecen café en el Lobby. La limpieza es muy buena y los productos de aseo que brindan. La atención de personal es muy buena tambien. La temperatura de la habitación se puede regular a gusto y funciona a la perfección. Uno de los mejores hoteles en los que me he hospedado. Muy recomendable

title: Quiet and great location
text: Had a room on the 19th floor with a fantastic view of the Hudson. Spacious for NYC although a bit short on storage space. Bed was super comfortable and exterior noises were of an acceptable level. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Will definitely stay again.

title: Great location in south Manhattan
text: Very nice hotel in the Financial District. Convenient to Battery Park and tours to Statue of Liberty. Lots of good restaurants in area and easy access to multiple subway lines. Rooms are very clean and bedding comfortable. Staff was pleasant. Would stay there again.

title: Great Location
text: Just one block from the 1, R, and W trains.  Convenient to uptown and Brooklyn.  Five minute walk to the Staten Island and Liberty Island/Ellis Island ferries.  10 minute walk to Wall Street.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Fantastic place to stay!!
text: Had a fantastic stay here over New Year 2018. The staff are really helpful and friendly and the front desk is staffed 24 hours. The rooms were extremely clean and well equipped. The hotel is located right near the Staten Island Ferry and there are many subways stations, within walking distance, with access to the 1,4,5, R and W lines. Overall a lovely place to stay in a quieter part of Manhattan!

title: New Years Eve
text: I was impressed with the room and the service I received placed was very well organized. Had such a very good water view and very quite I would definitely recommend it to those who visiting New York ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Walking distance to Battery Park
text: A very comfortable venue, in direct neighborhood of Battery Park. Excellent service. Breakfast - best in the US we have found so far. Friendly staff, full set of amenities, quiet rooms, speedy wifi. What else shall we expect from a one-night stay?

title: Wonderful
text: Excellent experience .Great room, very large. Perfect bed. Bathroom with gratuities. The view was amazing on Hudson river .Restaurant is great and services too. The employees were kindness and very helpfull. Very very good experience

title: Posizione perfetta ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: Check in veloce, personale sempre disponibile, vicinanza di tre fermate della metro, fermata autobus quasi di fronte all’hotel, a due passi dal traghetto per le statua della libertà. Pulito, camere comode ed ampie per gli standard di NYC.

title: Super Hotel in Downtonwn Manhattan
text: Das Hotel liegt direkt an der Staten Island Fähre, von hier kommt man sehr schnell überall hin. Das Zimmer war sehr sauber, geräumig und total ruhig, das Bad mit einer schönen großen Dusche ausgestattet. Sehr netter Personal, ich würde jederzeit wiederkommen.

title: Great location
text: Absolutely loved the location of this hotel. Rooms were clean,  fresh towels everyday.  The sub way and ferry is right across the street.  Everyone at the hotel was very nice and accommodating.  Also loved the cafe Rockwell's at the corner.

title: Spacious, clean, easy access to transit, and a nice view.
text: The reviews are well justified.  The hotel is clean, rooms are quiet (for NY standards).  I really liked being away from the craziness of times sq, madison sq gardens, etc., but being a subway ride away.  We took an uber ride in, but could've used transit from LGA.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: Cannot fault this hotel at all! Great location for the Staten Island ferry, Subway (3 minute walk away), Statue of Liberty, 9/11 memorial and 1 WTC. Rooms are very spacious for New York, modern and clean. However, what really makes this hotel is the staff. Everyone who we met (front desk, restaurant and housekeepers) were all extremely friendly and made us very welcome. The breakfast staff are a credit to the hotel, and went over and above to provide an excellent level of service every day by giving recommendations of local places to visit. Would recommend this hotel to anyone if you are visiting Manhattan. It is nice to be out of the business of Times Square, but it is only a short hop away on the Subway. Also, lots of bars and good restaurants nearby.

title: Never again!
text: We were very disappointed by the service, attitude of most of the staff and the condition of the hotel.  We heard other patrons complain about the restaurant breakfasts. I would not recommend this to anybody.

title: Happy memories
text: I booked a 3 night stay at  this hotel at  the end of our 6 week yearly adventure across  the states before flying home to the UK because it was handy to the 9/11 memorial by subway -----the staff at the hotel were just WONDERFUL each member of staff made our stay Abdel the manager ,Ann who signed us in Rachel & Mathew who were in the restaurant & the young man who I will call "North Devon " he will know I'm praising him too as of all things he spent 2 years in the area we live in --talk about a small world SO I highly recommend a stay here is a must if you want terrific service it made up for the awful night we stayed in a Hilton near the Newark airport .

title: Excellent and helpful staff
text: Excellent, friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was yummy but a bit pricey.  Hotel was very convenient to a subway station.  Clean, quiet and comfortable room.  Would definitely stay here again.  Already planning our next trip.

title: Will definitely stay here again!
text: I was worried about staying in the financial district but this hotel is located in a great location with easy access to the subway. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.

title: Very Nice Hotel!
text: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial Center/Manhattan Downtown the weekend before Christmas. I love this area of Manhattan because it is not super crowded. It is a quick was to subway. Less than 10 minutes to The World Trade Center. Hotel is very nice, very clean, very quiet for NYC standards. Staff is very nice.

title: Excellent well equipped room
text: Very helpful staff and great value for money. Location was perfect for what we wanted but if you don’t want to walk or travel far then may be more suited to the Times Square branch. Room was well equipped and had everything we needed. My partner particularly liked the coffee machine to make his morning coffee. When speaking to the staff they were very helpful and able to satisfy our requests. The on site restaurant cooked us a lovely meal and there is also an on site shop in case you fancy a snack or drink.

title: Hilton Garden Inn - Financial District
text: This was my 2nd stay and I will continue to choose this hotel when visiting NYC. The hotel is clean, in a quiet area, easy access to the subway, and the staff is superb!!! Rooms are small but perfect for us! I highly recommend this hotel.

title: A Day of Inspiration!
text: Everyone treated me well especially, Teddy, Ricaurte and Ann in the hotel restaurant. They knew that I needed to eat and they weren’t open for dinner but they made sure I ate before going to an event at Carnegie Hall.

title: Great
text: Perfect hotel, great location, staff really friendly and helpful. You couldn’t do better for a weekend in NYC. Could do with the bar being open til 12 rather than 11 but that’s a minor detail. Food in the bar was great too!

title: Burthday Celebration
text: Nice hotel if you wanna be away from the hustle & bustle of downtown NYC. Rooms are small but clean. Walls are thin. Food is good & everyone is friendly.  Steps away from Wall Street & Staten Island Ferry.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Made to feel welcome from check in to leaving. Staff were so friendly.  Stayed on the 12th floor overlooking the ferry terminal. Room spotless and beds were really comfy. Breakfast was really good lots of choice and again chefs and waiters friendly. All in all a good hotel would definitely consider staying again. Thank you Hilton.

title: 5 Nights in NYC
text: My wife and I chose this hotel for our first stay in NYC because of the price and the positive reviews of others.  We were not disappointed with our choice.  We were greeted with friendly staff who were always willing to help us with any request, and the room was perfect -- quiet, very clean and with a bit of a view over the water. This location in the Financial District is quiet and right across the street from a subway terminal that can have you anywhere in upper Manhattan you may want to go in 20-ish minutes or less.  This hotel is also right across the street from the South Ferry (think free views of the statue of liberty) and near good breakfast and Financial District restaurant options.  My guidance to anyone wanting to visit NYC is to forget paying $250+ to stay in mid-to-upper Manhattan and stay at this hotel in the Financial District and take the subway (We purchased the 5 day unlimited pass.).  Save your money for experiencing NYC because, as nice as this hotel is, you're not going to be spending the majority of your time in the room.

title: Modern hotel near the WTC
text:
This is a good hotel, close to many lower Manhattan sites, like the World Trade Center, Trinity Church, Staten Island Ferry, Century 21 store,  Battery Park, Native Indian museum, and Holocaust Museum.    Check in with Lee was very welcoming.
The hotel is modern with speedy elevators to all 29 floors.  There is a restaurant on the second floor, but the food is kind of expensive.  Didn't bother with it as there are a few other food options nearby.  There are many subway line options just nearby, and it's a quick trip (20 minutes) up to Times Square.  This is good, because the hotel is less expensive than Times Square hotels. There was a group of us in several rooms, but sorting out final bills was a bit of a hassle. 
Rooms are modern, but very compact,  There is just enough room for what you need in a hotel room, although there was not a closet in my room, just a tiny wardrobe with room for one person's clothes.  Good luck finding a place to put your suitcase.  Had some trouble getting the room temperature to be comfortable.   Bathroom was ample size, but shower water temperature would vary from warm to cooler.  Rooms come with microwave, safe, and fridge.  This room was an '07' room.   I would go back again, although I prefer being in midtown.

title: Great service
text: Great hotel. Close to trains. And in a great location.  Staff was friendly and attentive.  The room was clean, spacious, comfortable, and really nice. The lobby was nice and clean. The hotel all together was very nice.  Def worth the money which wasnt bad at all compared to others in the area.

title: Angenehmes Hotel in guter Lage
text: Das saubere und modern eingerichtete Stadthotel liegt im Süden Manhattens, direkt gegenüber den Fähren nach Staten Island. Dort befinden sich auch die wichtigsten Verbindungen der Subway. Ein Blick auf die Freiheitsstatue, das One World Trade Center, die Wall Street und der Battery Park sind jeweils in wenigen Gehminuten erreichbar. Wir fanden die Lage ideal, da es Abends doch ruhiger als im unmittelbaren Zentrum aber gleichwohl in kurzer Zeit per U-Bahn zu erreichen war. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich, hilfsbereit und kompetent. Die Zimmer sind modern eingerichtet und reichen für einen Städtetrip völlig aus. Der Room-Service ist hervorragend. Wir fanden auch das Frühstück sehr lecker. Einkaufsmöglichkeiten, Bars und Restaurants sind in unmittelbarer Nähe. Als Tipp: auch gegenüber im Fährbahnhof kann man für eher kleine Dollars eine Pizza oder Burger erwerben. Wir werden sicherlich noch einmal nach New York reisen und dann erneut Gast in diesem Hotel sein.

title: Fun Christmas Time Weekend in NYC
text: Great hotel!! We strongly recommend, especially if you are on a budget. A short walk to the subway and in less then 30 min you are in the middle of Manhattan. We had a great time and plan to stay again.

title: Good
text: Very good staff.  Room was very basic,  but clean.  Very close to the 911 museum and Statue of Liberty cruise port.  About a 20 min subway ride to Times Square.  Would stay here again if back in the area soon.

title: Friendly, attentive staff.  Great location for FiDi.
text: I have stayed at this property quite a bit over the past 2 years.  The staff is consistently friendly and attentive.  I always feel welcome.  Clean rooms.  Quiet (for New York). Any requests are taken care of quickly.

title: Stay at HGI Downtown
text: The room was quite spacious and well lit with both natural and electric lights. Location is awesome for both business and tourist visits. Easily accessible to the metro station just 3mins walk away and walking distance to most business offices.

title: Bright and Beautiful
text: This was a very clean and modern hotel , with all the amenities one would expect from a Hilton hotel . We would recommend this hotel to other travelers for its overall quality and price . You get much more than you would expect from such an inexpensive hotel

title: Perfect location for my Mom's first trip to NYC
text: She wanted to do all the notable attractions, Liberty, Ellis, 9/11 and a few others uptown of course, but this location allowed for easy walking to some and accessible transportation to others. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful, not what my mom expected for NYC!

title: Recent Stay at Hilton Garden Inn in NYC Financial Center
text: We spent 1st weekend of December here. Hotel itself is just fine, not over the top but not leaving us wanting for anything either. It even has a bar but we didn't avail ourselves to it. The main reason I selected this hotel (other than getting Hilton points) was its proximity to Battery Park. We booked the first ferry out to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island and the fact that the hotel was a 5 minute walk allowed a leisurely Saturday morning. Also, access to NYC subways is dramatically simplified by the fact that most lines (4/5 and 1/2/3) begin & end or pass thru the Battery. I took advantage of the valet parking service offered at the hotel ($100 for 48hrs) and we had really nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant. If your looking for a nice NYC pub, try the Whitehorse Tavern just a block or so away.

title: Work
text: The Hotel was in a great location with a great view of the harbor, the front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful, the lobby was very nice and clean.  The most important thing to me was the elevators were fast and always available.

title: Amazing Hotel Service and Location
text: The hotel is well maintained. Every staff member I encountered greeted me with a smile and amazing service. Our room had a beautiful view of the water, and we could easily walk to dining and sight seeing areas around the financial district. I highly recommend this hotel to NYC travelers. It's easy to find and access once inside the city. And the valet was extremely accommodating.

title: Pessima esperienza
text: In stanza tutto che non funziona. Lampadina rotta, macchina del caffè rotta, perdita in bagno che si allaga durante la notte e, dulcis in fundo, alle 3 di mattina la macchina del ghiaccio posizionata proprio fuori dalla stanza, inizia a riformare la riserva di ghiaccio con un rumore infernale che dura oltre 15 minuti. Per 300 dollari a notte pretendo di meglio.

title: First in NYC
text:
This was my first ever trip to New York and I was really worried about which area to stay in but this Hotel met all our needs. We traveled from Newark Airport with the NJ Train and then metro, I would say it took in total about 1 hour. We arrived at South Ferry Station, which is a 2 min walk to the Hotel. We were allowed to check in at 1pm as our room was ready. Staff were always friendly, greeting you on the way in and out of the hotel. On our last day, they kept our luggage for us after check out as we had an evening flight.

The room was quite large in comparison to what I expected. King size bed with city view, mini fridge, microwave, safe, cupboard with iron and ironing board, good size tv, coffee machine with coffee/tea supplies, massive pillows, neutrogena toiletries and clean white towels, plenty of space for our luggage and we forgot to bring an adaptor plug, but didnt need it as the room had usb points for our chargers. The room exceeded basic needs. 

The location was great, we walked to the Statue of Liberty ticket desks and were across the road from the Staten Island Ferry, we did not eat at the Hotel, as it was cheaper to eat outside. It was very easy to reach many attractions via metro, we brought the 7 day metro card and caught the train from South Ferry Station every time. 

Overall the location, size of the room and facilities available are brilliant for the price you pay, you get more than what you pay for.

title: Fantastically quiet!
text: We checked in on Black Friday and were greeted by Bianca who had been working a 12 hour shift.  She was professional, friendly and quite funny. Our check-in process was very smooth and quick.  Our room was on the 26th floor with a water-view.  The rooms are quite large for NYC standards.  We had a great view of the Staten Island Ferry terminal and the rising sun.  Christian, our waiter in the dining room at breakfast, was very pleasant and attentive.  He made sure our coffee and tea remained topped off.  On the weekends this area is not busy at all.  We were able to move around the area easily and were within close walking distance to subway access and the Native American Indian museum.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Most helpful and friendly staff ever!
text: Great location with dozens of restaurants in the area.  Very accommodating for business travelers.  Rooms were quiet, comfortable and the heat controls worked quickly.  I'd definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing staff!
text: The front desk staff was amazing! Bianca was an angel & very accommodating! The entire staff & bell attendant helped with luggage in the cold weather. Perfect location for visiting the financial district, 9/11 & Statue of Liberty. Very clean hotel!

title: Nice stay at Hilton Garden Inn
text: Nice hotel, friendly staff, clean and renovated room, close to the subway. Pricy breakfast, you can get something cheaper around the corner. Had a partial view of the water nice to wake up to. Keurig coffee machine in the room.

title: Perfect Location
text: Perfect location, subway stations, duane read store, Starbucks, restaurants nearby.South ferry just a block awayClean rooms, good internet connection, Beautiful lobby, friendly staff,Would Highly recommend this property

title: Business trip to NY
text: All was pretty fine regarding accommodation. Reasonable price for hotel on Manhattan. Close distance to subway and interesting tourist places.We did not take a breakfast as there is plenty opportunities to have a breakfast around for lower price.

title: Gem inNYC
text: Great hotel, tucked away in the Financial District. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Even though thisroom was near the elevators, it was a pretty quiet stay. Will definitely keep this property in mind during my next visit.

title: Thanksgiving in NYC
text:
My friend and I were here for the Macy's Parade/Thanksgiving weekend.
The staff here were incredible!!! Shout out to Bianca, Lee, Nsiki, Nikko (front desk) and Matthew (bar tender).
They were beyond helpful, friendly and always had a smile.
The room was clean and cozy. 
Hotel is close to subways, walking distance to World Trade Center and 911 Memorial and ferry to the Statue of Liberty.
Lots of pubs and restaurants near by.

title: Genuine friendliness
text: Convenient to the hub of downtown financial center, within walking distance of "tourist sites". Across from historical Fraunces Tavern, near ferry to Statue of Liberty, and not far from South Street Seaport. --From the front desk to any individual employee at the hotel, there was a warm genuine greeting. Breakfast is "real"--not a few bagels, juice and coffee.

title: Great location. Good price. Nice folks.
text: Room was nice. Hotel was easy to see as it's a different color from other buildings if you don't know where your going. Staff was great. Could have used wait help in bar on night of arrival.  1 bartender also ran 8 tables. Has a nice pull in area for valet parking since no parking garage. Did get charged 10.00 a day more than posted on site for parking (50.00 a day instead of 40.00). Right across the street from subway and the Staten Island Ferry. Times square was a 20 min subway ride. Could walk to 9/11 memorial and wall street. Loved the hotel overall. Would have been better to have a quick breakfast provided in morning for price of hotel. Room was smaller than midwest hotels but nice size for NYC hotels.

title: Beautiful views and friendly helpful staff, my sister and stayed at this hotel while visiting NYC it was excellent
text: My sister and I stayed at this hotel while visiting new York and the stay was excellent, the room was clean ,the bed was comfortable and the location was great, overall I would stay here again and recommend.

title: Weekend trip
text: Stayed one night rooms were nice not the best but good for the price you pay. I recommend staying there it’s a good location for New York access to a lot of restaurants and pubs quick access to subway

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Nice room, great location and very quiet place. It is located just across the street from subway. Lots of good restaurants near, especially on Stone St.  Easy to walk to Wall St. and Battery Park. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Top notch service
text:
Upon arrival, guest hostess Bianca was a pleasure to work with and welcomed us to the city. She was able to accommodate us out of towners giving us the most pleasant experience of New York we have received. She even went out of her way to make my 11 yr old daughter welcome. 
The next morning after a great nights sleep, we got to meet Christian at breakfast. A pleasant smile and friendly attitude made the breakfast wonderful. He even accommodated my need for lots of beverage and took time to chat with us about our trip. 
Overall, it was not only the best hotel experience we’ve ever had in the state of NY, but perhaps ever. Will definitely recommend to others and return if I can get the courage to drive in NY again!

title: Great location and view but small rooms!
text: It is right in Downtown, near 2 subway stations. 1 minuets walking distance to Staten Island ferry  The view is great but the rooms are small (expected in NYC). Would recommend to solo travelers than family

title: Excellent service, great location!
text: I was working in Lower Manhattan for about 6 months, and I stayed at this location.  The service was great, all the tourist attractions are close by, plenty of restaurants, and I felt safe.  I had a great time!

title: Very Good for the Price
text: Very good hotel for the price! Room with Coffe machine, spacious for NYC standards, new and well maintained! Very good location in downtown and super close to the subway station! Some rooms have great water views to East River. Friendly staff!

title: Hidden gem!
text: Everything about our recent stay at this hotel was awesome.  The location was perfect for exploring this area of Manhattan, the staff were so helpful, the room was comfortable with a view of the river and the food in the restaurant was outstanding. Highly recommended!

title: Anniversary visit to NYC
text: The room was small, but it is to be expected in NYC.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The location was right next to several subway stations and the Staten Island ferry.  There are a lot of restaurants right in the area and the hotel is within walking distance of Wall Street.  A good value in NYC.

title: Grat place and Location
text: Rachael made the stay even better as the bartender. Fun and knows what she is doing. Went to the bar to watch a football game, and between the drinks and food, it was definitely a memorable stay. I highly recommend Hilton Garden for a clean and nice place to stay

title: I love this hotel it's my New home away from home.
text: I visited this hotel this past weekend.  Let me tell ya, the manager Eric , his front desk staff, food concourse staff, the cook Christopher, house keeping staff , bell men all were AMAZING. I will say they have the best HOSPITALITY in all of NYC. They are friendly and helpful all around the board. The hotel nice quiet and cozy, clean, and  views are great. Directly across the street from Staten island ferry  close to subway transportation and fine dining.  The hotel itself has some of the best breakfast with Christopher whipping up omlets and oreo pancakes and a lot of charm, you will feel as if you are right at home and part of the family. And the young man who runs th food concourse was quite the gentleman and made me feel quite welcome to come on in and enjoy my dining at the Hilton.  Everyone reading this post when I say I love this hotel , I promise you I'm only stating here from now on when I visit Nyc from now on. I truly enjoyed my time from check in to check out . My experience was great. Thank you all for the AMAZING time .

title: Nice Location.  Clean.  Efficient Staff!
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn NYC Financial District.  Smithsonian Museum of the American Indian was fantastic and right next door.  Paying a bit extra for the view of the East River and New York Harbor was worth it.  Little touches like iced citrus water, free coffee and tea, fresh baked cookies in the lobby gave this BIG hotel a friendly, homey touch.  Our room was quiet, comfortable and immaculate.  Great restaruants closer than you might think.

title: Bra och trevligt hotell
text: Är överlag nöjd med hotellet. Bra service, resturang, träningsmöjlighet och hotellrum. Ligger visserligen inte mitt på Manhattan, men det gör inget då det inte tar lång tid att åka med tunnelbana. Ligger dock bra till för vissa sevärdheter. T.ex. frihetsgudinnan, ground zero, Brooklyn. Frukost ingick inte, vilket inte gjorde så mycket för vår del. Hittade ställen runt om där vi åt.

title: Small rooms and under staffed
text: The hotel was nice but the rooms, halls etc are all super small.  Like living in a camper at $500 a night.  The breakfast was $25 which in NYC is ok, but they had only one server for a lot of tables.  One morning 75% of the tables were dirty so there was only one table left for us....a table for 6, we were 2.  It was common to not get any service until you were half done eating and then you only got it by spending 20 minutes trying to get the attention of the one waiter.

title: Great location, helpful staff
text: I stayed just one night for a business meeting. Staff was very helpful and recommended nearby places for dinner. Hotel was clean and spacious (for NYC) with nice views. An easy walk to the Staten Island Ferry and Wall Street.

title: Best staff!
text: Just stayed her for 5 days.  What a great hotel.   Beautiful clean rooms,  friendly and helpful staff,  great food and dessert in the restaurant.   We will be back.   This hotel is also super convenient to the Staten Island Ferry, subway, Stone St, Leo's bagels and so much more in a short walking distance. Oh and the beds...beat our Tempurpedic a hundred hands down.

title: Great place. Superb staff
text: Very happy with our stay here. Polite and helpful staff. Clean and tidy rooms. Beds could be bigger. But for what we paid- we were very happy. Decent location for heading into Brooklyn or for drinking around the financial district which I would highly recommend. Lots of cool bars and cafes!

title: Ferocious bed bugs w/ no response from Hilton
text: I've stayed at this property many times without issue.  Honors member.  Good location, nice rooms.  Many folks in our office stay here when in town.I was horribly bitten up by bed bugs.  It's a week later and I am still miserable covered in painful welts, 24 of them!It took me a day to realize what had happened and called my hilton honors number.   Lots of jockeying around, got someone live I explained to, no apology whatsoever just told to please hold.  I listened to music for a while and then call was just dropped.  I then used their online form to lodge the complaint.   I got an email response confirming my feedback indicating the local hotel would contact me live in 2 days.   No one ever contacted me.I've been a pretty loyal Hilton traveler but after having my first problem and seeing how it was handled I am really going to think twice before booking one again.

title: HGI Financial Center-Perfect!
text: I was in NYC recently for business and stayed at this location. It was perfect! The location is ideal as it offered a great view of the harbor as well as easy access to several subway lines and the Staten Island Ferry. The hotel is fairly new, and everything was spotless. The best part of my stay was the staff- from the breakfast servers to the front desk I was very pleased with the level of service and friendliness I observed. I will definitely stay here again...thanks HGI!

title: NY Marathon
text: This is the perfect location for access to the Staten Island ferry. The room was overpriced for what you get. The hotel restaurant was expensive. But it is close to other eating spots. The location was perfect for the ferry and the subway.

title: Small but big time service
text: This is what you expect in a limited space, but everything is modern and fresh looking and the staff was the kindest of any stay I have ever had in NY! Great local food all around and was able to walk everywhere needed.

title: Nice location
text:
Stayed one night pre-cruise. Arrived early room not ready not a big deal- checked luggage and went about our day. 
Arrived at 3PM for check in- the area was total chaos- the Front Desk workers stated this never happens.
There were no lines and people were coming from every direction no order or line was ever instituted. Some in front of us rooms were still not ready at 3PM.
We check in and got our room amazing view! Elevators are small and slow to arrive.
Great staff that we encountered and great location!

title: Nice Location and Modern
text: I really enjoyed the amenities, as in the coffee in lobby and in the room.  The convenience to transportation is wonderful and the staff was helpful, and nice to work with - they made check in and check out easy.

title: Great location in sight of the Staten Island Ferry
text:
The perfect place for an early morning trip over to Liberty Island on the boat which was just a short walk away. Great welcome from desk staff after a long days flying. Comfy room and bed. Nice bathroom. 
We did have a problem with the heater and called the engineer a couple of times, but it still blew out cool air. So we figured that was just the way of the heating system. We coped. Helpfully they kept our bags for our last day in the city until we left late afternoon.

title: Bel hôtel bien situé !
text: Bel hôtel bien situé ! En plein coeur du financial distric juste en face du ferry de Staten Island. À deux pas d'une bouche de métro. Tout près aussi du One World Trade Center. Tous les Tours Bus sont à côté! Un peu cher mais c'est New York !

title: Perfect location
text: The room was everything that we expected from a Hilton Garden Inn. The location just across from the ferry was great and the proximity to the Statue of liberty ferry was perfect. We were close enough to walk to 911 memorial, Battery Park & Wall Street. Plus Subway was just around the corner. Thank you.

title: Super venue in lower Manhattan
text: Ultra-clean and comfortable, walking distance to scads of restaurants and the East River.  Close to subway stations.  Friendly staff and very efficient check-in, check-out.  So nice to have refrigerator and microwave in room.

title: A great hotel!
text: I stayed here for 5 nights on business.  It is a lovely modern hotel with a friendly, helpful staff.  The hotel is in a very convenient location in the Financial District - numerous subways stations, the waterfront, the World Trade Center buildings and memorial, and lots of excellent restaurants around Stone Street are just a quick walk away.  We easily got our bearings the first day and found this area safe, walk-able, and fun to spend time in.  The hotel does offer breakfast in their restaurant for $20 or so, and have a small happy hour menu before they serve dinner in the evening.  The views from the rooms are great, as well.  I look forward to returning to this hotel and this neighborhood!

title: Great stay at Hilton Financial District
text: We were staying at the Hilton with some other wedding guests, and it was our first time in New York. We really enjoyed our stay here. Very clean bathroom, extremely comfortable bed and pillows. Its really close to a lot of attractions and the South Ferry Station is right outside. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: Christopher we loved your shakshuka and smilling face :) Argon and Christian thanks for your kindness and warm welcome
text:
מלון שנמצא ממש על באטרי פארק עם מלא תחנות מטרו מכל הסוגים , מרחק 15 דק הליכה לגשר ברוקלין ו10 לאנדרטת 9/11. 
החדר טיפה קטן הארון עושה רעש בסגירה ופתיחה בגלל מגנטים, אבל מעבר לזה אחלה!
מנקים כל יום, יש מיקרו מקרר וטלויזיה, מכונת קפה ועריסה לתינוק, אמצעים לגיהוץ בחדר למי שצריך.
חדר האוכל בבוקר מתוקתק אני לא ראיתי כזה דבר. 3 אנשי צוות שזכורים לי במיוחד לטובה כריסטופר השף - מלך , כל בוקר מתקבל אצלו עם חיוך , בכלל גם ארגון וכריסטיאן שמפנים ומגישים את האוכל פשוט מדהימים.
הם עובדים קשה אבל לא תראו עליהם בכלל, הכל עם חיוך.
בארוחת בוקר יש ביצים איך שתבחרו יש גם בשר אנחנו לא לקחנו , יש פנקייקים וופל מאפים לחם בייגך תפוזים אשכוליות קפה תה פירות, מידי פעם היו גם אוכמניות אבל רוב הזמן אננס תותים ומלון, יש יוגורט דגנים גרנולה וכולי. אין ירקות.. אבל זה ככה באמריקה.
אין שיש באמבטיה יש רק כיור, אז אין כל כך מקום להניח דברים.
עוד משהו מוזר שרווח במלונות במנהטן אין מברשת בשירותים.. שירות חדרים עד 3 אז אם תרצו שינקו את החדר זה לא יכול לקרות בערב.
יש מספיק מעליות לא מרגישים בכלל שיש 30 קומות בבניין והינו בזמן יחסית עמוס.
נחזור שוב כמובן
שימו לב שבערב העסקים מסביב מלבד הפאבים נסגרים בסביבות 8 אז אם תכננתם לקנות אוכל לא במשלוח תתארגנו לזה
יש סטארבקס מתחת למלון מימין כשיוצאים ודנקן דונטס די קרוב

title: bon rapport qualité/prix
text: Bien situé avec tous les services nécessaires. Très bon service. Chambres un peu petites mais confortables et pratiques.Proches de plusieurs sites d'intérêts/touristiques ainsi que du métro, vélos, ferry, tours guidés
